story:
Short Summary


  • Hello! My name is Sara and I am italian. I live in Rome and, as you may imagine, I am surrounded by art in all its form of expression. I see myself as an art addicted, I literally adore artists, no matter if they are painters or dancers: when I see passion in someone's performance, I feel good and blessed. Photography allows me to share how I feel about it. I started 8 years ago by shooting my hero, Olympic Champion Evgeni Plushenko and now I want to share with you the neverseen pics of him during this time. I shooted many moments with a basic camera, not a pro one. And I loved it. 
  • I am raising funds because I want this photography passion to become a real job. Unfortunately in my country is not easy to work in art, people are used to think that making pictures is like an hobby, so you don't deserve any reward for it. I think differently and I really want to improve my skills and my equipment so I can start rockin this wonderful world. My goal is to spread my vision of people I admire to the world. 
  • I really need contributions to buy my new equipment and to publish my book, it would be amazing for me, since finding a job you love is something very difficult nowadays. But life is all about finding our way, isn't it? Your help could free myself and make it possible to pursue my dream.


I Perk my Pics! :D

  • With the funds I raise I will buy a basic equipment which is composed of the Canon 1DX Camera and 2 lenses, one for figure skating and concerts, a 70-200 lens, 2.8 L series which allows to capture moving subjects (since I picture athletes mostly). And to realize my book with the pics I already have too.
  • My SUPER PERKS! :) My pictures obviously! At the moment I add some of my already taken shots of Olympic champions in Figure skating like Carolina Kostner, Adelina Sotnikova and Evgeni Plushenko and some performing artists such as Leona Lewis and 2 Cellos. I have a smiling Alessandro Del Piero too! Taken with a noble canon 550d. Honor to my friendly camera! 
  • Here there is one of the PERKS you'll get:
  • Snowy Rome


  • Evgeni Plushenko Champions on Ice jpg. image


Books of Neverseen Before Shots

  • Have you ever thought about what artists do while practicing? While they are not under the spotlight? They are extraordinary people, they create art anytime so... I want to capture unseen moment of their lives and share it to the world.
  • In 8 years of shooting, I gained many positive feedbacks from colleagues much more equipped and experienced than I am ... And from my subjects of course! This is awesome! And of course it made me realize that yes! I can make it!
  • My first project is a book about a super famous Olympic Champ Evgeni Victorevic Plushenko, stay tuned!

Risks & Challenges

  • Being a Freelance is a risk. I could not be able to reach the events for any kind of reason like... missing trains or no press passes!
  • In many years, btw, nothing stopped me from getting my pics and from entering the events I wanted to shoot! I can prove it! :)

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Let's share my campaign! Any kind of help is needed and appreciated so, if you cannot contribute just make my DREAM to be seen all over the world!
  • DON'T FORGET to share this campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools!

THANK YOU ALL VERY MUCH!
story_txt:
Short Summary   Hello! My name is Sara and I am italian. I live in Rome and, as you may imagine, I am surrounded by art in all its form of expression. I see myself as an art addicted, I literally adore artists, no matter if they are painters or dancers: when I see passion in someone's performance, I feel good and blessed. Photography allows me to share how I feel about it. I started 8 years ago by shooting my hero, Olympic Champion Evgeni Plushenko and now I want to share with you the neverseen pics of him during this time. I shooted many moments with a basic camera, not a pro one. And I loved it. 
 I am raising funds because I want this photography passion to become a real job. Unfortunately in my country is not easy to work in art, people are used to think that making pictures is like an hobby, so you don't deserve any reward for it. I think differently and I really want to improve my skills and my equipment so I can start rockin this wonderful world. My goal is to spread my vision of people I admire to the world. 
I really need contributions to buy my new equipment and to publish my book, it would be amazing for me, since finding a job you love is something very difficult nowadays. But life is all about finding our way, isn't it? Your help could free myself and make it possible to pursue my dream.     I Perk my Pics! :D
 With the funds I raise I will buy a basic equipment which is composed of the Canon 1DX Camera and 2 lenses, one for figure skating and concerts, a 70-200 lens, 2.8 L series which allows to capture moving subjects (since I picture athletes mostly). And to realize my book with the pics I already have too.
My SUPER PERKS! :) My pictures obviously! At the moment I add some of my already taken shots of Olympic champions in Figure skating like Carolina Kostner, Adelina Sotnikova and Evgeni Plushenko and some performing artists such as Leona Lewis and 2 Cellos. I have a smiling Alessandro Del Piero too! Taken with a noble canon 550d. Honor to my friendly camera! 
Here there is one of the PERKS you'll get:
Snowy Rome






Evgeni Plushenko Champions on Ice jpg. image



    Books of Neverseen Before Shots  Have you ever thought about what artists do while practicing? While they are not under the spotlight? They are extraordinary people, they create art anytime so... I want to capture unseen moment of their lives and share it to the world. In 8 years of shooting, I gained many positive feedbacks from colleagues much more equipped and experienced than I am ... And from my subjects of course! This is awesome! And of course it made me realize that yes! I can make it! My first project is a book about a super famous Olympic Champ Evgeni Victorevic Plushenko, stay tuned!    Risks & Challenges  Being a Freelance is a risk. I could not be able to reach the events for any kind of reason like... missing trains or no press passes! In many years, btw, nothing stopped me from getting my pics and from entering the events I wanted to shoot! I can prove it! :)    Other Ways You Can Help  Let's share my campaign! Any kind of help is needed and appreciated so, if you cannot contribute just make my DREAM to be seen all over the world! DON'T FORGET to share this campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools!   THANK YOU ALL VERY MUCH!

story:
If mankind need armies cost what it may, than be the  armies of empowered artists, fighting to open portals of beauty, wonder and awe!

Quick preview of "what I want and what you get"

     I am here not for easy gaining, but to earn your trust with hard, passioned work!
     Art is my therapy, my deliverance and also the main way to sustain my family. The goal of this campaign is to raise funds for the digital art tool of my dreams: Wacom Cintiq 27QHD, via  PERKS I created (scroll down for more detailed illustrative examples):


  • Personalized HAND-PAINTED ARTWORKS on Wood
  • Hand-made ORNAMENTS, some with desk support
  • Family CREST and illustrations  printed on Wood
  • Digital epic ILLUSTRATIONS at demand
  • Canvas prints- DIGITAL EPIC SCENE with you or/and family, or as preffered
  • Canvas prints- Personalized DIGITAL PORTRAITS, surrealistic/realistic
  • Personalized T-SHIRTS with your desired name/ text/ image 
  • All the RIGHTS for personal use my actual artworks (digital and traditional)
  • Prints and printable PDF-s of my artworks
  • A nice WALLPAPERS Set
* Perks include WORLDWIDE SHIPPING (which for hard, large items is quite signifiant). Also include Indiegogo's FEES + related ~ 8-10%

     If by your overwhelming kindness the ammount raised would happen to exeed the goal of this campaign, all the rest of the money would be used on further illustrating my fantasy short-story "Tale of Butterflies and Worms" and all contributors will receive it in PDF/Kindle format upon completion.

(details further below)

About Me:

     I'm Iosif Chezan, a digital and traditional painter from Romania, as well in love with poetry, literature and philosophy. I love to blend colors, shapes, symbols, and words, in my humble trying to bloom catharsis. 

-My digital art portfolio: http://iosifchezan.deviantart.com/gallery  

-My traditional art portfolio:  http://www.divine-icons.com

     To translate my vision into digital art, I used an old Trust graphic tablet, which at the moment needs repair  It served me well a good period, but lately burned my neurons.

I always dreamed of a Wacom Cintique, but I never afforded to take a step toward it, in my fight to be a responsable father of two wonderful children. (David, my little  boy is stuck with elements of autism spectre; in contrast to other countries, specific autism therapy for recovery is not for free  in Romania, but very costly every month).   


What this campaign is about:

     The goal of this campaign is to raise funds for the digital art tool of my dreams: Wacom Cintiq 27QHD, via  PERKS I created. It would help me beyond words  in my freelancer endeavour to earn my living through digital painting.    I dared to imagine so many times the creative flow an artist could have on such  "magical painting tool," in spite of the later bitter feeling of finding it beyond my reach.

     With the risk of ruining my modesty, I will add that I was 6 times semi-finalist (top 25 from thousands entries) on the DeviantArt.com international contests, last of which was held by Blizzard Entertaiment - Hero Of the Storm Fan Art Contest. Not to spam here, I will write in a bottom addentum all the proving links.

  Original link : http://www.wacom.com/en-us/products/pen-displays/cintiq-27-qhd-touch  Here is the reseller i found to offer warranty in my country: http://www.cel.ro/tablete-grafice/tableta-grafi...  Here, the cost of the graphic tablet itself is about 2970 $.   Indiegoo would take about 5% of the founds raised + thrid part fees about 3-5% + other exchange currency fees - see this article about fees and pricing https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/articles/204456408-How-much-does-Indiegogo-cost-Fees-Pricing
To cover everything, a safe amount to be raised would be about  3350 $ (3350 minus aprox. 10% equals  3015$ that i guess can support currency exchange fees)

What would you get - with visual exxamples:

     I do not ask for your precious help without trying to repay your kind gesture in my own humble way, as an artist: take a look at the PERKS  I created. You may find some of them quite tempting, as they include :

  • HAND-PAINTED (fantasy or religious) decorative ARTWORKS that I will make specially for this campaign, personalized or dedicated.
  • Hand-made decorative ORNAMENTS with desk support
  • Family CRESTS and illustrations printed directly on wood.
  • Digital epic ILLUSTRATIONS at demand
  • Personalized DIGITAL PORTRAITS, surrealistic/realistic - printed on canvas with wood edging
  • Personalized T-SHIRTS with your desired TEXT, FACE or NAME included in the printed artwork design
  • The RIGHTS for personal use my actual artworks (digital and traditional)
  • Printable PDF-s of my artworks
  • The WALLPAPER set for pc, tablet and smartphone

See below illustrative examples:

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

■ Digital Water-Color PORTRAIT on canvas: YOU or SOMEONE DEAR to you, painted in a digital WATER-COLOR PORTRAIT  and printed on a 50x30cm canvas with wood edging [one of the rewards of 100$ perks]. The example depicts my daughter.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
■ PRINT on barked WOOD SLICE, about 25cm tall and 2 cm thick [one of the rewards of 50$ perks].

  -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
■ Guardian Angel - beautiful symbol of Love and Protection in any home - hand made ornament with desk support, painted over gold, silver and copper leaves, aprox. 22x35cm [one of the rewards of 100$ perks]

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
■ Personalized T-SHIRTS -YOUR OWN NAME will appear instead of "...Your Name..." Any TEXT is replaceble at will. The same, YOUR FACE or the face you want the t-shirt for could be printed instead of example. [one of the rewards of 100$ perks].


■ PERSONALIZED FAMILY CREST ( A3 size! ), printed on WOOD and also in digital format. You may choose form, symbols, colors which represent you and I will illustrate them accordingly (some examples below) [one of the rewards of 100$ perks].


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
■ You or your family digitally painted PORTRAITS - realistic style, printed on canvas, as the below examples [one of the rewards of 150$ perks].

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
■ Hand-painted neo-byzantine icons -26x36cm collection- painted with gold/silver leaves on normal or burnt wood support, at choice -see the project gallery for larger images [one of the rewards of 150$ perks]
*Whether you are or not religious, the religious art will always remain in the human culture a thrilling apiration toward beautiful, good and celestial.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
■ A wallpaer with powerful mesage - the symbolic reward for any good intention.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
■ Special hand-painted, neo-byzantine icons (35x45cm collection), painted with gold/silver leaves on normal or burnt wood support, at choice -see the project gallery for larger images - [one of the rewards of 300$ and 500$ perks]
*Whether you are or not religious, the religious art will always remain in the human culture a thrilling apiration toward beautiful, good and celestial.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
■ Hand-made Crest Shild Ornament of Heroes, on wood, with gold/silver leaves, personalized symbols and colors. [one of the rewards of 500$ perks]


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

■ YOURSELF painted as FANTASY HERO   -face and personal features, male or female, on HAND-SHAPED, very large WOOD -up to 120cm larger length. Below are some examples, but you if you have whatever other preffered hero, I can make custom /personalized painting after that. See project gallery for larger images [one of the rewards of 1000$ perks]

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
■ Palatial hand-painted religious icons -up to 120cm in larger side, painted with gold/silver leaves on normal or burnt wood support, at choice -see gallery for larger images- [one of the rewards of 1000$ perks]
     If you enjoy other lower size icon models to be painted at this scale, I can do that. *Whether you are or not religious, the religious art will always remain in the human culture a thrilling apiration toward beautiful, good and celestial.


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

■ The RIGHTS for your personal use of my actual art (that is not copyrighted to other parties):


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
■ The Printable PDF set:


-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
■ The WALLPAPER SET:

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

■ Dedication* on the preview cover print of my short-story "Tale of Butterflies and Worms" (book under on-going illustration process):

*If by your overwhelming kindness the ammount raised would exeed the goal of this campaign, all the rest of the money would be used on further illustrating of "Tale of Butterflies and Worms." There, above the veils of symbols, contrasting scenes, dilemma situations  or epic flow of adventures, I try to depict an overview to existence and a scale of values to thrill the mind of the reader… values which received on the back wings of both emotion and reason, (in my subjective eyes) could shape a much more beautiful, fair and empathetic world of humanity.
I add blow some "behind the scene" already  illustrated pages- paired two by two:

      If you enjoy my humble art and consider my dream not too daring, please join this campaign and help me aquire the Wacom Cintique graphic tablet.

     I feel pregnant with so much beauty, imagination, intense feelings and deep empathic emotions, all waiting to flow outside like a river, with the right tool to channel them out.

     I want to thank you all for any good vibration or kind gesture. I can imagine a future where empathy and kindness would be the solid bridges upon persons. . . where beautiful minds and warm hearts are not let to be wasted in poverty and solitude, for the lack of resourses. I believe mankind deserve an age of abundence, in which all could have a chance to bloom and share their inner beauty, as inspired artists of their own lives.


Risks & Challenges

     If by some too generous support, most of perks that involve hand-made artworks would abound, the delivery may be delayed  more than specified, as  I am the only one who hand-craft all the rewards.

     I am a honorable person and I will fulfill every promise. For me, the good vibrations sent to me, when my name comes into one's mind, matter more than any money.

Other Ways You Can Help

     I very much understand that some of you just can't afford to contribute. But that doesn't mean you can't help: using the Indiegogo share tools,  you can spread the word about this campaign and with few good intentioned clicks make the difference in a life.


Addentum:

Without false modesty, I give the proving links of Deviant Art International Contest where i got 6 times to semi-finals (top 25) from thousands of entries:

--Semi-finalist (top 25 from over 2300 submissions)  in “Heroes of the Storm Ultimate Fan Art Contest” by “BLIZZARD ENTERTAIMENT” and “Deviantart.com”http://madizzlee.deviantart.com/journal/Heroes-of-the-Storm-Contest-Semi-Finalists-544485157with the painting http://www.deviantart.com/art/A-glimpse-of-HOTS-Epic-Universe-541715480

-Semi-finalist (top 25 from over 3350 comics submissions)  in “Mythical Creature T-shirt Design Challenge” http://deviantartgear.deviantart.com/journal/Mythical-Creatures-Semi-Finalists-320161614 with the artwork: http://deviantartgear.deviantart.com/art/Sharing-IMAGINATION-316178451

-Semi-finalist (top 25 from over 3300 submissions)  in “The Give the Gift of Art Challenge” by “Wacom” and “Deviantart.com” http://moonbeam13.deviantart.com/journal/Give-the-Gift-of-Art-Challenge-Semi-finalists-501930695 with the painting http://iosifchezan.deviantart.com/art/Vision-gift-from-the-peaks-of-my-soul-498726034

-Semi-finalist (top 25 from over 2250 submissions) in the “Outcast Odyssey Card Master Chalenge” by Namco Bandai Games America and “Deviantart.com” http://madizzlee.deviantart.com/journal/Outcast-Odyssey-Challenge-Semi-Finalists-511622418 with the artwork: http://iosifchezan.deviantart.com/art/I-bring-you-the-embrace-of-FEAR-508834446

-Semi-finalist (top 25 from over 1650 submissions)  in the “Plans gone wrong” by “Fotolia” and “Deviantart.com” http://danlev.deviantart.com/journal/Plans-Gone-Wrong-Contest-Semi-Finalists-255726560 with artwork http://danlev.deviantart.com/art/TROUBLING-BOOTY-252882047

-Semi-finalist (top 25 from over 500 comics submissions)  in “The Darkness II contest” by “Top Cow Productions, Inc” and “Deviantart.com” http://moonbeam13.deviantart.com/journal/The-Darkness-II-Contest-Winners-278002334 with the artwork: http://iosifchezan.deviantart.com/art/The-DARKNESS-inside-could-also-redeem-276571587 

For transparency I will also add the link for DELIVERY FEE of Romanian International Mail: https://www.posta-romana.ro/index.php/?page=cal...

story:
Short Summary

This 40th year Anniversary  tour will provide the Chicago Blues All Stars with startup capital to establish our headquarters in Hammond,Ind.We will interview and  assemble the proper design team, fact finding team, and community craftsmen to design, develop, build, and maintain a state-of-the-art multi-generational community centers entitled, The University of Life Community Center (ULCC).     

We are the Chicago Blues All Stars  inc. I am, Dr.Jimmy Lee Tillman, spokesman for CBAS inc. We are a not for profit 501(c)3 organization formed to keep the Blues alive. Our mission is to develop state-of-the-art multigenerational community  arts and alternative learning centers in key locations across the United States. We plan to raise additional funding for our project by recording, touring, lecturing , selling CD's, DVD, a CBAS's  clothing line, films, television, documentaries, music videos, books.and pamphlets. A series of press releases and social media sites will document our progress as we reach key milestones.
Deacon Freddie Dixon , John Watkins and I have come  out of retirement to dedicate our lives to carrying on the enduring legacy of the Chicago  Blues. The Chicago Blues All Stars stand on the shoulders of giants like Muddy Waters, Howlin’ Wolf, Little Walter, Bo Diddley, Buddy Guy and the others who invented the Chicago Blues sound and provided the foundation for a new way of hearing the Blues  through recordings by The Rolling Stones, Led Zeppelin, The Doors, Cream, The Animals and Van Morrison—and so many others who helped introduce the entire world to the Chicago Blues..

The CBAS is the band that Willie Dixon, the greatest Blues songwriter of his generation, put together to carry on the legacy of the founders of the Chicago Blues. With Willie at the helm, CBAS toured and performed for over 10 years thrilling audiences worldwide, performing Willie’s songs, including blues classics like “Back Door Man,” Hoochie Coochie Man,” I Just Want to Make Love to You,” “Little Red Rooster,”” My Babe,” “The Seventh Son.”

The Blues are the true facts of life told in words and songs of inspiration, emotion and feeling. TheBlues is a living organism. It was never meant to be confined to a museum. It was meant to be played live and transmitted by human beings who love to play and listen to the blues. The CBAS plan to have a Living Blues Museum where musicians will introduce audiences to great blues musicians of the past

Now you can do your part. You can contribute to the CBAS’s crowdfunding campaign on Indiegogo. The ULCC's educational centers funded by CBAS’s efforts will be a place where the Blues are taught, performed, studied, and enjoyed by generation after generation.   It's hard to imagine a Bob Dylan, a Mick Jagger or even a hit Broadway show like "Hamilton" had there not been for Willie Dixon,Muddy Waters or a Howlin' Wolf or Chuck Berry. 

The Chicago Blues All Stars are the direct lineage to the greatest Bluesmen that America has ever produced. The CBAS's multigenerational  ULCC  will  implement programs that  will improve the lives of the whole community in locations across the United States.

       THE UNIVERSITY OF LIFE COMMUNITY CENTER PROGRAMS 

1. Multigenerational Community Centers: The ULCC established by the CBAS  will gather and serve people across all age groups, especially those on the "fringes" -- the youth and the elders.  The benefits of a music education (whether informal or formal), such as this one are well documented: https://www.dosomething.org/facts/11-facts-about-music-education. These include better attendance in school, less violence ,less use or abuse of drugs and alcohol, improved brain development and even benefit children with learning disabilities. ULCC will consult with and recruit Transcendental  Meditation trainers to assist in  the needs of the community. Elders will find companionship, an opportunity to pass on their knowledge and skills to new generations, and music has a proven form of cognitive therapy for people as they age.

2. Programs for children: Blues camps, mentoring/instrument lessons, blues in the schools programs are also important parts of our proposal.  The Blues Foundation in Memphis has developed programs for scholarships and blues in the schools, and could be a great partner with the potential to aid communities in duplicating their programs in University of Life Community  Centers. 

3. Job Creation: The centers will require a full staff to instruct, operate, clean and maintain the facilities, which means jobs for a number of people in the locations where they live.  They will also  provide an opportunity for internships and/or shadowing by younger people who are preparing to enter the work force.

4. Performance Hall/Auditorium: There will be a dedicated place within each community center for concerts, where local and touring talent could perform and/or conduct workshops and perhaps take part in an annual blues festival.The centers could provide a physical site for the blueshalloffame.com awards to be displayed and celebrated. 

5.  State of the arts athletic facility swimming pool, steam room, yoga gymnasium weight room athletic field football, soccer,baseball,basket ball, golf  and tennis course.

6. ULCC Organic Community Farm  for sustainable living, food and,energy.

 www.gardeningmatters.org/sites/default/.../Multiple%20Benefits_2012.p...

What We Need & What You Get

$150,000

$ 110,000  to begin work on a  CBAS  Headquarters and Living Blues Museum. 

 $5000  legal management fees and administrative costs, 

 $10,000  for promotional costs

 $25,000  for band /staff/(booking agent, tour manager,technology  manager, promoter),which will help support fundraising efforts. Supporters of our Indiegogo campaign will become members of the CBAS's PEOPLES BLUES ARMY and  will receive free gifts ranging from CDs and vinyl records, T-shirts  to free admission and backstage passes to CBAS performances.

story:
Who we are and what we want to do


Hi! We are Beata and David, a just married couple of professional artists based in London.
Beata's website
David's website
We are delighted to have been selected among hundreds of applications to get an artist residency at Arteles Creative Center in Hämeenkyrö, Finland! So we will have access to the art studio facilities and we will spend the whole January 2016   creating new works directly inspired by the very mystical and fascinating nature of Finland. 

It will be a very cold and dark winter, perfect environment for the  art residency's main theme called "Silence, Awareness, Existence". We are really excited about it!

http://www.arteles.org/sae_residency.html

For us participating in this art residency is a unique opportunity.  To be able to dedicate one full month of our lives to create new beautiful artworks in such an inspiring environment will for sure make a breakthrough in our artistic practice, and through new contacts, catalogues and exhibitions, this experience will well help us achieving our dream of being full time artists.


What We Need & What You Get


Arteles Organisation only covers half costs of the residency rent, so we have to pay the other half-rent fee for two people (€1480).

Apart from that,  there will be other costs involved, regarding  travel expenses (plane, buses and train tickets), food for two people during 30 days, warm clothing (it's very cold there!) , art supplies (papers, canvases, acrylics, scanning, good quality printing) and finally the moving costs of bringing back all the artworks produced.

So we have calculated we would need €6500.

No matter the contribution you give us we will thank you eternally and of course we will add you to our e-mailing list to keep you updated on our art.  And depending on the donation you will get artworks prints and original artworks sent from us (check perks on the right) Sharing this link will also help us a lot.

Thank you in advance!

story:
Hi, we are Robert and Sloane Cheatham, artists and recently relocated to Philadelphia, MS from Atlanta, GA. With extensive experience in the arts, we have decided to open an art space/ gallery/ studios in Phliadelphia, MS. And we need your help.

We found a perfect building, but it's old and in need of a lot of work. The building does have a rich history. It's where Marty Stuart bought his first guitar! We feel passionately that an art gallery, one that functions more like an art community center, will transform this region in to a cultural destination and increase the arts education for the children and adults in the local community and in the state of Mississippi, as well. This is our dream, which somewhat mysteriously, led us to this crossroads, (hats off to Robert Johnson). Part of the dream is opening our arms to you to join the adventure. This would be an historic event!

The building we found is on Main Street on our town square. We figure a minimum estimate of costs to open, make safe and get it running is $52,000.  The two story building needs to be scraped and painted inside and out; there's a large concrete wall that needs to be repurposed; we have to purchase and install gallery lighting and area lighting; we need to have signage; we hope to offer live performances, book readings and other presentations, so we need a small p.a. system; we need insurance; again, this is a large space with multi rooms and two levels, so the utilities will be considerable- we are trying to raise enough for one year of utilities; we want to offer free wi-fi; ideally, the carpet will be removed and the original floors used; we will also need to hire help to handle some aspects of art hanging. Plus, the costs of the unexpected in working in an old building.

Other than being part of an historic moment!We have perks: we have cool t-shirts designed by us; the Pinelandia book, published by Robert's fort!/da? book series; free use of part of the space for one month.

If we fail to reach the full fundraising goal, we will work to do a couple of art shows with what we have.   

                                                               ••••••

Robert, originally from Philadelphia, moved to the suburbs of Atlanta with his parents and siblings in 1962. However, his folks managed to keep their Mississippi home in hopes of one day returning. Robert was the director of the non-profit Eyedrum Art and Music Gallery in Atlanta, GA for over seven years where he worked with an active board to curate, host and manage over 200 events per year. Working at Eyedrum prepared Robert for the rigors and obstacles that goes with rehabbing a space to suite art of various genres. Sloane  served on the board of directors and worked as a curator at Eyedrum, as well. Also, Sloane has worked in the interior design business for twenty years, building relationships with interior designers, their clients, introducing them to galleries and artists. Together, we created and ran Freedonia Garden Works for five years.

After closing the garden design business in Atlanta, we decided to have an adventure and move to Mississippi, renovate the family home and live a slower pace life and quickly fell in love with our new hometown and decided it's the perfect place to set roots and raise our son, Rowan. However, there are aspects of our life in Atlanta that we miss. But definitely not the traffic! We do miss an active arts community of painters, poets, musicians, art patrons and all the creative types that make life adventurous and fulfilling. We are artists but with entrepreneurial spirit. After meeting and making friends with local, creative folks, we discovered there is a real need for a multi-faceted art space that will enhance the lives of both artists and patrons of the arts.
We thank you for any monetary assistance that you can provide, but we understand that not everyone can help monetarily. Please use the indiegogo sharing tools and spread the word to your contacts and check back often to see our progress. We are excited and look forward to seeing you pass through the Pinelandia Gallery door!

Special thanks go to 4m Productions and Melody Mclain Hanks; David Vowell, Brenda Vowell, Walt Willis and Allison Willis.

story:
Join Us

The wall is located at the intersection of North Davidson and Parkwood, which marks the entrance of the North Davidson neighborhood- or more fondly, NoDa. Joe’s Doughs will occupy 1721 North Davidson St, but would like to donate the wall to maintaining the arts district of our city. The outer wall of Joe’s Doughs is a vast blank canvas- and we want the community to paint it!


The Specifics

This 840 square foot wall faces the intersection of Parkwood & North Davidson; adjacent the to new Parkwood Station on the blue line extension. It will be divided into 4 different sections, providing a smaller (but still sizeable!) canvas for local artists to paint however they choose.


Matt Moore (@puckmcgruff) and Matt Hooker (@hookermedia) have already signed on and will be painting a ‘Welcome to NoDa’ mural to greet those entering the neighborhood. Matt and Matt will take the lead in working with local artists to showcase our city's talents.

See their work at www.hookermedia.com


The Reason

NoDa is known for its flourishing art scene. It is one of the most creative areas in Charlotte- and we want to embrace and encourage that! NoDa wouldn’t be NoDa without it’s artists. So what better way to recognize these artists than giving them an opportunity to claim their neighborhood?

As NoDa undergoes a new development phase, we would like to make sure the neighborhood maintains its culture. Joe’s Doughs is passionate about the community that helped build their dream into a donut shop- and this is their way of giving back to that community!


The Artists

Matt Hooker and Matt Moore are some of Charlotte’s premier painters and muralists- and they have left a beautiful impression on the city. Some of their previous work includes:

(All pictures from: www.hookermedia.com)

What We Need and What You Get

  • In order to get this wall finished- we need $11,000. That may sound like a lot- but this is a BIG wall. It requires a lot of paint, and a lot of work. We've got some of the best local artists working on this, and their attention to detail won't go unnoticed!
  • We're thrilled that you've decided to donate, and we'd like to thank you with the sweetest rewards we could think of- Donuts! Joe's Doughs has offered tons of great perks that you'll be able to gobble up once the store front opens in May. 
  • If we don't reach our entire goal (and hopefully this is a big 'if'), the money will still go towards the wall, and we'll reach out to other investors and dig into our own pockets to get this thing done.

The Perks

Joe’s Doughs is incredibly grateful that you’re willing to give your money to this project- and thought you should see some of Joe's Doughs past creations as well as some other perks you'll be getting in return! 


Other Ways You Can Help

If money’s tight and you can’t contribute, don’t sweat it! There’s still ways you can help:

  • Make some noise about the campaign! Tell your neighbor, tell your mom, tell a stranger on the street! Tell whoever you can- word of mouth is priceless to us.

  • Share the campaign! Any kind of coverage on social media is a huge help, whether it be a tweet, Instagram, Facebook post, or Snapchat- we can’t thank you enough!

story:
RIGHT LOVELY PEOPLE, LET ME TELL YOU ABOUT THE BEAUTIFUL, REBELLIOUS, EQUILIBRIOUS ART HAPPENING THAT IS FRIED RICE JAM!

Our aims for Fried Rice Jam are as follows:

To bring together the performance and art communities present in Leicester and the East Midlands.

 To encourage artists from a variety of disciplines to meet, network, collaborate and engage in an evening of exciting collaboration and improvisation with one another.

The event is a chance for artists who wouldn't usually meet to get creative and play together. 

We aim to create a series of these events allowing the participants to have ongoing creative dialogues and collaborations with each other, benefiting their practice, whatever it may be.

We aim to take away the angst that often is present in the UK about creating art for no reason, to let go of reasoning and to play.

What does Fried Rice Jam mean to us?

This project is extremely valuable in establishing a strong community relationship between artists in the midlands and across the country, bringing together their unique talents and skills. Collaboration between artistic individuals is something that we see as essential in sustaining performance art as a culture. Uniting artists that would not normally work together has the potential to create amazing partnerships that would not of otherwise been found. Improvisation is a fantastic skill to have in performance, as it shakes individuals lose of their inhibitions and worries and instead enables them to trust their instincts and welcome the unknown in order to make fantastic discoveries along the way. 

Combining improvisation with the mish mash of artistic disciplines holds fantastic potential! We must rid the stigma of dancers just working with dancers and musicians with musicians and instead enable individuals to embrace the unknown and build trust within artistic communities leaving the opportunity for future collaborations.

Where would your money be going?

Your money would be HUGELY appreciated as Fried Rice Jam could not happen without you! We would use it for:

Industrial and unique space hire.

FREE FRIED RICE FOR ALL!

Surface materials to keep the space safe and comfortable.

Art Supplies, such as painting materials, technical equipment and instruments.

Promotion and advertisement of the organisation.

Brand development.

A money pot for future Fried Rice Jams which will taking place in the next few months (exciting!). This pot will be match funded.
With £1000 we can achieve : Two more Fried Rice Jams in the next three months.
                                                         Two Fried Rice Workshops for the public.
                                                        A Workshop/mini jam in a location outside of Leicester                                                          in the next month!

Thank you Thank you Thank you!

The life of Fried Rice Jam...

After the first Fried Rice Jam on the 22/01/16 the feedback we received was fantastic. Spectators and participants of the jam likened the event to the underground happenings of the 1960's and are keen for the Jams to keep happening. 

Here is some feedback that we received:

'Where else is there for all artistic communities to come together for freeform collaboration?" That's one thing; as free as art is, if this night could be (semi) pre-arranged it would CONQUER! Avant Garde at its most outgoing in Leicester in my experience. Quality'

'Much thanks to FRJ for the playful organised chaos. I liked the flow of raw participation and the accidental, but inevitable, symbiosis.'

This is exactly the reason why we started Fried Rice Jam...because there was a need for it! There is a huge gap in the art industry where people can just let go of inhibition and jam for the sake of it. With the lack of open spaces in Leicester too we knew that people would love and need Fried Rice Jam.

The future of Fried Rice looks bright! After receiving a loving and enthusiastic welcome from Leicester we would love to take Fried Rice to other areas of the country spreading art and love wherever we go. We just need a little bit of your help to achieve this, Thank you.


Risks & Challenges:

 As we are young and this project is just beginning, Fried Rice has not yet been tried and tested enough so we are still learning how to make the project work. We are also aware that Fried Rice will not work in every city so we need to be selective and try this out in different areas.

As Fried Rice grows in popularity we are also aware that there may be an issue with finding space to facilitate it and short listing will have to come into play for artists as demand grows.

However, as Fried Rice creators we are all inspired young artists, with varying ages, interests and experience but with one unique goal, to make this project work. We doubt that no event since the 1960's underground happenings has quite the same unique edge or energy as Fried Rice does and we are so excited for THE FUTURE OF FRIED RICE JAM!
story_txt: RIGHT LOVELY PEOPLE, LET ME TELL YOU ABOUT THE BEAUTIFUL, REBELLIOUS, EQUILIBRIOUS ART HAPPENING THAT IS FRIED RICE JAM!Our aims for Fried Rice Jam are as follows:To bring together the performance and art communities present in Leicester and the East Midlands. To encourage artists from a variety of disciplines to meet, network, collaborate and engage in an evening of exciting collaboration and improvisation with one another.The event is a chance for artists who wouldn't usually meet to get creative and play together. We aim to create a series of these events allowing the participants to have ongoing creative dialogues and collaborations with each other, benefiting their practice, whatever it may be.We aim to take away the angst that often is present in the UK about creating art for no reason, to let go of reasoning and to play.What does Fried Rice Jam mean to us?This project is extremely valuable in establishing a strong community relationship between artists in the midlands and across the country, bringing together their unique talents and skills. Collaboration between artistic individuals is something that we see as essential in sustaining performance art as a culture. Uniting artists that would not normally work together has the potential to create amazing partnerships that would not of otherwise been found. Improvisation is a fantastic skill to have in performance, as it shakes individuals lose of their inhibitions and worries and instead enables them to trust their instincts and welcome the unknown in order to make fantastic discoveries along the way. Combining improvisation with the mish mash of artistic disciplines holds fantastic potential! We must rid the stigma of dancers just working with dancers and musicians with musicians and instead enable individuals to embrace the unknown and build trust within artistic communities leaving the opportunity for future collaborations.Where would your money be going?Your money would be HUGELY appreciated as Fried Rice Jam could not happen without you! We would use it for:Industrial and unique space hire.FREE FRIED RICE FOR ALL!Surface materials to keep the space safe and comfortable.Art Supplies, such as painting materials, technical equipment and instruments.Promotion and advertisement of the organisation.Brand development.A money pot for future Fried Rice Jams which will taking place in the next few months (exciting!). This pot will be match funded.With £1000 we can achieve : Two more Fried Rice Jams in the next three months.                                                         Two Fried Rice Workshops for the public.                                                        A Workshop/mini jam in a location outside of Leicester                                                          in the next month!Thank you Thank you Thank you!The life of Fried Rice Jam...After the first Fried Rice Jam on the 22/01/16 the feedback we received was fantastic. story:
Update 8/23

WOW!  Thank you so much to our community for rallying behind this project.  We have less than $6K to go.   Please consider what your donation can do to help this project get to the finish line.

We have been blessed by the most amazing build crew, phenomenal support from the org, and generous-beyond-belief donors.  And yet with building costs and shipping costs, we still need a little more.  Can we get this campaign to $20,000 tonight?  Tomorrow morning?  

 

Update 8/19

With the bulk of our crew on playa or headed up this weekend, we are incredibly grateful and touched by the support of our community.  We have less than $9,000 to raise to finish this project. 

Please consider donating and sharing among your friends.  Our crew will rest a little easier knowing that the campaign is nearly over.  

Our deepest gratitude,

CoV Crew

 

 

How far we've come...

For the past two months hundreds of volunteers and artists from the Bay Area, Los Angeles, Vancouver, Boston, Reno, Portland, Amsterdam, Copenhagen, France, you get the picture; have come to SF to help us construct the Catacomb of Veils. Until now, we have raised $68K toward our goal of ~$90k that will enable us to complete this sculpture and deliver it to the playa for Burning Man 2016. The community that has been built is incredible, it's truly a family of folks that have come together with a singular vision to see this built and individual desires to be a part of something special. Along with our donors, we make up the Catacomb of Veils. 

At 220' across and covering almost 19,000 square feet of playa area, Catacomb of Veils will be the largest art piece at Burning Man 2016 and one of the largest burned sculptures in the history of the event. 

Your donation goes 100% to procuring materials, construction, transportation, insurance, and build-site rental for the project. Everyone participating in the creation of Catacomb is all-volunteer with a commitment to the transformative power of temporary art. Our community of artists and builders is so grateful for your contribution and support.

Catacomb rises like a rocky outcropping off the desert floor, and as the dust swirls up and around, it evokes Black Rock Point itself.  It is a ruin of a previous society-- a remnant of our collective search for moments of quiet, introspection and reflection. It is a journey of discovery and a descent into a subterranean world.

A path winds up to the Narthex at the Eastern Pyramid of the Catacomb and from this vantage point the community begins its descent inward. Ancient relics of a collective history adorn the walls as shafts of light illuminate effigies and offerings. These are moments in our primeval memory, inviting us further downward and inward into ourselves. The journey culminates in an inner sanctum-- a Sanctum of Veils-- a confluence of concealment, revelation and sublime beauty.

The core crew met while working together on the Temple of Grace in 2014 and has a long history of creating huge art for the Burning Man community. 

Make a contribution, follow us on Facebook, spread the word or bring your energy to lift lumber and build a mountain.  We guarantee your contribution makes a difference. 

Thank You!

- The Catacomb Crew

** For donations that require or desire a tax deduction receipt, please donate directly to our campaign on Fractured Atlas' site. Go to https://www.fracturedatlas.org/site/fiscal/profile?id=14182

story:
Chromatic is the result of three years of collaboration between Susan Marshall,  Jason Treuting, and Suzanne Bocanegra, which will have its world premiere June 23-25, 2016 at The Kitchen in NYC, presented by American Dance Institute.

We need your help to get to the premiere! We have raised $150,000 over the last three years to develop this project but we still need to find $25,000 between now and opening night on June 23 to pay for the sets and costumes, our production staff, rehearsal space and equipment rental, and all the other exciting things that make up the colorful world of Chromatic.

We hope you'll agree that we have come up with some fun and exciting perks. And we hope that you can join us for the premiere of Chromatic!

You can find out more and buy tickets here.

Thank you,

Susan Marshall, Jason Treuting, Suzanne Bocanegra


Choreographer Susan Marshall, composer Jason Treuting, and visual artist Suzanne Bocanegra perform live real time color experiments using line, light, movement, shape and sound. Inspired by Josef Albers' 1963 masterpiece of color theory, Interaction of Color, Marshall, Treuting, and Bocanegra push into the internal logic and emotion of color utilizing improvisatory systems devised from the structure of Albers’s book, a primer for understanding color used by artists and art students all over the world. Using their own bodies, they explore the subjectivity and humanity of individual perception in relation to color and color history.

Choreography Susan Marshall 

Music Jason Treuting

Visual Design Suzanne Bocanegra

Lighting Design Eric Southern

Projection Design Jeff Larson

Costume Design Suzanne Bocanegra, Olivera Gajic, and Beth Goldenberg

Audio Engineer Jay Eigenmann

Creative Assistant Kristen Hollinsworth

story:
Organizational Purpose

We are artists, we are creatives, we are AV+F. An organization built for the development of networks and communities. AV+F showcases upcoming talents in visual art, performance art, fashion design, music, hair and makeup artistry. 
AV+F serves to provide independent artists, musicians, and designers within the first 10 years of their creative career with the resources and exposure needed to inspire and cultivate creativity. AV+F ventures to provide the platform for these artists to be seen, heard, and admired. 
Our campaign is to raise money to provide larger platform opportunities to entrepreneurs and creatives around the world. We provide the largest art showcases in the world. We need your support to reach domestic and international markets around the world.
With the support, we can secure venues for larger events for artists and connect the communities across the world. Particularly our platform allows artists to grow exposure but remain independent for creative presentation. 
Are you ready to support an artist in the family, in your community, or yourself? Join now and lets bridge the gap between opportunity and beauty.

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $75,000 in funding to secure our venues for our showcases and film festivals. This will allow artists to have a secure schedule of events for artist development and showcase.

Our exclusive perks are created in a way to make our supporters become apart of the organization. We want every person's contributions small or large to be recognized for helping our community grow.

If we don't reach our goal, we will take the limited funds and schedule out events in our existing market to build momentum. Our revenues will grow our organization from the east coast to the west coast.

Our Impact
Our projects are valuable to our contributors because you love art. You understand the lack of opportunities. This support is what makes the artists find that determination, it helps the artists find that passion. 
Successful opportunities so far have been our ability to partner with galleries to gain new artists, producers to hear new sounds, and designers to showcase their fashion in trade shows/fashion weeks.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

Our current challenges are not having venues available due to finances. We aren't able to touch new markets because of the lack of capital to invest. If we aren't able to impact new markets our national relationships will soon move to other means of gathering artists.
Our plan for solving these issue rely heavily on our ability to market and develop artists. We have strong ties on the east coast to art galleries which allow are relationships to open many doors. We have many contributors to the arts but not a lot of funding to scale the showcases. 

Other Ways You Can Support

You can also contribute to our platform by sharing this message. Passing the word along will help us connect to more people interested in building a dynamic art platform. 
Use the indiegogo tools to your advantage and thank you for your time. Check out artvibesfashion.com! Join us in changing our communties through art.

Artists Benefits

Participating artists' benefits:

A profile portfolio on artvibesfashion.com, upload pics, videos, MP3s and more information on yourself and your work. (Only for AV+F Artists)
Promotion on our social media outlets
Placement in the AV+F Showcase Event (a showcase with 500-700+ attendees)
Professional head shots and photos of your work, collection, performance, band or whatever you happen to be presenting (also great for portfolios, social media or websites)
Complimentary admission into any AV+F showcase +1 guest, forever!
AV+F Radio: We bring you exclusive interviews, opportunities, updates, branding, promotions and more…
We have strategic partnerships with organizations, companies and industry players to continue to bring more opportunities to the forefront!

story:
What is Hillsfest?

Hillsfest is an ambitious FREE festival of art & music!

The festival will be a celebration of creativity but with a clear focus on the brilliant people, place, heritage and industry of Hillsborough, Sheffield. The very first Hillsfest will take place in Hillsborough Park on July 9th and 10th this summer but the aim is to create something that will leave a positive legacy for the local community, far beyond the event itself.

Why is this important? - because this area wants a change of perception.

“When I say Hillsborough what’s the first thing you think of?”

Sadly, for many, the answer is still the terrible football tragedy of 1989 where 96 people lost their lives - The Hillsborough Disaster. This was 26 years ago.

There’s a real desire for people to come together to deliver something entirely positive for the area. Everyone we have spoken to is in agreement that the disaster will always be a part of Hillsborough’s story but moving forward there’s a need to recognise some of the things that are truly great about this area for the people who live and work here. Hillsborough is full of talent and has a rich and fascinating cultural and industrial heritage.

There’s a desire to see Hillsborough re-assert its identity and re-invigorate its sense of pride.

The community feel that it’s important to involve the people of Liverpool in this event. We want to extend the positive legacy of the festival in building closer community ties between Liverpool and Hillsborough and have already begun to make those links as the festival takes shape. From arts and crafts to music making and performance we want this to be a shared experience.

You can make a massive difference!

  • change some of the unfair negative perceptions of this area & celebrate the enormous creativity that exists here
  • deliver an extraordinary FREE event in the North of Sheffield which sits next to some of the most deprived wards in the city.
  • highlight the talent, stories and heritage of an area that feels it has been, to a large extent, neglected and overlooked or overshadowed by other events.

What We Need

We need cash!  The more we get the more extraordinary we can make this festival. 

Extraordinary, exciting, fun and FREE! 


Hillsfest doesn't want to look like any other festival.  The desire is to transform the local park through the erection of huge 24 metre inflatable domes, each with an internal capactiy of 800 people standing. Inside and outside of which we want to deliver an exciting programme of content across various themes.

  • If we can raise £10K, that would cover the cost of a dome and some FREE exciting content  to take place inside it, or exciting content within the various themed zones. 
  • £3K would cover the cost of bringing 2 professional glass artists, Bandits of Glass,  to offer two days worth of glass blowing demonstrations.
  • £1K would cover the costs of two days worth of engaging & accessible workshop delivery for people of all ages with professional artists!
  • £5K would cover the cost of a fantastic music stage and crew


Themes the festival aims to cover include:

  • Creative Showcase - exhibition space for painting, printmaking, textiles, glass, jewellery, ceramics, photography, sculpture, illustration and design.
  • Makers activity - opportunities, to build, make, play and generally get 'hands on' with a wide range of media
  • Sound & Movement - dance, theatre and or other explorations into sound and movement in its broadest sense.
  • Spoken word & film  - to include poetry and various elements of spoken word and experimental and diverse film screenings suitable for a range of ages and interests.

In addition:

  • A modular graffiti tower - the size of a terraced house!
  • A sculpture symposium - live chainsaw carving!
  • Performances
  • Music stage - Sheffield and Liverpool bands.

Why?  Because you're worth it!!!

Perks!

Do we have perks for you?  Wow!  Artists and others have been enormously generous.  In fact so generous we cannot realistically put up all the perks on the site without you losing the will to live trying to get through them all!  So, we have narrowed it down to:

  1. Excellent quality unique original works of art across media.
  2. Signed high quality limited edition prints of unique works by living artists
  3. T-shirts of various designs and sizes
  4. Personalised 'thank you' mugs, complete with 4x artist made coasters, a badge, a sticker and a thank you!

Images of current perks are in the gallery section (go to the top of the page). Links to available perks are also on a facebook page here

What happens if we don't reach our goal?

Well, apart from being very sad..we have a back up plan for an impactful but scaled down event.  Every penny we raise will help towards the festival and if we don't manage to deliver everything we want we know we can build on whatever we do achieve this year for next time!  

We already know this will have an impact on Hillsborough as the community has said so.

Access to high quality activities and events can be life changing.  This festival has the capacity to really affect people's lives and bring new ideas, possibilities and opportunities.  We want to give people FREE access to sights, sounds and activities they may have never seen or imagined.

Team

We are very blessed to have a dedicated team of volunteers with too many years(!) of experience helping to make sure we stay on track and deliver an amazing and safe experience for all. 

Oh no you can't!  Oh yes we can!!

How many times have we heard the 'you'll never do it!'  Or..  'You'll never do it in Hillsborough!' comment? 

The festival director set up a contemporary art gallery between a betting shop and a launderette, around the corner from the Sheffield Wednesday Football ground in the middle of a recession in 1991!  Most people gave her 6 months... 25 years later she is still going strong! 

"Where there is a will, there is a way!"

Karen Sherwood, Festival Director


Other Ways You Can Help!

We know not everyone can contribute financially but that doesn't mean you can't help.  Everyone has skills and talents and if you want this event to happen, you can still help!

PLEASE SHOUT ABOUT THE CAMPAIGN:
  • Talk to people -face to face -  friends, colleagues, family,
  • Share across social media platforms - facebook, twitter, Instagram etc
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools
  • Can you distribute flyers, stickers, badges?
  • Can you organise a coffee morning or other fundraising social?

Download a fundraising pack here

We can do this!

Thanks for reading.  xxxx

Karen and all the volunteers and helpers.

If we can raise £10K, that would cover the cost of a dome and some
 FREE exciting content  to take place inside it, or exciting content 
within the various themed zones. 
£3K would cover the cost of bringing 2 professional glass artists, Bandits of Glass,  to offer two days worth of glass blowing demonstrations.
£1K would cover the costs of two days worth of engaging & accessible workshop delivery for people of all ages with professional artists!
£5K would cover the cost of a fantastic music stage and crew


Themes the festival aims to cover include:


Creative Showcase - exhibition space for painting, printmaking, textiles, glass, jewellery, ceramics, photography, sculpture, illustration and design. 


Makers activity - opportunities, to build, make, play and generally get 'hands on' with a wide range of media

Sound & Movement - dance, theatre and or other explorations into sound and movement in its broadest sense.

Spoken word & film  - to include poetry and various elements of spoken word and experimental and diverse film screenings suitable for a range of ages and interests.

In addition:

A modular graffiti tower - the size of a terraced house!
A sculpture symposium - live chainsaw carving!
Performances
Music stage - Sheffield and Liverpool bands.


Why?  Because you're worth it!!!



Perks!Do we have perks for you?  Wow!  Artists and others have been enormously generous.  In fact so generous we cannot realistically put up all the perks on the site without you losing the will to live trying to get through them all!  So, we have narrowed it down to:
Excellent quality unique original works of art across media.

Signed high quality limited edition prints of unique works by living artists 

T-shirts of various designs and sizes
Personalised 'thank you' mugs, complete with 4x artist made coasters, a badge, a sticker and a thank you!

Images of current perks are in the gallery section (go to the top of the page). Links to available perks are also on a facebook page here


What happens if we don't reach our goal?Well, apart from being very sad..we have a back up plan for an impactful but scaled down event.  Every penny we raise will help towards the festival and if we don't manage to deliver everything we want we know we can build on whatever we do achieve this year for next time!  
  We already know this will have an impact on Hillsborough as the community has said so.
Access to high quality activities and events can be life changing.  This festival has the capacity to really affect people's lives and bring new ideas, possibilities and opportunities.  We want to give people FREE access to sights, sounds and activities they may have never seen or imagined.TeamWe are very blessed to have a dedicated team of volunteers with too many years(!) of experience helping to make sure we stay on track and deliver an amazing and safe experience for all.    Oh no you can't!  Oh yes we can!!How many times have we heard the 'you'll never do it!'  Or..  'You'll never do it in Hillsborough!' comment?  The festival director set up a contemporary art gallery between a betting shop and a launderette, around the corner from the Sheffield Wednesday Football ground in the middle of a recession in 1991!  Most people gave her 6 months... 25 years later she is still going strong!  "Where there is a will, there is a way!" 
Karen Sherwood, Festival Director  Other Ways You Can Help!

We know not everyone can contribute financially but that doesn't mean you can't help.  Everyone has skills and talents and if you want this event to happen, you can still help!PLEASE SHOUT ABOUT THE CAMPAIGN:
Talk to people -face to face -  friends, colleagues, family, 

Share across social media platforms - facebook, twitter, Instagram etc
Use the Indiegogo share tools
Can you distribute flyers, stickers, badges?
Can you organise a coffee morning or other fundraising social?

Download a fundraising pack here
We can do this!
Thanks for reading.  xxxx
Karen and all the volunteers and helpers.

story:
Archangel Michael Project Summary

Hi, my name is Christie and I am an artist and lightworker.

Recently I’ve been guided by Archangel Michael to create a painting of him and to help him in his work by getting his image out in front of the eyes of as many people as possible.

Just by visiting this page you can help in this project because I'm offering a free way to participate (in addition to purchasing Perks.) You can find out about it by watching the video, and I'll tell you about it again below. But first, let me explain a little about this painting and this project.

If you’re with me so far you probably know who Archangel Michael is, but in case you don't, to put it briefly he is the archangel of protection. He also helps people find and follow their purpose.

So what's the point of sharing this image? 

Everything that exists vibrates at a certain energetic frequency. What’s more, everything we come into contact with affects our vibration. That means that the things you hear, touch, or see really do change you on an energetic level. 

Some things affect us positively, in a healthy, uplifting way. Others negatively, in a way that is not so good for us. 

Lower vibration energies (including visual images) create negative reactions within us - such as fear - that encourage us to respond from our lower, ego selves.

Higher vibration objects and experiences make it easier for our higher selves to take the lead.  And that brings us (eventually) to a life brimming with peace, love, and joy.

So it’s really important to surround ourselves with high vibration things that will support us energetically. 

One of the things I do as a lightworker-artist is to sense spirit guides and guardian angels, then translate them into beautiful paintings that help raise people’s spiritual vibration when they are viewed.  

This painting resonates with the very high spiritual frequency of Michael the Archangel.

Following the principle of resonance, viewing this image activates the Archangel Michael energy already present within you, and within the room it is displayed in. Meditating on this painting, or just having it in your space, can help shield you from lower vibration influences in your environment. 

This piece of art is also an invitation from Michael to focus on the Light. He says not to be afraid, that he and his allies will help you and support you when you choose to align your life choices with what your Higher Self is longing to do.

Michael’s energy is very real and accessible to everyone. But we have to be willing to allow him to help us. 

And that starts with being aware of his presence, and inviting it into our lives. 

The Impact

Right now, we're at a critical turning point as the world shifts into a higher vibration of consciousness. More and more people are starting to awaken to their higher selves. However it's not an easy process and there is a LOT of energetic resistance.

Personally, I've struggled with this resistance for years. From the time I was old enough to hold a crayon, I knew I was meant to be an artist. But somewhere along the way I became afraid to follow my dream. It got so bad that at one point I hardly picked up a brush for 10 years. 

I'm not alone. There are SO many people on the planet today with amazing gifts who could bring so much healing into the world. But they're paralyzed with fear, their gifts unrecognized and underused.

Archangel Michael's energy is helping me - and many others - to break out of this old pattern. The more people call on him and invite his energy in, the stronger a presence it will have in the world. That's what this project is all about. Will you help? 

This project will do two things:

First, it will help fund some intense spiritual training I'm taking that is getting me in closer communication with Michael and which will allow me to continue to create even more deeply healing works and through which I hope to inspire many others (maybe you?) to shake off their own resistance and move forward towards living their purpose. The funds raised in this project will also help pay for a video camera (to get time-lapse paintings out on YouTube) :-) art supplies, framing, and all the other expenses artists face.

Here is my budget:

$8,000 - spiritual training and travel expenses

$2500 - printing costs

$500 - HD video camera & related equipment

$110 - art supplies (watercolor paper & paint)


Second, and most importantly, it will help Archangel Michael increase his presence in the world.  Michael's energy is SO needed right now and is being brought to the forefront in so many ways to assist in clearing away negative energies and helping humanity to come to its senses!


Enjoy the Love & Protection of Archangel Michael in your home or office

As I worked on this painting, Michael instructed me to make this image of him available and accessible to everyone. 

How to Take Part in the Archangel Michael Project for FREE

First of all, they won't let me offer an official Perk for free but I wanted to do everything I can to help Michael with his outreach efforts. So what I've decided to do is to make the Archangel Michael image I've posted above available under the Creative Commons attribution license.  
It's a smaller, lower resolution file than the one I'm using to create the fine art prints and Perks, but it's good enough for many purposes and certainly good enough to share online. So I encourage you to post it on social media, use it on your website, or on fliers, or wherever you think Michael's energy will do the highest good.  Download it for free here, and see where Michael suggests you post it! :-)

(I won't require you to link back to this page, or to my Facebook page, but I would very much appreciate it, and doing so will help the Project reach even more people.)

How to Become a Champion Supporter

You can help bring even more Michael energy into the world by purchasing one or more of the Perks at right. I’ve created a number of Perks to choose from, and every Perk comes with a special blessing! :-)
I want this to be affordable to everyone, so prices start at $10. Larger Perks are also available for those who feel called to support this project in a bigger way or would like a more intense infusion of Archangel Michael energy.
Whichever Perk calls to you, once you receive it will help you more easily tune in to Archangel Michael’s energy. This will protect you from fear and ego-based illusion, and help you stand in the Light so you can more easily realize and manifest your purpose in the world. 
The Perks are: 
$10: Archangel Michael printable calling cards. 

See full description at right. These pdf files are royalty-free and fully Photoshop-editable, so you can adapt them as you wish - even turn them into business cards if you like. If you purchase this or any Perk I will also send you a Blessing and a big Thank-You on my Facebook page. 
$20: Archangel Michael postcard. I will personally sign a postcard featuring Archangel Michael and send it to you anywhere in the world. Frame it for the perfect addition to your personal altar! You will also get the Archangel Michael Calling Card files and everything that goes with them. 
$44: Archangel Michael 11"x14" open edition giclee print. 

Signed fine art giclee print. Details at right!
$111: Archangel Michael Art Gifting Pack. Gift Michael's love and protection all around! Package includes three signed Open Edition archival prints, and a pack of 8 Archangel Michael greeting cards (some locations outside the U.S. may receive a 4th print instead of the cards.) All make great gifts. Of course you'll also receive the Michael Calling Card package, too. This is the best deal on prints!
$200: Custom Angel drawing and intuitive reading. 
One of the things I do as a spiritual artist is to sense spirit guides and guardian angels, then translate them into a beautiful piece of art that helps raise people’s spiritual vibration when is is viewed. It’s especially resonant for the specific people I painted them for because it helps them maintain their connection with their angels, but they are effective for everyone who sees them. 
With this Perk you get a beautiful, one-of-a-kind original piece of channeled art containing the image and energy of your very own Guardian Angel, plus a personal angel reading recorded on mp3. Graphite pencil or other black-and-white media on archival fine art paper, includes Certificate of Authenticity. Read more details at right.


 $444: Limited edition Archangel Michael 24"x36" print. 

Printed at the same size as the original painting, this fine art print resonates with the high healing vibration of Archangel Michael to bring protection and clarity to all who enter your home. Signed and printed on archival watercolor paper under the close supervision of the artist. I am only printing 25 of these, ever, and making only 15 available at this time. Once they are sold, they will never again be available in this size or quality. Includes Certificate of Authenticity. Bonus for Indiegogo customers only: I will also include a poster print and an intuitive Angel reading recorded on mp3. (And of course you will also receive the Michael Calling Card package.) 
Includes shipping to anywhere in the world. (U.S. orders shipped flat; international orders may be sent rolled depending on location.) 
$555: Custom Guardian Angel painting and intuitive reading. 

One of the things I do as a spiritual artist is to sense spirit guides and guardian angels, then translate them into a beautiful painting that helps raise people’s spiritual vibration when is is viewed. It’s especially resonant for the specific people I painted them for, but they are effective for everyone who sees them. 

A Custom Guardian Angel painting is a beautiful, original piece of watercolor fine art containing the channeled image and energy of your very own Guardian Angel, plus a personal angel reading recorded on mp3. Genuine watercolor on archival paper, includes Certificate of Authenticity.Your choice of sizes - 10x7, 9x12 or 11x14. (Some people prefer the more intimate size for use on a personal altar.)   This is a special offer for Indiegogo customers only, and includes an 11"x14" Archangel Michael print, plus everything in the Michael Calling Card package. 

$1,111: Your Angel and You Custom Painting and Reading. 

A beautiful portrait of yourself with your Guardian Angel. Or your child with their Angel. Or perhaps a portrait of you with Archangel Michael himself? (Why not??)  Additional figures in the same painting add $200 per figure. Genuine watercolor on archival paper, includes Certificate of Authenticity and channeled recording containing wisdom from your angels. Your choice of sizes -  11x14 or 16x20. (Some people prefer the more intimate size for use on a personal altar.) For Indiegogo customers only, I will also include an 11"x14" Archangel Michael print, plus everything in the Michael Calling Card package. 
$4,444: Archangel Michael Original Watercolor Painting. 


Viewing the original painting is the most optimal way to experience Archangel Michael's spiritual strength and protection channeled through this work of art. In my angel paintings, I like to use an iridescent medium that introduces a subtle sparkle impossible to reproduce in a print. You will see it in Michaels's wings, hair, halo, and the orb of light. This original 23"x36" watercolor painting is on highest quality Arches paper. I will also include a custom Guardian Angel painting and channeled Reading for Indiegogo customers only. Signed, and includes Certificate of Authenticity. 
There's only one original. You can own it.
$11,110: Custom Angel Mural. I will travel to your home, business or place of worship and create a custom channeled mural just for you. You will also receive a bonus limited edition Archangel Michael print and an Angel Reading, plus the Calling Card Package, of course. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Archangel Michael is coming into the world right now in a very big way to assist in a tremendous shift in consciousness that is happening on this planet right now. We’ve reached a critical point where to preserve ourselves as a species, and more importantly to raise the level of consciousness in the universe, we have got to start freeing ourselves of ego-based fears and start thinking, speaking and acting out of Love. That's what Michael is here to help us do!

If you can't support a Perk right now, please consider helping in other ways. Here are some thoughts:

  • Download the Michael painting from this page and share it around. Link back to this page if you can, and/or to other good pages about Archangel Michael (such as on Doreen Virtue's website.)
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about this campaign.
  • Ask your friends to share, too!
  • Ask bloggers you know to spread the word about the Archangel Michael project.
  • If you have a blog or a podcast, consider writing a post about Archangel Michael. Use the image I've provided.
  • I'd be happy to contribute to your blog or podcast if you like - just ask!

Thank you so much for your time and attention. I look forward to being in touch.

Namaste!
