story:
Bref résumé

Les 5 dernières années de ma vie ont été si tordues et chaotiques que j'ai fini, contre toute attente, par en faire quelque chose. Mon bordel intérieur m'a permis de créer un mode de vie qui me ressemble, en accord avec mes principes et qui arrive, je le pense, à rendre le monde autour de moi heureux. 

Mon métier est celui de l'image, de l'écriture et de la création.

Écrire ça va. 

J'suis encore capable de le faire couchée ou assise sur le rebord d'une falaise.

Mais l'image.

Je suis arrivée au bout de mes emprunts et de mes locations.

J'ai besoin de matériel de qualité afin de pouvoir exercer mon métier de façon sérieuse et autonome,  j'en appelle donc à votre généreuse participation émancipatoire.

L'achat d'un appareil photo full frame mirrorless (style Sony A7/lumix) équipé d'un mode vidéo de qualité et d'une couple de lentilles (24-70/85/55)

  •  Est une dépense onéreuse nécessaire
  • Afin de pouvoir pousser plus loin mes projets de films, de reportages et de photos
  •  Cet argent que vous investissez vous sera rendu en services que je vais vous énumérer, ou que vous pouvez me proposer !
  •  Et en général vous serez non seulement fiers d'avoir pu contribuer à l'essor d'une artiste, mais vous pourrez en plus vous féliciter d'avoir permis à ses proches de ne plus avoir à subir ses demandes insupportables. Vous faites donc un COMBO de bonnes actions : vous investissez dans la culture et vous sauvez des amitiés
  • Vous devenez une sorte de dieu
  • Vous pouvez enfin vous rattraper pour toutes les fois que j'ai travaillé pour vous gratuitement ou pour un prix absolument dérisoire 

 L'impact

Grâce à votre aide, je pourrai

  • Continuer mon projet féministe FEMME TOUT NU
  • Lancer d'autres projets immersifs engagés et les exposer
  • Faire mon livre
  • Vous prendre en photo
  • Prendre en photo les autres
  • Prendre en photo des choses importantes
  • Imprimer ces choses importantes et en faire des cadres qui pourront aller sur le mur de votre château
  • Faire des oeuvres qui vous feront rêver, rire ou vous poser des questions
  • Continuer à vivre, manger et payer mon loyer

 Risques et défis

Évidemment, si je perd mon mojo d'un seul coup, mettons qu'un matin je me réveille et je ne sais plus me servir d'un kodak, ou que tout le monde se mette à détester mon travail jusqu'à m'interdire d'être à moins de 50 mètres d'une caméra, on pourra alors conclure que c'était un investissement malheureux. 

Si ça arrive, je vous promet qu'on ira s'en parler calmement dans un sweat lodge.

 D'autres façons d'aider

Si vous ne pouvez pas participer, ce n'est pas grave. Je vous aimerai pareil. Mais j'ai quand même besoin urgemment de m'acheter du matériel.

Je vous aime. 

Crissement.
story_txt:
Bref résumé
Les 5 dernières années de ma vie ont été si tordues et chaotiques que j'ai fini, contre toute attente, par en faire quelque chose. Mon bordel intérieur m'a permis de créer un mode de vie qui me ressemble, en accord avec mes principes et qui arrive, je le pense, à rendre le monde autour de moi heureux. 
Mon métier est celui de l'image, de l'écriture et de la création.
Écrire ça va. 
J'suis encore capable de le faire couchée ou assise sur le rebord d'une falaise.
Mais l'image.
Je suis arrivée au bout de mes emprunts et de mes locations.
J'ai besoin de matériel de qualité afin de pouvoir exercer mon métier de façon sérieuse et autonome,  j'en appelle donc à votre généreuse participation émancipatoire.


L'achat d'un appareil photo full frame mirrorless (style Sony A7/lumix) équipé d'un mode vidéo de qualité et d'une couple de lentilles (24-70/85/55)

 Est une dépense onéreuse nécessaire
Afin de pouvoir pousser plus loin mes projets de films, de reportages et de photos
 Cet argent que vous investissez vous sera rendu en services que je vais vous énumérer, ou que vous pouvez me proposer !
 Et en général vous serez non seulement fiers d'avoir pu contribuer à l'essor d'une artiste, mais vous pourrez en plus vous féliciter d'avoir permis à ses proches de ne plus avoir à subir ses demandes insupportables. Vous faites donc un COMBO de bonnes actions : vous investissez dans la culture et vous sauvez des amitiés
Vous devenez une sorte de dieu
Vous pouvez enfin vous rattraper pour toutes les fois que j'ai travaillé pour vous gratuitement ou pour un prix absolument dérisoire 


 L'impact
Grâce à votre aide, je pourrai

Continuer mon projet féministe FEMME TOUT NU
Lancer d'autres projets immersifs engagés et les exposer
Faire mon livre
Vous prendre en photo
Prendre en photo les autres
Prendre en photo des choses importantes
Imprimer ces choses importantes et en faire des cadres qui pourront aller sur le mur de votre château
Faire des oeuvres qui vous feront rêver, rire ou vous poser des questions
Continuer à vivre, manger et payer mon loyer


 Risques et défis
 Évidemment, si je perd mon mojo d'un seul coup, mettons qu'un matin je me réveille et je ne sais plus me servir d'un kodak, ou que tout le monde se mette à détester mon travail jusqu'à m'interdire d'être à moins de 50 mètres d'une caméra, on pourra alors conclure que c'était un investissement malheureux. 
Si ça arrive, je vous promet qu'on ira s'en parler calmement dans un sweat lodge.

 D'autres façons d'aider
Si vous ne pouvez pas participer, ce n'est pas grave. Je vous aimerai pareil. Mais j'ai quand même besoin urgemment de m'acheter du matériel.
Je vous aime. 
Crissement.

story:
Paint Your Freedom

Hello art supporters, it exciting to take part in Galerie Miscre8 future. You are allowing our doors to open into the world of art, with your contributions. As an artist I'm truly appreciative, My name is Miscre8 i'm the creator of the intro cartoon skit above and the owner of Galerie Miscre8. People who know me, and for those who don't, Welcome to my creative roller coster ride I called my art life. I have been creating art ever since I could hold a pencil or a spray can. My art has transform into a unique style I call urban contemporary.  Becoming more aware, positive, and appreciative which lead me to take my art career in a different direction more gallery and lifestyle brand. That path lead me back to what I truly love my art. Residing in Las Vegas, I came across a small 10x10 art studio in 2010 located on the iconic Fremont St. inside a building call Emergency Arts. An old re-model medical center in las Vegas. I created Lil Art Bodega Creative a clever way to pay homage to New York City graffiti shops. The city were my art life started. Three years later I moved to a 8x20ft shipping container inside of Container Park a unique mall downtown Las Vegas.  Creating a west coast buzz for myself and my shop  business grew. I started needing more space for classes and workshop.  Now you have a quick rundown of my art life. With these blessing I have secured an amazing art space for this new gallery launch called Galerie Miscre8.

Having a 800sq. foot outlet for an unorthodox Art Gallery that practice in urban contemporary art. Is needing help with the build-out of the gallery! Here's why:

GALERIE MISCRE8 will operates as an artist-run space because of the freedom it affords us. Functioning as a non-commercial entity gives us the flexibility and independence in making a culture shift by exhibiting works by Female Artists focusing on bringing balance to the art world. This gives Galerie miscre8  a positive outlook and venturous work free of commercial pressures and limitations. As an experience talented professional artist with a Bachelor of Fine Arts Graphic Design my travels, exhibits, showcases, murals, graphic designs and teachings let's me give back my expertise to the young and old and everyone in between experience art in a positive and happy way.

What We Need & What You Get

I secured an amazing new raw space for Galerie Miscre8, it requires a bit of work.  What I did not factor in are construction work permits and the COO (certificate of occupancy) in order to open the galerie. This is my first experience constructing a 800q ft shell of a space by installing A/C, Electric outlets, Walls, Floor, etc. I have covered most of the costs and Me & friend are doing most of the labor & design work ourselves. However, I need some help with unforeseen costs:

WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO?

$1,000 - Architecture floor plans, permits

$2,000 - Material & Labor (electrician) Outlets, Safety signs

$1000 - Signage & Marketing material

$3000 - Materials: art hanging system, tracking lights, Struts, furnishing, shelving

$1000 - Start up supplies (youth program)

$800 - other fees (indie go go's 5%, etc.)

___________

$8,800.00 = TOTAL HELP

We want to continue to explore the possibilities of an artist-run space in Las Vegas NV, and with your help we can do that. Check out our random perks that will be EXCLUSIVE for Galerie MIscre8 Much Love Edition for donating! 

 

The Impact

While LIL ART BODEGA at Container Park, will certainly be missed, we couldn't be more excited about the opportunities to grow our sister company GALERIE MISCRE8. Here's what we're looking forward to with our re-launch:

  • Central location providing easier access to the gallery 
  • More space for artwork, workshop, classes, youth program and events
  • Potential to build partnerships within local company and beyond
  • Greater exposure for the artists & Six-week long exhibitions 
  • Exhibiting works by female artists local and international artists at all points in their career
  • Host and provide a showcase space and participate in auxiliary events & pop-up shows

Risks & Challenges

Everything in life is a risk and some type of challenge when building a business and a team. I took a leap of faith in myself and place all of my money, strength and time into this business of art. This is a new re-lunch, there are obstacles that Galerie Miscre8 must prepare for and overcome with everyone's help. Galerie Miscre8 has:

  • an aggressive timeline,
  • a big vision,
  • the need for dedicated volunteer 
  • the backing of creative people who can help us overcome these challenges.

I have no money! How can I help?

  • Spread the word! People need to know about this campaign. 
  • Love, comment and share the news on Instagram or Facebook, Twitter.
  • Follow us on Instagram @miscre8 @galeriemiscre8
  • Much Luv and Respect, for your help and your support!

About Us & View More Art

http://www.miscre8.com/welcome.html

http://www.galerimiscre8.com

http://www.lilartbodega.com

story:
Bref résumé

 

Un premier film entièrement tourné dans Chaudière-Appalaches est-ce possible? La réponse est évidemment oui!  Je suis Feber E. Coyote, cinéaste et auteur-compositeur-interprète qui travaille sur le territoire depuis près de 10 ans autant en documentaire que fiction, en plus d'écrire et interpréter ma musique.  Hank est en ville est mon premier film long métrage de fiction et est partit d'une idée de faire une sorte de portrait western de la Beauce (endroit où j'ai grandit) .  Le projet a évolué pendant quelques années et c'est finalement en 2018 que le premier tour de manivelle a été donné.  Autofinancé en partie, le film use de créativité et de ressources connexes et grâce aux collaborateurs de plus en plus nombreux le film a de plus en plus de fans et d'espérance de faire un succès! 

La distribution du film compte des acteurs chevronnés de renoms tels que Michael Kelly (Yamaska, District 31), Geneviève Néron (La moitié gauche du Frigo, Virginie), Martin Jr. Pelletier (Hochelaga Terre des hommes) et l'Arizonien Howe Gelb (Jackie).

Un film western-policier oui... mais qui traite également de la musique western... un hommage au cinéma-direct et aux pionniers de la musique country au Québec.

L'impact d'un tel projet est évidemment un plus pour la région de Chaudière-Appalaches mais pour le Québec en entier car c'est toute la manière de financer les films qu'il faut revoir et Hank est en ville est en soit un exemple de détermination et de courage pour aller au bout de ses rêves... Nous croyons vraiment qu'en incluant les gens dans l'aventure de la création du film,  la population se sentira plus interpellée et consommera différemment la culture !  La question qui demeure est : Voulez-vous faire partie de l'aventure?

Les sous que nous demandons seront directement investis dans la post-production du film pour permettre d'avoir des effets spéciaux encore plus Hank-croyable, et une mise en marché encore plus grande pour que le film soit vu en salle et ailleurs...  Nous travaillons beaucoup sur le web pour pousser le projet, mais nous voulons briser les barrières et aller rejoindre un plus gros bassin de population encore. Un investissement de votre part est un appui direct qui fait la différence!

Comme vous le savez peut-être, un film ne se fait pas tout seul.. les génériques peuvent en témoigner et c'est pourquoi nous sollicitons votre aide précieuse! 

 

Merci de nous permettre d'illustrer à notre façon ce qui manque dans le paysage cinématographique québécois!

Merci de partager à tous vos contacts et faisons en sorte que nous atteignons notre objectif du 10 000$ dans les plus brefs délais!

Hi haaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa

Feber

Feber

story:
Fort McMurray experienced economic collapse in 2014 and then, in 2016 came "The Beast": a massive wildfire that forced the evacuation of the entire city and became Canada's most expensive natural disaster.  The city could use some love from the rest of the province and the country! One way to make a difference and recognize the region's character is in the realm of public art: let's build and erect a statue of Alberta's most famous fictional character, Wolverine!

We are inspired by and are following the city of Detroit, which envisioned, funded and now will install a statue of that city's famous fictional resident: Robocop. They raised enough money to create a bronze statue that will be installed in the spring of 2018. We are inspired by how that  community obtained the necessary permissions. We have already started conversations with the Regional Municipality of Wood Buffalo (City of Fort McMurray) and we will approach Marvel once fundraising is complete.  

The majority of funds raised will go towards creating a bronze statue of Wolverine, which includes materials, design, labour, transportation and installation.  Based on the costs of the Robocop statue, we are looking to raise approximately $85,000.

Alberta has a number of interesting landmarks including a giant Easter egg, beaver, baseball bat, pyrogy, a UFO landing pad and a replica Starship Enterprise. This project is another way to artistically and aesthetically contribute to the community and the province solely through private dollars.

If you contribute, our perks will include having your name publicly recognized on social media as well as on an accompanying website that will thank all of our contributors. Other perk details to follow.

And finally, if for some reason, we are unable to proceed with the construction, all funds raised will  be refunded or go towards the preservation of wolverines (the species!) in Northern Alberta.

story:
Hi my names Tim

 

I am a super passionate and committed visual artist. I've spent the last 11 years, studying, teaching and making studio art, public art and community art. My dream is to grow my audience base and market for my artwork to a point where sales are my main income source. This year I have been given the opportunity to have a booth at The Other Art Fair in Sydney between the 21st and 25th of March, this will mean reaching literally thousands of new viewers and potential buyers. I had to provide the money upfront but I borrowed most of it and that has left me in a difficult situation, struggling to keep my normal living costs at bay and buy framing materials, insurance and other necessary bits for the art fair.  Its not far away now and I'm getting excited but I am in need of financial assistance to help me pay back the money I have borrowed, so that I can continue to pay for my normal living costs and take time off my day jobs to drive to Sydney for a week to do the art fair. 

The minimum booth for The Other Art Fair is $2200 Australian, I have spent around $500 on framing materials and tools so far (I'm doing it myself!!!), $280 on public liability insurance, $20 on packing materials. There are more costs on top of this but those are the major part for which I am asking assistance. These numbers total $3000 Australian but Indiegogo uses US Dollars so this equates to $2355 USD.

I am not the sort of person to ask for help usually, I had never dreamt of doing a crowdfunding campaign, but this is a special opportunity and I really want to make the most of it. 6 years ago I was offered to take my art to an art fair in Asia, but I turned it down due to the high costs associated with it, this time I am determined to make it happen. 

I will very happily reward any donations/contributions by giving artwork or tutorials or both as you wish. All donations great and small are welcome and will be greatly appreciated. Even if you can only spare a very small amount, it all helps and will make this project a little easier and more productive for me.

Donation Reward Breakdown - What You Get For Helping

Donations under $4 USD will get a big thank you and your name listed as a supporter on my website.

Donations of $4 USD will get one of my super rad new stickers posted to their door and  a big thank you and your name listed as a supporter on my website.

 

Donations of $8 USD will get 2 of my super rad new stickers posted to their door and  a big thank you and your name listed as a supporter on my website.

Donations of $16 USD will get an uber cool custom ceramic brooch, a big thank you and their name listed as a supporter on my website.

Donations of $24 USD will get the choice of a ceramic vase, cup, brooch or a half hour lesson on any aspect of art making , skateboarding, gourmet home cooking or any other related skills sharing (provided that I have them), a big thank you and their name listed as a supporter on my website. Teaching can be provided in digital video for those geographically challenged ie not living in the northern rivers area. 

Donations of $40 USD will get the choice of two ceramic cups, vases, brooches , small sculptures, digital art prints or a one hour lesson custom tailored to your specific needs on drawing, sculpture, ceramics, skateboarding, gourmet home cooking or DIY LYF, a big thank you and their name listed as a supporter on my website. Teaching can be provided digitally as required (video). 

Donations of $80 USD can choose from a small custom mixed media drawing,  ceramic sculpture, series of 4 ceramic cups or vases, 4 digital prints, or 2 custom lessons in any of the following areas: drawing, sculpture, ceramics, skateboarding, gourmet home cooking or DIY LYF. You also get a huge thank you and a listing as a super supporter on my website. 

Donations of $160 USD and above can choose from custom or pre-made artworks: drawings (framed or unframed depending on size), ceramic sculpture, functional ceramics eg cups or vases, custom tailored lessons in: drawing, sculpture, ceramics, skateboarding, gourmet home cooking or general DIY. You also get a huge thank you and a listing as a super supporter on my website. 

If you are too broke to help out financially that's cool, I understand but you can still help by sharing this campaign with your friends!

story:
Short Summary

I've always been a person who loves to create things. It's been a spontaneous driving force of mine throughout my life. The raw enjoyment that comes from getting to realize my imaginings is beyond any words one could possibly use.

With this campaign, I hope to be able to acquire enough of a kickstart in order to begin realizing my idea into reality.

This campaign will help me achieve this dream and eventually allow me to create lines of various sculptures and models of various characters and personas from a multitude of different fanbases. 

I hope to be able to give back to the people who supported me with some nifty trinkets that they can happily display on their shelves of their favorite personas and characters.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I will need a minimum of approximately $600 for this first campaign in order to get the necessary supplies to begin this project successfully. The supplies will be comprised of custom packaging material for shipping completed sculpts securely in a classy way (cardboard, plastic, foam, etc), materials needed to color sculpts and packaging (paint, spray paint, enamel paints, inks), necessary materials for casts and molds with resin needed to create the sculpt replicas for order, premium sculpting clay essential to create the molds for the sculptures, hand torches and pressured cool air needed for sculpting, and tools needed for sculpting.

Contributors may receive a miniature sample or print as a thank you

Should the goal not be reached, I will utilize what funds have been attained and use them to at least acquire some materials necessary for the project (though, depending on the amount, it will depend on just how many supplies I can procure).

The Impact

My project will allow me to produce custom sculptures of people's interest while getting to have fun with the experience of doing so. There are quite a lot of different ideas people have that just have not been produced! So giving people a way for their interests to be realized in sculpture form by yours truly, with direct public input, would be of rather significant interest to many.

I have experience with creating things and completing projects in general. Though it might not be as extensive as professionals out there, as a hobbyist/amateur, I have managed to create some rather involved works over a broad spectrum of mediums, including foam, plastic, paints, inks, digital, cgi, etc.

If there are ANY questions about this project whatsoever, feel absolutely free to ask me directly! I will be happy to answer all of your questions as necessary.

 

Risks & Challenges

It is inevitable that difficulties will arise with the pursuance of this project, whether it be deficient funding, lack of public awareness, time constraints, etc.

However, I am rather determined to get this project rolling as soon as possible. I have been through numerous ruts before, but from patience and determination, my passion was able to help me through the obstacles somehow.

In the end, I am sure that I will manage to do something regarding this project so I can finally get to offer up something new and interesting from yours truly.

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, I also totally understand that not everyone can contribute a donation to this kickstarter, and that's ok!

There is something else you can do instead, which is spread the word by sharing on your social media and with your friends, family, and peers around you!

 

 

Thank you!

story:
I'm Bobby Danger of Danger Artworks, established in 2009 in Durham, North Carolina where I was born and raised.  Art is the way I communicate with others and with the world.  It is the way I deal with the insane level of stress that comes from being black or brown in this country.  I’ve encountered racism on many levels throughout my life, both blatant and subtle, directly and indirectly.  Being the target of any kind of hate is traumatic, confusing and frightening.  No history book can prepare you for it.  We are taught that racism is always loud and obvious; it is not.  We are taught that only certain types of people are racist; this is not true.  We are taught that slavery ended and slaves were set free; our society today proves that those wounds are still wide open.  

In 2014, I spent a summer in New York collaborating with my best friend, Alex Ghassan.  Alex was an independent photographer, videographer and director. He filmed and edited a powerful music video for Skyzoo named “Spike Lee Was My Hero” that landed him an invitation to the official 25th Anniversary commemoration for the release of “Do The Right Thing.”  I was fortunate enough to be able to accompany him to this event and meet Spike Lee himself, which was something I never dreamed I would have the opportunity to do.  I grew up admiring him and fearing the truths he put front and center where they belong.  Meeting him was surreal. The entire experience of being in New York that summer made me realize that I could use my own talent to speak to the world and maybe even inspire a bit of much needed change.  I was moved to think of my art as my voice.  

Another event of 2014 gave my work a new focus and intention.   The strangulation of Eric Garner at the hands of police led me to call attention to the magnitude of this kind of social injustice in the black community.  Eric Garner’s death, like many others, truly drove home how quickly and easily lives and communities can be destroyed by the very people and things meant to protect us.  That summer in New York with Alex provided the creative energy needed to bring together an illustration I had started but was not sure how to finish.  Alex helped me brainstorm and fueled my determination to bring awareness and attention to what I could no longer be silent about.  Out of this collaboration came the completed colored pencil illustration I now call, “Say It Loud.”  I took the powerful image of the iconic character “Buggin’ Out” from “Do The Right Thing” and placed a crowd of silent protestors behind him with their hands up to demonstrate the obvious.  The juxtaposition of Buggin’ Out’s shock-filled expression against the calm, tired faces of the crowd of black men and women holding up their hands represents the backwards movement of racism that Spike Lee highlighted over three decades ago.  Tragedies caused by racism happen far too often.  As artists, I believe it is our duty to highlight and draw attention to this.

I finished the piece and shortly after, my friend Alex left this earth unexpectedly and far too soon.  This loss came on the tail end of two other significant losses I had experienced recently, and truly stopped me in my creative tracks.  Recently, and eerily timed with the news of the injustice served in the exoneration of Eric Garner’s killer, I came back to life with a mission and determination unmatched.  I realized that I owe it to Alex to keep the momentum this piece inspired in me.  I realized that I couldn’t give up or sit still while this is the atmosphere we still live in 30 years post release of “Do The Right Thing.”

So here I am.  The seed was planted for this project in 2014, and finally today it has grown into an endeavor that cannot fail. This campaign supports a collection of artwork by Bobby Danger of Danger Artworks with commentary and writing by Karen Ashley of LYTM Photography.  It will ultimately break down the message put forth in my piece “Say It Loud.”  This project will examine the various "states" of racism in this country.  Racism exists in corporations, armed forces, sports, housing and education and transportation.  Those in a privileged position often overlook the inequities and injustice in these areas that people of color experience every day – sometimes unintentionally.  If we are not conscious of it, we cannot change them.  This project will highlight the less obvious ways in which people of color are challenged, doubted and judged according to stereotypes or preconceived notions.

This project is my protest and my contribution to the collective call to all artists to keep fighting for what is right.  Those already leading the way, especially those in my hometown, inspire me as I hope to inspire others.  For now, I am ready to keep going with more determination than I have ever had.  This time, I’m not alone.

Joining Danger Artworks as of 2019 is, writer, editor and photographer, Karen Ashley.  Karen’s writing skills and passion for social justice align perfectly with my artistic endeavors, so we decided to join forces to double our impact. 

Stay tuned for our blog, The United States of Racism that will document the progress of this project so that you can truly be a part of it every step of the way.  We will also use the blog to provide our followers with exclusive information on shows and products related to the cause.  Our mission is to release the final versions of the illustrations and paintings progressively until the series is complete.  We will then present the project in art shows, festivals, and other avenues to inspire others to join us stand strong against injustice in black and brown communities.  Our hope is to eventually publish a book with the final collection that will change hearts and policies alike to make this country a safer, more humane place to raise our families.

 

Your contribution will help us with the initial costs required to get this project moving.  It will support the purchase of art supplies and office/studio equipment necessary to complete unfinished artwork and to create new pieces.  If we reach our initial goal, the campaign will remain open and help us bring this project to completion sooner rather than later.  If the campaign is able to remain open, funds that continue to be raised will assist with art show preparation including custom framing of each piece.  If you'd like to see a detailed breakdown of the allocation of funds, please visit the FAQ section.  You can also support Karen and me in the following ways:

Follow The United States of Racism Blog once it launches.

Follow us on Instagram @theunitedstatesofracism.

Follow Danger Artworks on Facebook, @dangerartworks on Instagram. 

Order prints or “Happy Hippy” gear at Dangerartworks.com.

Follow LYTM Photography on Facebook and Instagram.

If you live in North Carolina, book a Photo Session with LYTM Photography.

Spread the word about this campaign any way that you can - Share!  Share!  Share!

       
We can’t thank you enough for your contribution and support, but mostly for joining us on this journey.

Follow The United States of Racism Blog once it launches.
Follow us on Instagram @theunitedstatesofracism.
Follow Danger Artworks on Facebook, @dangerartworks on Instagram. 
Order prints or “Happy Hippy” gear at Dangerartworks.com.
Follow LYTM Photography on Facebook and Instagram.
If you live in North Carolina, book a Photo Session with LYTM Photography.
Spread the word about this campaign any way that you can - Share!  Share!  Share!


 
 
 
 

We can’t thank you enough for your contribution and support, but mostly for joining us on this journey.

story:
Happy and Free is the place to be!

Hi! I'm Jennifer Price Davis, an artist, author & illustrator of 5 children's books, and preschool teacher.  I live, work, and create in Cleveland, Ohio, with my husband, son, and our dog Coal.

Two years ago, I was having a rough day at lunchtime, when I noticed that I forgot to pack myself a cookie. I fessed up, to a class of very sympathetic 3-6 year old children, that I was not having a very good day at all. Genevieve (Genny) Serena Davis came to life that day and "Not a very good day at all," became the title of my first book! 

Five books later (six by the end of this year) I longed to create more stories that centered children with marginalized identities, where they weren't explaining their existence; rather, experiencing their everyday life. I want more children to see themselves reflected in literature and central to the story. Instead of me dreaming up what it *might* be like to live in  a body or life that is unfamiliar to me, I knew it was time to expand beyond my own books. I decided to create a publishing company and digital space called Happy and Free Kid's Space! The name signifies my intention to contribute to a society where children and all people can be happy and free - where it is safe to be as we are. (I wrote a theme song for that!)

The future of Happy and Free Kid's Space is an online space that includes music, movement, and more!

  • In  year 1, I plan to have the logo and website for Happy and Free, Kid's space developed, establish a social media presence promoting Genny books + one book I am illustrating for another author, the theme song recorded and incorporated into the website. Merchandise and consider a membership model to generate revenue (access to videos will always be free.)
  • Between year 1-2 Further develop online programming including reading books aloud, recording of additional songs and collaborative videos (where people are encouraged to record their family/community dancing and singing along.) Consider a podcast.
  • Proceeding years will include seeking out additional authors to publish and creating relevant  content.
  • Behind the scenes, I hope to create a Happy and Free organization that embodies what we are creating in every way: a supportive and inclusive space with fair wages.

Here's a sample of one of the songs I've written:

 "Confidence!"

 

Aesthetic

Here's a sample of the aesthetic of Happy and Free Kid's space! This is painted by me and will be made into overalls. I have several other patterns, and this will mix with the aesthetic that various guests and community participants will bring. I envision beautiful layers of personality expressed through patterns and colors.

 

Outcomes

By creating a digital space, the books read aloud and captioned, music, and information available will be accessible to more children. Additionally, with resources available to adults who care for children, I intend to support:

  • positive and compassionate interactions 
  • non-binary perspectives
  • fat-affirming, body-supportive spaces
  • inclusion of children of varying abilities, socio-economic status, etc.
  • making space for children who identify as LGBTQ+ or who have LGBTQ+ family members
  • reduction in occurrences of aging black and brown children up (seeing them as older than they are) and
  • disproportionately punishing these children. 

I realize my dream is big, and yet as an artist completing my own projects over the last 10+ years and with over 15 years working with children and young adults aged 18 months to college, always with a focus on social justice, I know that with your support, this dream will be a reality!

I deeply appreciate your contribution!

 

How you can help

I am seeking $25,000 in funding to launch Happy and Free Kid's Space. The bulk of the funds will go toward the establishment of Happy and Free Kid's Space, including purchase of the domain, outsourcing the building of the website and support with video creation, purchase of ISBN numbers, and  a computer that will help me move and manage my titles to my own device (I currently share a laptop with my very generous son. He's going to college soon!) 

Costs (these are estimates and are short of $25,000 because I will have to adjust for fees, funds held in reserve, supplies for perks and any surprise expenses.)

  • Domain and website: ~$400-500 annually to allow for free material, as well as the sale of books and merchandise like stickers, totes, and t-shirts
  • Purchase of ISBN numbers: $575 for 100 numbers (they are sold individually, 10, 100, or 1000)
  • Computer to store books, host meetings, etc.: ~$1500-2000
  • Creating of small set for videos: ~$500 including painting, purchase of a reading chair, lights 
  • Consulting on establishing publishing company and contracts: ~ $1000
  • Video creation and editing: ~$5000 (This budget might work for a paid internship. We have several local universities with arts programs that could make this possible.)
  • Website & logo creation: ~$10,000 (I have a drawing and a vision for the website that needs a designer's expertise, both for visual stuff and functionality.)
  • Purchase & distribution of books: ~$2000

 

In appreciation

I have some fun perks in mind, from thank you cards and stickers to collector's hardcover editions of the Genny series and contributor acknowledgement on the Happy and Free Kid's Space website.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share far and wide!  Your enthusiastic endorsement just might be the reason more people support my campaign.If you can't contribute funds, your sharing my campaign means so much. Thank you

Computer to store books, host meetings, etc.: ~$1500-2000

Creating of small set for videos: ~$500 including painting, purchase of a reading chair, lights 

Consulting on establishing publishing company and contracts: ~ $1000

Video creation and editing: ~$5000 (This budget might work for a paid internship. We have several local universities with arts programs that could make this possible.)

Website & logo creation: ~$10,000 (I have a drawing and a vision for the website that needs a designer's expertise, both for visual stuff and functionality.)

Purchase & distribution of books: ~$2000

I have some fun perks in mind, from thank you cards and stickers to collector's hardcover editions of the Genny series and contributor acknowledgement on the Happy and Free Kid's Space website.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Debbie Chapnick and I am thrilled to be working on this wonderful project with Dolores Ashcroft-Nowicki. The Shakesperian Tarot was originally published in 1993 and has been out of print since 1997.

For those of you that don't know Dolores, she has been the Directer of Studies of the Servants of the Light School of Occult Science for over 40 years. She has recently retired, but instead of relaxing and eating bon bons, she is writing every book and working on every project that she has ever had in her head! Dolores started out on the stage, so Shakespeare and his plays are very close to her heart. Now, with the help of social media this deck can get out into the world in a way that it couldn't before.

I have been working with Dolores since 1999 and have been her archivist since 2001. In addition to studying and reading tarot for over 20 years and I am the owner of Datura Press (www.daturapress.com).

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $5000 to get the deck, the boxes and the companion book printed. The new edition of the book will have an updated introduction by Dolores. There will be perks include decks and books, (paper or pdf) and will be available by the end of the year.

The Impact

The deck and the book are designed, formatted and ready to go to the printer. As soon as the money is raised the decks will go to the printer. The more money we get, the more decks will be printed.

Why did we decide to do this now? At 90 Dolores wants to get certain projects don that have been in her head! Also I will send half the decks printed over to her in the UK so she can sell them at lectures and the local bookstores.

Regardless of the amount of money raised the deck will be printed.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, no worries! Please share this campaign to help get the word out.

Why did we decide to do this now? At 90 Dolores wants to get certain projects don that have been in her head! Also I will send half the decks printed over to her in the UK so she can sell them at lectures and the local bookstores.
Regardless of the amount of money raised the deck will be printed.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute, no worries! Please share this campaign to help get the word out.

story:
{The Mural}

A mural this vast (spanning four walls) requires a lot of work to install, and we're still about $5,000 short. Funds raised will be used to purchase high quality materials, and to pay our amazing artist, Andrew Fearnside, for the hundreds of hours required to produce a mural of this scale. Now we need the community’s help to come up with the remaining funds so we can complete this community project!

With your help, the Birds of Burque Project will:

  • Create a large-scale public art piece on Mountain Road (at Mountain and 12th)
  • Employ 1 lead artist and several assistant helpers
  • Add to the growing beautification around Albuquerque with murals
  • Create an area that encourages walking and exploring (this building is on the same corner as Cocina Azul, the NM Tea Company, and The Next Best Thing to Being There, and a block from Golden Crown Panaderia)

The following is a computer rendering of the mural plan:

 

If you've been by my building lately, you've seen that Andrew has made some progress on the mural already. The walls have been prepped, painted the base dark blue and he's started on the layers of color - the background white flowers first. 

{The Building}

I'm Vicki Bolen and I own Little Bird de Papel -  my art studio and shop in the picture above, Little Bird de Papel, on Mountain Road. 

I started my artist journey with my love of paper and used it to create paper quilts and other printed projects. I’ve since branched out into cranes and ceramics.

I make hand painted hanging cranes that are safe for outdoor use, art, gift cards, and more.  

I also love bringing people together to learn how to create ceramic bowls for my Soup is Love project. We create bowls, then they go on sale once a year and proceeds go to OffCenter Arts.

 

{The Artist}

I'm excited to be working with Andrew Fearnside on this project!

Andrew Fearnside is a New Mexico painter guided by ongoing interests in psychology, social justice, pop culture and spiritual life. He has been juried into group shows in Oregon, Michigan, Colorado and Texas, and has won awards for his work. He has had solo shows at Harwood Art Center, Zendo, Winning Coffee, and the Erna Ferguson Library in Albuquerque, and duos at the Open Space Visitor Center and Page Coleman Gallery. He recently completed a mural at The Burger Stand on Central.

From Andrew: "The Birds of Burque project will cover over 1000 square feet of wall space—four walls. I’m working on a developing a fusion of influences—Japanese kimono textiles and compositions, my own shape-making drawing language, and the spirits of little birds flitting through the seasons in our beloved Bosque."

 

{The Budget}

We want the mural to last as long as possible, and we've built in the possibility of touchups from damage or tagging. The following is our mural estimate, we'll be starting with the early phases in January and February.

Andrew has already worked out the design (he started back in August with his creative processes). In fact, we started priming the walls on January 28, 2020.

Cleaning Phase 

  • TSP, Brush, Buckets $30

Priming Phase 

  • Novacolor, 5 gallons $175
  • Assistants $150

Drawing Projections Phase 

  • Transparencies, black Paint, pens $40
  • Assistants $150

Area Painting Phase

  • Novacolor $560
  • Assistants $500

Gradation painting Phase

  • Novacolor $560
  • Assistants $500

Detail painting Phase

  • Novacolor $560
  • Assistants $300

Varnish Phase

  • Novacolor, 5 gal $200
  • Assistants $300

Plus $1,200 for:

  • Scaffolding
  • Brushes
  • Rollers
  • Containers
  • Tarps
  • Masking tape 
  • Fees
  • Artist Hours

 

{March 6 - Block Party and Fundraiser}

Come party with us and raise money for a spectacular new mural on 12th and Mountain at LIttle Bird de Papel!

Our party/fundraiser for the mural will include various vendors:

  • Denise Weaver Ross - On site selling copies of her book about the Tortuga mural
  • Plot Duckies - Selling books from local authors, and plot duckies! (duckie sales will go toward fundraising for the mural)
  • Cuisine de Corazon - Selling cookies for the Birds of Burque mural.
  • Scribes 8 - An artist collective, will be on hand to talk about their mural, and help us support our event.
  • Sarah Jane Cole - A representative of Central New Mexico Audubon Society will also be on hand with her silver jewelry and all sales will go toward the Birds of Burque Mural.


More soon!

 

{The Team}

Also on the team is Sonja Dewing, author and owner of Plot Duckies. 

She's offered up her adventure novel, Toy of the Gods, for our perks.

She's also bringing her company products from Plot Duckies, to our fundraiser kickoff to help raise money for our mural.

 

 

 

 

 

{Other Ways You Can Help}

Together, we can make this happen. We’d be forever grateful if you could share our campaign with your social networks (e.g., Facebook, Twitter.) We need loads of folks to tell their friends, family, and coworkers about what we are trying to achieve!

Thank you so much for your time & contribution.

 

{The Perks}

You can find all of these perks in the donations page, but here's some info on what you'll find:

$10 for postcards – signed by the artist

Andrew Fearnside will put together a compilation of his images into postcards. We'll send you one, hand signed by the artist at the conclusion of the campaign.

$10 - Website Thank You

Your thoughtful contribution will be acknowledged on my website at the conclusion of the campaign.

$20 - A Single Crane to send you peace

A hand painted, hand folded crane from Little Bird de Papel.

$40 - Greeting Card

You'll receive a handmade greeting card you can use by Little Bird de Papel, types vary.

$50 - Mural Tshirt

A close up of one of the elements on the mural will be on this one of a kind tshirt.

$100 - Crane Chain

Get your own peaceful crane chain to use in your garden or anywhere in or outside your home. 

$250 USD - Original, limited-edition art by Andrew Fearnside Sizes vary

story:
Who we are and what we do!

We are three artists coming together to create uatsh-tide-uatsh.

Katharina Kneip and Masako Kato will go by kayak from Münster (Westf) in Germany all the way to Copenhagen in Denmark. During these about 6 weeks of passing different channels and the baltic sea we will film constantly with two action cameras. Duoni Liu will compose afterwards a piece of music with the duration of time that we need to overcome these about 1000km of water. 

We want to create an interdisciplinary work that needs the same time that we need to canoe. A two channel video installation with an unique piece of music will be shown in different public places. In this work we will pass all kind of borders, connect people and places, experience an adventure in the middle of civilization and in the end create a way of making time visible and experienceable for everybody passing by in their daily life.

In order to manage this work safely we need to master about 40 TB of data, get a seaworthy boat with fitting life jackets and of course a lot of calories... 

  

Where does all the money go?

In many things we can improvise, borrow clothes and live low budged, but when it comes to safety we cannot make any compromise:

  • To save all the videos during the trip and the music composition, work on it and then show it, we need many discs, micro-SD cards for the cameras, solar panels, media server, ....................
  • To make it safely to Copenhagen ourselves we need a proper kayak with fitting life jackets

As you can imagine these equipment needs quite some budget. Thanks to different sponsors we got already waterproof bags, sleeping bags and tarp, but still we need at least 4000 € in order to start and come back safely.

 

Why uatsh-tide-uatsh?

Coming from three different backgrounds of cultures and art we felt it is important to leave the comfort zone in order to create something new and powerful. Duoni as a composer (http://www.duoni-liu.com), Masako working a lot in digital art and Katharina with different interactive, performative sculptures (https://katharinakneip.com/works). With uatsh-tide-uatsh we don't want just to take part in todays daily life, but be the daily life. We are mainly passing a highly populated and agricultural area of Europe- a tiny bit of the world, but still we don't know what will happen during these weeks on the water, being together in one boat and following the rhythm of nature on the one hand and technical difficulties like changing batteries and SD-cards on the other.

With uatsh-tide-uatsh we don't want to keep the distance to our audience that many art works inhere. All the struggle of planning, but also all the beautiful things happening on the way from the beginning to the end are part of it.

We are excited to exchange with people that are as well passionate about facing new challenges, crossing borders, even when they are not visible on first sight as well as film, music, kayak, river, endurance .......... lovers. 

>>>>

Since we know that a two channel 6 week long video installation might be difficult to watch at home, we will create a limited edition of a special home version that comes along with a booklet. For those who want to take part in the video directly- order an individual postcard that we will send you from the way or save a spot in the closing credits.

Even if you cannot support us financially, feel free to write us your thoughts, share the link, tell your friends and help that many others can take part. All our supporters will receive invitations to the exhibitions and public places where uatsh-tide-uatsh will be shown.

story:
Notice: 

We started this campaign just two weeks before the pandemic shut downs.  We are ready to relaunch soon. Thank you all for your support.

 

Short Summary

Blue Moon Camera & Machine recently acquired the warehouse directly across from the James John Elementary School. We plan to change this currently desolate corner of St. Johns into a place of civic pride.

We’ve already planted curbside trees and installed dramatic night-time lighting to improve the space. The centerpiece of this transformation will be a massive 175 foot long panoramic mural by noted North Portland artist David Carmack Lewis.

But we can't make this happen without your help.

Breve Resumen

Blue Moon Camera & Machine recientemente adquirió el almacén directamente frente a la Escuela Primaria James John. Planeamos cambiar este rincón actualmente desolado de St. Johns en un lugar de orgullo cívico.

Ya hemos plantado árboles en la acera e instalado una espectacular iluminación nocturna para mejorar el espacio. La pieza central de esta transformación será un mural panorámico masivo de 175 pies de largo del reconocido artista del norte de Portland, David Carmack Lewis.

Pero no podemos lograr que esto suceda sin su ayuda.

Mr. Lewis has been given complete artistic control over the concept and design. As photographers, we appreciate that great art is created by artists, not by clients or committees.

Mr. Lewis' work was recently featured in a solo show at the Coos Art Museum. He is a Ford Family Foundation grant recipient for his exhibition on fire and fossil fuels. His work has been represented in galleries and juried shows throughout the American West. His Boise mural, "The Big Back Yard" was selected to represent Idaho in Parade Magazine's article "Murals Across America: The Very Best Street Art in Every State".

(See our FAQs to learn more about the artist's concept for this project.)

El señor Lewis ha recibido control artístico completo sobre el concepto y el diseño. Como fotógrafos, apreciamos que el gran arte sea creado por artistas, no por clientes o comités.

El trabajo del señor Lewis apareció recientemente en una exposición individual en el Museo de Arte Coos. Recibió una subvención de la Ford Family Foundation por su exposición sobre incendios y combustibles fósiles. Su trabajo ha sido representado en galerías y espectáculos con jurado en todo el oeste americano. Su mural de Boise, "The Big Back Yard" fue seleccionado para representar al estado de Idaho en el artículo de la revista Parade "Murales en toda América: el mejor arte callejero en cada estado".

(Consulte nuestras preguntas frecuentes para obtener más información sobre el concepto del artista para este proyecto).

 

What We Need & What You Get

All funds will first be applied to the necessary expenses in the order in which they occur: Wall preparation, paints and supplies, lift rental, insurance and anti-graffiti coating. The artist will contribute most of his usual fee as an in-kind donation. Additional funds raised will help to partially compensate him for his time. He will be spending nearly every day for two months on a truly monumental piece of public art that will become an iconic part of the historic downtown St. Johns business district.

As a thank you for your donation, we are offering a variety of perks, including fine art prints and some schwag from Blue Moon Camera & Machine. We'll be adding additional perks in the days and weeks to come.

  • For a donation of $40 we'll send you a Blue Moon Camera coffee mug and pin.
  • For a donation of $75, we offer one of three different fine art prints representing elements from the mural.  
  • For a donation of $150, we are offering a panoramic print of the initial concept design.
  • For a donation of $250, we offer a limited edition signed print, hand-selected from David’s extensive personal catalogue. 

All of these fine art  prints will be produced by technicians at Blue Moon Camera, America’s hardest-working photo lab.

 

St. Johns Neighborhood Improvement
Total Budget: $56,800    Total Funding Gap: $18,800
(Estimated costs for all aspects of our project, including the value of donated services.)

Green = currently funded
Red/Orange = funding needed

Mejoramiento del vecindario de St. Johns

Presupuesto total: $ 56,800 Brecha de financiamiento total: $18,800
(Costos estimados para todos los aspectos de nuestro proyecto, incluido el valor de los servicios donados).

Verde = actualmente financiado
​Rojo / naranja = se necesita financiación

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtiene a cambio

Todos los fondos se aplicarán primero a los gastos necesarios en el orden en que se producen: preparación de paredes, pinturas y suministros, alquiler de ascensores, seguros y revestimiento antigraffiti. El artista contribuirá con la mayor parte de su tarifa habitual como una donación en especie. Los fondos adicionales recaudados ayudarán a compensarlo parcialmente por su tiempo. Pasará casi todos los días durante dos meses en una obra de arte público verdaderamente monumental que se convertirá en una parte icónica del distrito comercial del centro histórico de St. Johns.

Como agradecimiento por su donación, estamos ofreciendo una variedad de beneficios, que incluyen impresiones artísticas y algunos materiales de marca de Blue Moon Camera & Machine. Agregaremos beneficios adicionales en los próximos días y semanas.

  • Por una donación de $40, le enviaremos una taza y un distintivo de Blue Moon Camera.
  • Por una donación de $75, ofrecemos una de las tres impresiones artísticas diferentes que representan elementos del mural.
  • Por una donación de $150, estamos ofreciendo una impresión panorámica del diseño conceptual inicial.
  • Por una donación de $250, ofrecemos una impresión firmada de edición limitada, seleccionada a mano del extenso catálogo personal del señor David.

Todas estas impresiones artísticas serán producidas por técnicos de Blue Moon Camera, el laboratorio fotográfico más trabajador de Estados Unidos.

 

The Impact

The corner of North Kellogg Street and North John Avenue, where the mural will be painted, sits directly across from the James John Elementary School. It has long lain fallow with overlooked potential. Frankly, it has been a bit of an eyesore, an unfortunate circumstance for the students across the street. We see it as a giant blank canvas.

 We have already made significant improvements, including new curbside trees and elegant "billboard-style" lighting. It is our hope that the mural will establish this intersection as a centerpiece of the St. Johns community and an inspiration for generations of young minds.

El impacto

La esquina de North Kellogg Street y North John Avenue, donde se pintará el mural, se encuentra directamente frente a la Escuela Primaria James John. Tiene un largo barbecho con un potencial pasado por alto. Francamente, ha sido un dolor de ojos, una circunstancia desafortunada para los estudiantes al otro lado de la calle. Lo vemos como un lienzo gigante en blanco.

Ya hemos realizado mejoras significativas, incluyendo nuevos árboles en la acera y una elegante iluminación de "estilo de cartelera". Esperamos que el mural establezca esta intersección como una pieza central de la comunidad de St. Johns y una inspiración para generaciones de mentes jóvenes.

 

Risks and Challenges

Delays and unexpected hiccups in projects of this scale are inevitable.  Based on our long-term relationship with the artist, and his extensive history of completing challenging projects just like this one, we have every confidence that we will make this happen. Mr. Lewis brings the experience and commitment necessary to accomplishing a huge project like this.

When it’s finished, we hope that you’ll have a chance to visit.  We want you to see what you helped create, and that it was worth every penny.  

Riesgos y desafíos

Las demoras y los contratiempos inesperados en proyectos de esta escala son inevitables. Basado en nuestra relación a largo plazo con el artista, y su extensa historia de completar proyectos desafiantes como este, tenemos toda la confianza de que lograremos que esto suceda. El Sr. Lewis aporta la experiencia y el compromiso necesarios para lograr un gran proyecto como este.

Cuando el proyecto termine, esperamos que tenga la oportunidad de visitar. Queremos que vea lo que ayudó a crear y que valió la pena cada centavo.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We hope to combine Mr. Lewis’ longtime fans, the amazing customer base of Blue Moon Camera and the tenacious residents of St. Johns into the kind of powerful cooperative that turns a project like this into reality.  We’re specifically asking for a large number of small donations. 

If you want to support this project, but can’t donate, then please help us get the word out. Share this link with others and you’ll be helping us complete this project.

Puede ayudar de otras formas

Esperamos combinar a los fanáticos de largo tiempo de Lewis, a la increíble base de clientes de Blue Moon Camera y a los tenaces residentes de St. Johns en el tipo de cooperativa poderosa que convierte un proyecto como este en realidad. Estamos pidiendo específicamente una gran cantidad de pequeñas donaciones.

Si desea apoyar este proyecto, pero no puede donar, ayúdenos a correr la voz. Comparta este enlace con otros y nos ayudará a completar este proyecto.

 

Our Community Support

We are proud to have the support of the St. Johns Neighborhood Association, The St. Johns Boosters, the James John Elementary School PTA, a generous grant from the Regional Arts & Culture Council, and in-kind donations from Portland Star Rentals, St. Johns Ace Hardware and Siegner & Company Painters. Spanish translation provided by Carlos Romano.

Nuestro apoyo comunitario

Estamos orgullosos de contar con el apoyo de la Asociación de Vecinos de St. Johns, Los St. Johns Boosters, la Asociación de Padres y Maestros (PTA) de la Escuela Primaria James John, una subvención del Consejo Regional de Arte y Cultura y donaciones en especie de Portland Star Rentals, St. Johns Ace Hardware y Siegner & Company Pintores. Traducción al español proporcionada por Carlos Romano.

Breve Resumen
Blue Moon Camera & Machine recientemente adquirió el almacén directamente frente a la Escuela Primaria James John. Planeamos cambiar este rincón actualmente desolado de St. Johns en un lugar de orgullo cívico.
Ya hemos plantado árboles en la acera e instalado una espectacular iluminación nocturna para mejorar el espacio. La pieza central de esta transformación será un mural panorámico masivo de 175 pies de largo del reconocido artista del norte de Portland, David Carmack Lewis.
Pero no podemos lograr que esto suceda sin su ayuda.

Mr. Lewis has been given complete artistic control over the concept and design. As photographers, we appreciate that great art is created by artists, not by clients or committees.
Mr. Lewis' work was recently featured in a solo show at the Coos Art Museum. He is a Ford Family Foundation grant recipient for his exhibition on fire and fossil fuels. His work has been represented in galleries and juried shows throughout the American West. His Boise mural, "The Big Back Yard" was selected to represent Idaho in Parade Magazine's article "Murals Across America: The Very Best Street Art in Every State".(See our FAQs to learn more about the artist's concept for this project.)
El señor Lewis ha recibido control artístico completo sobre el concepto y el diseño. Como fotógrafos, apreciamos que el gran arte sea creado por artistas, no por clientes o comités.
El trabajo del señor Lewis apareció recientemente en una exposición individual en el Museo de Arte Coos. Recibió una subvención de la Ford Family Foundation por su exposición sobre incendios y combustibles fósiles. Su trabajo ha sido representado en galerías y espectáculos con jurado en todo el oeste americano. Su mural de Boise, "The Big Back Yard" fue seleccionado para representar al estado de Idaho en el artículo de la revista Parade "Murales en toda América: el mejor arte callejero en cada estado".
(Consulte nuestras preguntas frecuentes para obtener más información sobre el concepto del artista para este proyecto).
 

What We Need & What You Get
All funds will first be applied to the necessary expenses in the order in which they occur: Wall preparation, paints and supplies, lift rental, insurance and anti-graffiti coating. The artist will contribute most of his usual fee as an in-kind donation. Additional funds raised will help to partially compensate him for his time. He will be spending nearly every day for two months on a truly monumental piece of public art that will become an iconic part of the historic downtown St. Johns business district.
As a thank you for your donation, we are offering a variety of perks, including fine art prints and some schwag from Blue Moon Camera & Machine. We'll be adding additional perks in the days and weeks to come.

For a donation of $40 we'll send you a Blue Moon Camera coffee mug and pin.
For a donation of $75, we offer one of three different fine art prints representing elements from the mural.  
For a donation of $150, we are offering a panoramic print of the initial concept design.
For a donation of $250, we offer a limited edition signed print, hand-selected from David’s extensive personal catalogue. 

All of these fine art  prints will be produced by technicians at Blue Moon Camera, America’s hardest-working photo lab.
 
St. Johns Neighborhood ImprovementTotal Budget: $56,800    Total Funding Gap: $18,800(Estimated costs for all aspects of our project, including the value of donated services.)
Green = currently fundedRed/Orange = funding needed


Mejoramiento del vecindario de St. Johns
Presupuesto total: $ 56,800 Brecha de financiamiento total: $18,800(Costos estimados para todos los aspectos de nuestro proyecto, incluido el valor de los servicios donados).
Verde = actualmente financiado​Rojo / naranja = se necesita financiación

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtiene a cambio
Todos los fondos se aplicarán primero a los gastos necesarios en el orden en que se producen: preparación de paredes, pinturas y suministros, alquiler de ascensores, seguros y revestimiento antigraffiti. El artista contribuirá con la mayor parte de su tarifa habitual como una donación en especie. Los fondos adicionales recaudados ayudarán a compensarlo parcialmente por su tiempo. Pasará casi todos los días durante dos meses en una obra de arte público verdaderamente monumental que se convertirá en una parte icónica del distrito comercial del centro histórico de St. Johns.
Como agradecimiento por su donación, estamos ofreciendo una variedad de beneficios, que incluyen impresiones artísticas y algunos materiales de marca de Blue Moon Camera & Machine. Agregaremos beneficios adicionales en los próximos días y semanas.

Por una donación de $40, le enviaremos una taza y un distintivo de Blue Moon Camera.
Por una donación de $75, ofrecemos una de las tres impresiones artísticas diferentes que representan elementos del mural.
Por una donación de $150, estamos ofreciendo una impresión panorámica del diseño conceptual inicial.
Por una donación de $250, ofrecemos una impresión firmada de edición limitada, seleccionada a mano del extenso catálogo personal del señor David.

Todas estas impresiones artísticas serán producidas por técnicos de Blue Moon Camera, el laboratorio fotográfico más trabajador de Estados Unidos.
 
The Impact
The corner of North Kellogg Street and North John Avenue, where the mural will be painted, sits directly across from the James John Elementary School. It has long lain fallow with overlooked potential. Frankly, it has been a bit of an eyesore, an unfortunate circumstance for the students across the street. We see it as a giant blank canvas.
 We have already made significant improvements, including new curbside trees and elegant "billboard-style" lighting. It is our hope that the mural will establish this intersection as a centerpiece of the St. Johns community and an inspiration for generations of young minds.

El impacto
La esquina de North Kellogg Street y North John Avenue, donde se pintará el mural, se encuentra directamente frente a la Escuela Primaria James John. Tiene un largo barbecho con un potencial pasado por alto. Francamente, ha sido un dolor de ojos, una circunstancia desafortunada para los estudiantes al otro lado de la calle. Lo vemos como un lienzo gigante en blanco.
Ya hemos realizado mejoras significativas, incluyendo nuevos árboles en la acera y una elegante iluminación de "estilo de cartelera". Esperamos que el mural establezca esta intersección como una pieza central de la comunidad de St. Johns y una inspiración para generaciones de mentes jóvenes.
 
Risks and Challenges

Delays and unexpected hiccups in projects of this scale are inevitable.  Based on our long-term relationship with the artist, and his extensive history of completing challenging projects just like this one, we have every confidence that we will make this happen. Mr. Lewis brings the experience and commitment necessary to accomplishing a huge project like this.
When it’s finished, we hope that you’ll have a chance to visit.  We want you to see what you helped create, and that it was worth every penny.  
Riesgos y desafíos
Las demoras y los contratiempos inesperados en proyectos de esta escala son inevitables. Basado en nuestra relación a largo plazo con el artista, y su extensa historia de completar proyectos desafiantes como este, tenemos toda la confianza de que lograremos que esto suceda. El Sr. Lewis aporta la experiencia y el compromiso necesarios para lograr un gran proyecto como este.
Cuando el proyecto termine, esperamos que tenga la oportunidad de visitar. Queremos que vea lo que ayudó a crear y que valió la pena cada centavo.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
We hope to combine Mr. Lewis’ longtime fans, the amazing customer base of Blue Moon Camera and the tenacious residents of St. Johns into the kind of powerful cooperative that turns a project like this into reality.  We’re specifically asking for a large number of small donations. 
If you want to support this project, but can’t donate, then please help us get the word out. Share this link with others and you’ll be helping us complete this project.
Puede ayudar de otras formas
Esperamos combinar a los fanáticos de largo tiempo de Lewis, a la increíble base de clientes de Blue Moon Camera y a los tenaces residentes de St. Johns en el tipo de cooperativa poderosa que convierte un proyecto como este en realidad. Estamos pidiendo específicamente una gran cantidad de pequeñas donaciones.
Si desea apoyar este proyecto, pero no puede donar, ayúdenos a correr la voz. Comparta este enlace con otros y nos ayudará a completar este proyecto.
 
Our Community Support
We are proud to have the support of the St. Johns Neighborhood Association, The St. Johns Boosters, the James John Elementary School PTA, a generous grant from the Regional Arts & Culture Council, and in-kind donations from Portland Star Rentals, St. Johns Ace Hardware and Siegner & Company Painters. Spanish translation provided by Carlos Romano.
Nuestro apoyo comunitario
Estamos orgullosos de contar con el apoyo de la Asociación de Vecinos de St. Johns, Los St. Johns Boosters, la Asociación de Padres y Maestros (PTA) de la Escuela Primaria James John, una subvención del Consejo Regional de Arte y Cultura y donaciones en especie de Portland Star Rentals, St. Johns Ace Hardware y Siegner & Company Pintores. Traducción al español proporcionada por Carlos Romano.

story:
Our Goal:

Our goal is to invite Shakespeare off the pedestal and reflect the diverse world as we know it through our productions. We respect the community excitement Muse of Fire cultivated through the years, and will continue the tradition of creating dynamic and accessible theater while integrating our own inclusive artistic values. 

We practice that actions alone evoke change and that language shapes our world.​

Theatre Evolve’s mission is to provide opportunities for new and developing artists to grow and evolve, both on and off the stage. We will support bold collaborators through the use of original ideas and interpretations.

We are committed to embodying the diversity of our community at all levels: on our staff, on our stage, and in our audience.

 

Now The Real Question:

We are asking for $10,000 to fully fund our first production: Comedy of Errors!

 

OUR SHOW:

Comedy of Errors is known for its tale of twins separated at birth and reunited through the hilarity of rigmarole and mistaken identity.  Underneath is a tale of a parent imprisoned and sentenced to die for seeking their lost children in a foreign land.  The Island of Ephesus is a place where immigrants of Syracuse are unwelcome and people tell you your identity is not your own. 

We promise you will laugh, for that's what we do when the truth catches us by surprise.

 

Where Is Your Money Going:

Actor Stipends

Designer Stipends 

Costumes/Props

Posters/Programs

Insurance

Portable Toilet Rental

 

Good news! We are an official 501©3, which means your donation is tax deductible! With your donation you will receive an official receipt from Evolve Shakespeare for your taxes.

 

Our Work So Far:

 

  • In our inaugural 2018 Season, we offered an incredible production of Twelfth Night filled with some of Chicago most amazing artists. Our three-week run had multiple sold out nights and rave reviews from our audience!

 

  • In the fall of 2018, we produced our first REvolve reading series! After a month of reading through the 260 play submissions we received from all over the country, we narrowed it down to seven 10-min plays and two full length pieces. With packed houses we were honored to produce REvolve with over 30 actors, playwrights, and directors.

 

  • In the summer of 2019, we produced the World Premiere of HUMAN RESOURCE(S) by Sara Means, telling the sometimes-too-familiar story of corporate America and the extremes of clawing one's way to the top. The production was well-received by critics and audiences alike!

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

We completely understand if you can’t make a financial donation. But there are other ways to help make Evolve Shakespeare a reality:

Please let all your friends and family know about this Indiegogo campaign. Tweet about it. Facebook about it. Instagram, Snap, Message, Text, Email away. Use the Indiegogo share tools and help us spread the word. This is the most important thing you can do!

story:
Public art installation in Owl's head park,

Bay Ridge, Brooklyn

  • I initiated this project with students of Fort Hamilton High School who visited  Heraklio, Greece and did a workshop with the European School students.
  • in 2017 I had the chance to further work for the preparation of this project through workshops I made in MERVO, Mergenthaler Vocational-Technical High School students and their amazing art teacher Sia Kyriakakos in Baltimore.

  • The project is an official collaboration with the Parks Department of NYC but there is, unfortunately, no available funding for the installation and insurance expenses.
  • In the past I solely funded my project with them in Tompkins Square Park in the East Village, but things have changed and this project has much higher expenses, notably in liability insurance and by the nature of the project, since the sculptures are bigger and need to be transported and I need more materials and equipment to install them in the park.
  • I feel very committed to the neighborhood and all the kids that worked on this project. I hope that most of the visitors of the park will be agreeably surprised since this would be the very first art installation ever in this park!
  • Your generous contributions will ensure that all the children's efforts on this project will become a reality!

Articles about this installation

https://www.brooklyndaily.com

https://www.brooklynpaper.com

 

Recent articles about my work in New York

https://www.thenationalherald.com

http://www.greeknewsonline.com

 

Experience in public art projects:

Recently I won this competition by NYC Mayor's office for Climate change / emergency management, with my mural design, Day that was installed in Red Hook, Brooklyn as part of the emergency flood program 

http://linardakiparisot.wixsite.com/linardaki-p...

 

http://untappedcities.com/2015/09/25/12-art-ins...

http://industry-buzz.com/mirror-images-turn-puz...

  • in Jackson Heights, Queens in collaboration with the Department of Transportation, NYC and NYCares, : 

    https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8kxVygfPCWs

    http://foresthillstimes.com/bookmark/25905831-M...

    http://www.nyc.gov/html/dot/downloads/pdf/dot_a...

    http://qns.com/story/2014/10/03/artist-voluntee...

     

  • And in collaboration with NYC Parks - Arts in the Parks :

  • http://www.culturecraver.com/event/1682052

    http://parksplazaspublicplaces.blogspot.gr/2016...

    https://www.mutualart.com/Exhibition/Eirini-Lin...

    and on my website :

    http://linardakiparisot.wixsite.com/linardaki-p...

In Branch Brook Park, Newark, NJ, in collaboration with Rutgers University : http://linardakiparisot.wixsite.com/linardaki-p...

 

What we need and what you are funding

  •  $ 3,500 are needed to co-fund this project.
  • All my fees and work time has been funded by me! 
  •  This amount covers the liability insurance, transportation of the sculptures, the installation materials and the technician who will help on that day to make sure we the installation makes it through next winter without any incidents!
  • The first  expense is the liability insurance without which we cannot even sign the contract. If we do not raise all the funds we will still cover this and continue with what we have for the installation.

Impact

The project was already presented to the community board in September 2017 and was approved.

I understood that this is a very important site for Bay Ridge. I met many of the visitors of the park, from skaters to families, dog walkers, tai-chi lovers, amateur landscapers and others, they all stressed out that this is a park used all year long, diverse and very authentic.

Everybody was interested in the project and was looking forward to see it happening, including the park managers!

 

Other ways to help 

Spread the word! Talk about the project and the crowdfunding campaign around you, Share it in social media if you can

Public art installation in Owl's head park,
Bay Ridge, Brooklyn

I initiated this project with students of Fort Hamilton High School who visited  Heraklio, Greece and did a workshop with the European School students.
in 2017 I had the chance to further work for the preparation of this project through workshops I made in MERVO, Mergenthaler Vocational-Technical High School students and their amazing art teacher Sia Kyriakakos in Baltimore.




The project is an official collaboration with the Parks Department of NYC but there is, unfortunately, no available funding for the installation and insurance expenses.
In the past I solely funded my project with them in Tompkins Square Park in the East Village, but things have changed and this project has much higher expenses, notably in liability insurance and by the nature of the project, since the sculptures are bigger and need to be transported and I need more materials and equipment to install them in the park.

I feel very committed to the neighborhood and all the kids that worked on this project. I hope that most of the visitors of the park will be agreeably surprised since this would be the very first art installation ever in this park!
Your generous contributions will ensure that all the children's efforts on this project will become a reality!

What we need and what you are funding

All my fees and work time has been funded by me! 
 This amount covers the liability insurance, transportation of the sculptures, the installation materials and the technician who will help on that day to make sure we the installation makes it through next winter without any incidents!
The first  expense is the liability insurance without which we cannot even sign the contract. If we do not raise all the funds we will still cover this and continue with what we have for the installation.


Impact
The project was already presented to the community board in September 2017 and was approved.
I understood that this is a very important site for Bay Ridge. I met many of the visitors of the park, from skaters to families, dog walkers, tai-chi lovers, amateur landscapers and others, they all stressed out that this is a park used all year long, diverse and very authentic.
Everybody was interested in the project and was looking forward to see it happening, including the park managers!
 

Other ways to help

story:
Helping Art Space & Artists, Revive First Fridays And Inspire Our Community.

 

Planning an art show takes time and money, which I'm already spending.  More funds for labor and materials is needed for extra wall space for our Art Exhibit November 2, 2018 at The Arts At Marks Garage, a local Non-Profit Art Space.  These new Art Walls will be donated to the non-profit organization for future exhibits.

I've already done paid advertisements for the Exhibit and Art Space.  And, I'm seeking funds to do more. 

Stimulating our Community, Supporting our Art Spaces, Local Artists & First Fridays events, is what we are asking help to do.  

Group Art Show Nov.2nd: The Art's At Mark's Garage 1159 Nu'uanu Ave. 5-9pm 

 

Artist List:

Brook Parker

Barry Napoleon

Albert"Hardkoa"Weight

Sonya Hoffemeister

Nadia Fairlamb

 

What We Need = $1,400

 

1) Art Walls - Labor and Materials. = $644 

2) Promotion; Flyers, Posters, Facebook & Instagram ads to inspire our community with a free event. = $184 

3) Artist Reception: Musician & Catering = $460

4) Fulfilling Rewards = 5% Indiegogo Fee, 3% + .30 Transactional Fees

This amount will only cover the things mentioned above, but framing, photographing art and art supplies are also priorities. 

I would be grateful for whatever mount I receive, yet I know sometimes campaigns on this platform go beyond there goal amount.  More funds raised, means more art can be hung for us.  

 

What You Get: 

Get an immediate 35% OFF Discount Code for all products at: HardkoaArt.com, for your Donation of $45 or more.  This Discount Code is a one time 35%OFF your entire order at HardkoaArt.com, expiration date Dec26th.  

 

Most importantly, you get the satisfaction of being a part of something that brings us together, in the spirit of community; perpetuating the inspiration that art brings.

 

Thank You Very Much For Supporting The Arts!
