story:
WELCOME TO FREE BELARUS! 

Команда Freedom Belarus создаёт первый виртуальный музей, предоставляющий безопасную  площадку для творческих людей Беларуси.

В 2020 году весь мир узнал о маленькой, но гордой стране – Беларусь. Здесь живет чуть больше 9 млн человек с потрясающим чувством юмора, энергией, безграничным креативом и силой. За несколько месяцев жизнь этих людей изменилась до неузнаваемости. Но несмотря на все сложности, они продолжают творить и экспериментировать, раскрывая все грани творчества.

К сожалению, неразумная цензура, бесконечные запреты и немыслимые ограничения не дают художникам, скульпторам, дизайнерам, фотографам и режиссерам воплощать ироничные идеи, отражающие беларускую действительность. Искусство по-беларуски – это искусство не в Беларуси.

Наш проект решит это проблему окончательно. Виртуальный музей станет полностью защищенной творческой средой для каждого креативного беларуса. Картины, плакаты, муралы, песни, видео, скульптуры, стихи, фотографии – все виды искусства найдут место в наших экспозициях.

Пространство музея будет разделено на несколько тематических залов, отражающих определенную проблематику. В первом – мы продемонстрируем всю суть противостояния последних месяцев, представив несколько сотен эксклюзивных работ. Более 20 художников и предоставили свои эксклюзивные эскизы и материалы для создания первого беларуского виртуального музея.

ПОЧЕМУ ВАЖНО НАС ПОДДЕРЖАТЬ

 Беларуский креатив появился «вопреки» всем событиям и законам. Так же родилась и идея нашего проекта. Поддерживая виртуальный музей, вы не просто жертвуете деньги.

1.      Вы поддерживаете каждого из 9 млн человек Беларуси.

2.      Вы дарите возможность созерцать искусство несмотря ни на что.

3.      Вы вдохновляете творческих людей не сдаваться и двигаться только вперед.

ЧТО УЖЕ СДЕЛАНО

Нам удалось собрать команду лучших профессионалов (бизнес-аналитики, it-разработчики, 3D-дизайнеры), которые помогут реализовать нашу смелую фантазию.

О команде и наших воплощенных проектах узнайте подробнее на нашем сайте https://freedomblrs.com/

 

ЧТО НУЖНО СДЕЛАТЬ

Для запуска проекта нам нужны денежные средства. Ниже вы увидите, для чего они будут использоваться.

ПОЧЕМУ МЫ?

Мы семья единомышленников и профессионалов из самых разных сфер, и нас объединяет одна цель – создание и продвижение беларуского искусства во всём мире. 

За полгода мы реализовали несколько творческих проектов (подробнее на нашем сайте и в соц. сетях), демонстрирующих креатив, смелость и уникальность нашего народа.  Наши работы получили поддержку не только в Беларуси, но и за её пределами. Мы уверены:  онлайн-музей Freedom Belarus вдохновит вас так же, как и всю нашу команду. Присоединяйтесь!

В 2020 году о Беларуси узнал весь мир. Помогите нам собрать нужную сумму, чтобы в 2021-м о нас никто не забыл.

КАК ЕЩЁ МОЖНО ПОМОЧЬ?

Вы можете помочь нам, даже не покупая лоты. Расскажите о нашем проекте, поделившись ссылкой на эту кампанию и другие наши работы.

Если у вас есть вопросы или любые предложения по этому проекту, пишите нам на freedomblrs@gmail.com с пометкой Online Museum. 

Также мы будем рады вашей подписке на наши социальные сети:

https://freedomblrs.com/

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCqjuyObi04nyZl...

https://www.facebook.com/freedomblrs/

https://www.instagram.com/freedomblrs/

https://www.tiktok.com/@freedomblrs?lang=en  
 

ДЕТАЛИ ЛОТОВ

ФУТБОЛКИ И ХУДИ

Размерная таблица для одежды представлена ниже. Обратите внимание, что футболки есть мужские и женские, а все худи - унисекс.


 

WELCOME TO FREE BELARUS! 

Freedom Belarus Team creates the first online museum that provides a safe platform for all creative people of Belarus. 

In 2020 the whole world got to know about Belarus - a small but proud country. Belarus has 9 million people with fantastic sense of humour, energy, infinite crearivity and strength. Their lives have changed radically for the several last months. However they keep on living, creating, experimenting and developing their own art.

Sad to say, numerous absurd restrictions and limitations prevent creators from carrying out their projects freely and safely. That's why they have to perform their works in other countries rather than in their motherland.

We believe that our project will solve this problem. Online museum is to become safe art enviroment for each creative belarusian. Paintings, posters, murals, songs, videos, sculptures, poems, photographs - all these you will find in our expositions.

Museum will have several theme halls. Now we are going to create the most important one, that will collect several hundreds of art works devoted to the last months srtuggle of free people. More than 20 artists have already provided us with their works.

WHY IS IT IMPORTANT?

Belarusian art evolves in the face of all negative events and problems. Supporting the online museum is not just money donation.

1.      You help every free belarusian. 

2.      You give a chance to belarusain art to be performed in spity of everything. 

3.      You inspire all creative people to continue struggling and move forward. 

WHAT WE HAVE AND WHAT WE NEED

We put a team of professionals together. 3D-designers, IT-developers, business analysts are ready to implement our daring dream.

You are welcome to find out about our team members and our existing projects here:  https://freedomblrs.com/

Still we need money to launch the project of museum. We need it for a manager team, PR-company, technical development of the museum model and all the digital copies of art works.

WHY US?

We are a family of co-thinkers and professionals from many different spheres. And we are united by the common purpose – to create and promote Belarusian art all over the world.

For the last 6 months we have released several art projects, which show creativity, courage and unique character of our nation. These works got support not only in Belarus, but also in other countries. We are sure that you will be inpired by Freedom Belarus Online Museum the same way as we are. Join us! 

In 2020 the whole world got to know about Belarus. Help us gain the needed sum of money so nobody forgets us in 2021. 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

You can also help us without donating money. Share this project and our previous works. 

You can ask your question by sending it to this e-mail freedomblrs@gmail.com with a title "Online Museum". 

We are happy to see you as our follower:

https://freedomblrs.com/

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCqjuyObi04nyZl...

https://www.facebook.com/freedomblrs/

https://www.instagram.com/freedomblrs/

https://www.tiktok.com/@freedomblrs?lang=en

WELCOME TO FREE BELARUS! 
Команда Freedom Belarus создаёт первый виртуальный музей, предоставляющий безопасную  площадку для творческих людей Беларуси.
В 2020 году весь мир узнал о маленькой, но гордой стране – Беларусь. Здесь живет чуть больше 9 млн человек с потрясающим чувством юмора, энергией, безграничным креативом и силой. За несколько месяцев жизнь этих людей изменилась до неузнаваемости. Но несмотря на все сложности, они продолжают творить и экспериментировать, раскрывая все грани творчества.

К сожалению, неразумная цензура, бесконечные запреты и немыслимые ограничения не дают художникам, скульпторам, дизайнерам, фотографам и режиссерам воплощать ироничные идеи, отражающие беларускую действительность. Искусство по-беларуски – это искусство не в Беларуси.
Наш проект решит это проблему окончательно. Виртуальный музей станет полностью защищенной творческой средой для каждого креативного беларуса. Картины, плакаты, муралы, песни, видео, скульптуры, стихи, фотографии – все виды искусства найдут место в наших экспозициях.
Пространство музея будет разделено на несколько тематических залов, отражающих определенную проблематику. В первом – мы продемонстрируем всю суть противостояния последних месяцев, представив несколько сотен эксклюзивных работ. Более 20 художников и предоставили свои эксклюзивные эскизы и материалы для создания первого беларуского виртуального музея.


ПОЧЕМУ ВАЖНО НАС ПОДДЕРЖАТЬ
 Беларуский креатив появился «вопреки» всем событиям и законам. Так же родилась и идея нашего проекта. Поддерживая виртуальный музей, вы не просто жертвуете деньги.
1.      Вы поддерживаете каждого из 9 млн человек Беларуси.
2.      Вы дарите возможность созерцать искусство несмотря ни на что.
3.      Вы вдохновляете творческих людей не сдаваться и двигаться только вперед.

ЧТО УЖЕ СДЕЛАНО
Нам удалось собрать команду лучших профессионалов (бизнес-аналитики, it-разработчики, 3D-дизайнеры), которые помогут реализовать нашу смелую фантазию.
О команде и наших воплощенных проектах узнайте подробнее на нашем сайте https://freedomblrs.com/


 


ЧТО НУЖНО СДЕЛАТЬ
Для запуска проекта нам нужны денежные средства. Ниже вы увидите, для чего они будут использоваться.


ПОЧЕМУ МЫ?
Мы семья единомышленников и профессионалов из самых разных сфер, и нас объединяет одна цель – создание и продвижение беларуского искусства во всём мире.

Мы уверены:  онлайн-музей Freedom Belarus вдохновит вас так же, как и всю нашу команду. Присоединяйтесь!
В 2020 году о Беларуси узнал весь мир. Помогите нам собрать нужную сумму, чтобы в 2021-м о нас никто не забыл.

Вы можете помочь нам, даже не покупая лоты. Расскажите о нашем проекте, поделившись ссылкой на эту кампанию и другие наши работы.

story:
There are two ways for you to support this campaign. You can make a contribution (on desktop, click the "Back It" button. On mobile, scroll all the way to the right of the perks section), or you can select a perk. Thank you!

Indiegogo衆籌網頁中有捐款及9項紀念品(perk)以供選擇，希望大家踴躍支持，共同建成這場展覽。

Apple Daily's interview
Our Facebook page
Our Instagram
Our YouTube channel

 

Featuring artists:

(last updated: July 1st, 2020)
Our team is working hard to confirm more artists. Here are the artists who have been confirmed to partner with us. 

Illustrators & painters:

巴丟草 @badiucao
芥蘭炒雞蛋 @kai_lan_egg
Harcourt Romanticist @harcourtromanticist
Childe Abaddon @a_ba                                                                                                                                               淋漓淋浪 @LumliLumlong
cheeky cheeky 厚面子 @cheekycheeky.hk
Lau Kwong Shing @cowcowtony
P O N ‘ S E E D @pon.seed
塵阿力 @alex_x916
Fung Kin Fan @fungkinfan                                                                                                                                            

Photographers:

Rémy Soubanère  @remysoubanere
Ko Chung Ming 高仲明 @chungmingko
May James @slpsiusin
Charles Ho @_chiu.h  

Toymakers:
膠叔叔 Uncle Plastic @uncleplastic

While the whole world is confronting the Coronavirus pandemic, attention given to the Hong Kong movement has rapidly decreased. In fact, the authoritarian leadership in China is the main source of this global crisis, and the state of our world is in now further underscores the need to stand with Hong Kong and the values they are fighting for. We are a group of New Yorkers, bringing the voices and significant artworks from the Hong Kong movement to New York City.
 

當全世界在面對武漢肺炎這場疫症時，連帶對香港的抗爭運動的關注也急速下降。現時全球開始察覺到中共政權黑暗、狡詐及腐敗，這正是武漢肺炎散播全球的主要原因，香港人應把握這次機會讓全球與我們站在同一陣線。藉此展覽，我們將繼續盡居於海外的香港人的責任，使以香港抗爭為主題的展覽及連儂牆上的作品首次登上紐約的舞台，傳揚香港人的聲音。



At the one year mark of the movement, the goals of the exhibit are:
 

  1. To amplify the voices of the people from Hong Kong. Facilitate a deeper perspective to the international audience, building upon the solidarity and attention given from the past year.
     
  2. To dedicate and acknowledge the collective effort and work by ordinary citizens and anonymous artists of the movement. Through the protest art, bring forward Hong Kong’s unique culture and identity.
     
  3. To connect the audience with our universal values of human rights, freedom, and liberty that Hong Kong is fighting and defending for on the frontline— values that are also core to American lives.
     


 

 

在這快一年的時間點，我們以此為目標:
 

  1. 透過過去一年所建立的團結及全球對香港的關注，我們希望令國際的觀眾聆聽更多香港人真實的聲音，加深對這場運動的理解。
     
  2. 向一群佚名藝術家及普通市民致敬，並展現香港人獨特的身份及文化。
     
  3. 以人權、民主及自由等普世價值去連繫世界，以感動更多人站出來支持香港。

     

 

 

 

 

With our exhibition designers, we are presenting interactive displays, photographic & video documentations of ways in which citizens react and respond in times of urgency— of testimonials, creative performances, and other disobedient civic actions taken to the streets. 

Street art and graphic design are defining features of the pro-democracy demonstrations. Not only do they visually convey the stories and emotions of the people, its collective mode of production reflects the unique culture and identity of Hong Kong. Our exhibition aims to celebrate and exemplify the decentralized, democratic nature of the movement, by presenting the crowd sourced and open sourced artworks and posters that are shared online and disseminated on Lennon walls across the city. 

 

香港的街頭充滿各人的吶喊，成為了意識形態的戰場，並讓人深切感受香港人的毅力。我們將藉互動式作品、照片、影象等表現香港人以文字、富有創意的方式及各種公民行動去極速應對暴政的打壓及社會的反應。

這場民主抗爭運動的其中一個特徵是街頭藝術及各種設計。這些作品除了向觀眾細說不同故事及情感，其集體創作的特色更反映出獨特的香港文化及人文特質。為此，我們選擇展出於網上及連儂場遍地開花、百花齊放的藝術品及文宣，以突出這場運動去中心化及重視民主的特色，並由選出的作品去體現香港人所重視的普世價值。


As part of the exhibit, we are looking to collaborate with oversea non-Hong Kong groups such as Taiwanese, Tibetan, East Turkestan groups for the launch event, talks, and panel discussions, to be live-streamed. To allow audiences outside of NYC to engage in our show, we are collecting Lennon Wall messages to be displayed in our exhibit. Follow our Facebook page for more updates.

作為藝術展覽中的一部分，我們計劃邀請來自台灣丶西藏及東突厥斯坦的嘉賓，參與開幕及座談會等活動。為使紐約以外的人參與這個展覽，現場將會提供直播。而特別在香港難以建立長久的連儂牆的時刻，我們希望收集大家的心聲共同建築展覽內屬於大家的連儂牆。更多詳情將會稍後公佈，請密切留意我們Facebook上的最新動向。
 


We are pleased to collaborate with Hong Kong Defiance-Voices Book publishing team. Many of the artists presented in our exhibit are included in this historic series of books. The book set is sold out in Hong Kong, We now have a limited amount of the book set in New York City , Hong Kong supporters in the United States can pre-order the book set with us for the month of July and pick up at our exhibition ( end of August). Our team can arrange domestic shipping to other part of the U.S for additional postal fees. To place an order for U.S shipping or pick up please email : hkartexhibition2020@gmail.com

我們很榮幸能夠和《誰衛我城•DEFIANCE》的出版隊伍合作，並展示部分收錄於這套書內藝術家們的作品。


We are actively planning our exhibition to be held in NYC in August. Proceeds will go towards venue rental, audiovisual equipment rental, mounting materials, art supplies & printing, insurance, and exhibition set up costs. In the spirit of transparency & accountability, we will post a full accounting of all expenditures for our donors to view. Remaining funds after the show will be donated directly to designated charities in Hong Kong. (to be announced to our donors before the show). Details of budgets please see here.
 

我們現正積極向着於2020年8月在紐約市舉行展覽。財政支出的項目包括展覽場地的租金、影視器材的租金、裝裱用料、藝術作品裝運及印刷費用、保險費用，以及展覽品擺設費用等。我們會秉承會計責任及展示財政透明度，展覽完畢將會向捐助者分發一份詳盡的財政支出會計列表。若有剩餘捐款，我們會直接捐獻給指定的香港相關慈善團體。(展期前將會向捐助者公佈有關慈善團體的名稱) 展覽預算內容詳情請參考。

 


Tiananmen Square Massacre event with various groups, on June 4, 2020. Photo credit: Thirdblade Photography

 

We are a group of volunteers / Hong Kongers living and working in New York City connected through marches and events in NYC happening throughout last year. Our core group consists of an art director, a graphic and exhibition designer, a fashion designer, and a real estate agent, working a full-time job or studying in the city. We welcome more volunteers to join our team in NYC.  Please contact us if you would like to know more!
 

我們是一群來自香港，現今在紐約市生活及工作的義工。因緣際會下，我們去年在紐約市的遊行活動中相識相知。我們懷著簡單的願景，期望藉著展覽引起觀眾留意有關議題。我們的核心工作人員包括藝術指導、平面及展覽設計師、服裝設計師、地產經紀, 學生等。我們歡迎更多本巿市民加入這義工行列，歡迎隨時聯絡我們！

Follow us on our Facebook page

Follow us on our Instagram

Watch our videos on our YouTube channel
 

 

Your gracious support is critical to make this exhibition happen. Considering the high costs of expenditure in New York City, we won't be able to do it alone without the collective effort. Please continue to follow us as we periodically update the progress for the project via social media platforms, thank you!
 

由於租場費用、作品運送及印刷、租借器材等製作費成本高昂，我們實在難以獨自承擔所有費用，而若未能籌得所需的基本款項，這場展覽將難以實行。如果大家認同我們的構思，我們誠意邀請大家支持令這場展覽得以實現。我們會定期在社交媒體上發佈最新進度，請繼續關注及分享本計劃給你的親友。多謝！

Featuring artists:
(last updated: July 1st, 2020)Our team is working hard to confirm more artists. Here are the artists who have been confirmed to partner with us. Illustrators & painters:
巴丟草 @badiucao芥蘭炒雞蛋 @kai_lan_eggHarcourt Romanticist @harcourtromanticistChilde Abaddon @a_ba                                                                                                                                               淋漓淋浪 @LumliLumlongcheeky cheeky 厚面子 @cheekycheeky.hkLau Kwong Shing @cowcowtonyP O N ‘ S E E D @pon.seed塵阿力 @alex_x916Fung Kin Fan @fungkinfan                                                                                                                                            
Photographers:
Rémy Soubanère  @remysoubanereKo Chung Ming 高仲明 @chungmingkoMay James @slpsiusinCharles Ho @_chiu.h  
Toymakers:膠叔叔 Uncle Plastic @uncleplastic


While the whole world is confronting the Coronavirus pandemic, attention given to the Hong Kong movement has rapidly decreased. In fact, the authoritarian leadership in China is the main source of this global crisis, and the state of our world is in now further underscores the need to stand with Hong Kong and the values they are fighting for. We are a group of New Yorkers, bringing the voices and significant artworks from the Hong Kong movement to New York City. 
當全世界在面對武漢肺炎這場疫症時，連帶對香港的抗爭運動的關注也急速下降。現時全球開始察覺到中共政權黑暗、狡詐及腐敗，這正是武漢肺炎散播全球的主要原因，香港人應把握這次機會讓全球與我們站在同一陣線。藉此展覽，我們將繼續盡居於海外的香港人的責任，使以香港抗爭為主題的展覽及連儂牆上的作品首次登上紐約的舞台，傳揚香港人的聲音。




At the one year mark of the movement, the goals of the exhibit are: 

To amplify the voices of the people from Hong Kong. Facilitate a deeper perspective to the international audience, building upon the solidarity and attention given from the past year. 
To dedicate and acknowledge the collective effort and work by ordinary citizens and anonymous artists of the movement. Through the protest art, bring forward Hong Kong’s unique culture and identity. 
To connect the audience with our universal values of human rights, freedom, and liberty that Hong Kong is fighting and defending for on the frontline— values that are also core to American lives. 

 

 
在這快一年的時間點，我們以此為目標: 

透過過去一年所建立的團結及全球對香港的關注，我們希望令國際的觀眾聆聽更多香港人真實的聲音，加深對這場運動的理解。 
向一群佚名藝術家及普通市民致敬，並展現香港人獨特的身份及文化。 
以人權、民主及自由等普世價值去連繫世界，以感動更多人站出來支持香港。 



 

 


 
 

With our exhibition designers, we are presenting interactive displays, photographic & video documentations of ways in which citizens react and respond in times of urgency— of testimonials, creative performances, and other disobedient civic actions taken to the streets. 
Street art and graphic design are defining features of the pro-democracy demonstrations. Not only do they visually convey the stories and emotions of the people, its collective mode of production reflects the unique culture and identity of Hong Kong. Our exhibition aims to celebrate and exemplify the decentralized, democratic nature of the movement, by presenting the crowd sourced and open sourced artworks and posters that are shared online and disseminated on Lennon walls across the city. 
 
香港的街頭充滿各人的吶喊，成為了意識形態的戰場，並讓人深切感受香港人的毅力。我們將藉互動式作品、照片、影象等表現香港人以文字、富有創意的方式及各種公民行動去極速應對暴政的打壓及社會的反應。
這場民主抗爭運動的其中一個特徵是街頭藝術及各種設計。這些作品除了向觀眾細說不同故事及情感，其集體創作的特色更反映出獨特的香港文化及人文特質。為此，我們選擇展出於網上及連儂場遍地開花、百花齊放的藝術品及文宣，以突出這場運動去中心化及重視民主的特色，並由選出的作品去體現香港人所重視的普世價值。
As part of the exhibit, we are looking to collaborate with oversea non-Hong Kong groups such as Taiwanese, Tibetan, East Turkestan groups for the launch event, talks, and panel discussions, to be live-streamed. To allow audiences outside of NYC to engage in our show, we are collecting Lennon Wall messages to be displayed in our exhibit. Follow our Facebook page for more updates.
作為藝術展覽中的一部分，我們計劃邀請來自台灣丶西藏及東突厥斯坦的嘉賓，參與開幕及座談會等活動。為使紐約以外的人參與這個展覽，現場將會提供直播。而特別在香港難以建立長久的連儂牆的時刻，我們希望收集大家的心聲共同建築展覽內屬於大家的連儂牆。更多詳情將會稍後公佈，請密切留意我們Facebook上的最新動向。 



We are pleased to collaborate with Hong Kong Defiance-Voices Book publishing team. Many of the artists presented in our exhibit are included in this historic series of books. The book set is sold out in Hong Kong, We now have a limited amount of the book set in New York City , Hong Kong supporters in the United States can pre-order the book set with us for the month of July and pick up at our exhibition ( end of August). Our team can arrange domestic shipping to other part of the U.S for additional postal fees. To place an order for U.S shipping or pick up please email : hkartexhibition2020@gmail.com
我們很榮幸能夠和《誰衛我城•DEFIANCE》的出版隊伍合作，並展示部分收錄於這套書內藝術家們的作品。



We are actively planning our exhibition to be held in NYC in August. Proceeds will go towards venue rental, audiovisual equipment rental, mounting materials, art supplies & printing, insurance, and exhibition set up costs. In the spirit of transparency & accountability, we will post a full accounting of all expenditures for our donors to view. Remaining funds after the show will be donated directly to designated charities in Hong Kong. (to be announced to our donors before the show). Details of budgets please see here. 
我們現正積極向着於2020年8月在紐約市舉行展覽。財政支出的項目包括展覽場地的租金、影視器材的租金、裝裱用料、藝術作品裝運及印刷費用、保險費用，以及展覽品擺設費用等。我們會秉承會計責任及展示財政透明度，展覽完畢將會向捐助者分發一份詳盡的財政支出會計列表。若有剩餘捐款，我們會直接捐獻給指定的香港相關慈善團體。(展期前將會向捐助者公佈有關慈善團體的名稱) 展覽預算內容詳情請參考。
 




Tiananmen Square Massacre event with various groups, on June 4, 2020. Photo credit: Thirdblade Photography
 
We are a group of volunteers / Hong Kongers living and working in New York City connected through marches and events in NYC happening throughout last year. Our core group consists of an art director, a graphic and exhibition designer, a fashion designer, and a real estate agent, working a full-time job or studying in the city. We welcome more volunteers to join our team in NYC.  Please contact us if you would like to know more! 
我們是一群來自香港，現今在紐約市生活及工作的義工。因緣際會下，我們去年在紐約市的遊行活動中相識相知。我們懷著簡單的願景，期望藉著展覽引起觀眾留意有關議題。我們的核心工作人員包括藝術指導、平面及展覽設計師、服裝設計師、地產經紀, 學生等。我們歡迎更多本巿市民加入這義工行列，歡迎隨時聯絡我們！
Follow us on our Facebook page
Follow us on our Instagram
Watch our videos on our YouTube channel 



 

Your gracious support is critical to make this exhibition happen. Considering the high costs of expenditure in New York City, we won't be able to do it alone without the collective effort. Please continue to follow us as we periodically update the progress for the project via social media platforms, thank you! 
由於租場費用、作品運送及印刷、租借器材等製作費成本高昂，我們實在難以獨自承擔所有費用，而若未能籌得所需的基本款項，這場展覽將難以實行。如果大家認同我們的構思，我們誠意邀請大家支持令這場展覽得以實現。我們會定期在社交媒體上發佈最新進度，請繼續關注及分享本計劃給你的親友。多謝！

story:
By popular request...

Before telling you more about Popseekl, you can find below a zoomed-in version of our perks. After picking the perk, select your favourite version by referring to the green numbers below. For detailed information and more pictures on each and every t-shirt/print, please visit the dedicated page on our website.

Collab t-shirts

 

Collab prints

 

What is Popseekl?

 

How far are we?

A Minimum Version of Popseekl has launched just a couple of months ago (February 2021). Today, we are already helping many creators, who actively use the platform, connect with our community and sell their pieces.

  • 2000+ IG followers
  • ~500 registered users
  • 100+ artists/creators and 400+ pieces
  • and we are recording our first sales :)

 

Why this crowdfunding?

Given the strong interest and encouraging take-up rate, we've decided it's already time to gear up.  We are working on a new version of the software, which will consist of a shiny, rock-solid new web platform and its mobile-app buddy.  At the same time, we are reaching out to the best talents around to share our vision and onboard them to our community.

We are currently self-financing the project, but significant resources are necessary to bring it to the next level. To avoid reaching the end of our rope before making our dream come true,  we've decided to seek community support in order to raise €30,000.

 

What will you get in exchange?

This is a tricky one for any app trying to go the crowdfunding way, as you cannot really give a good deal on the product you are working on. There's little room for discounts when it comes to a mobile app that will be made available for free. So, app developers need to get creative when it comes to perks design.

In our case, it was a no-brainer.

Collab merch, art prints and specials...

Being a community dedicated to visual arts and creativity, we've teamed up with our user base of artists and joined forces to develop some pretty cool perks. By supporting our campaign, you can get your hands on a wide variety of t-shirts, art prints, zines created in collab with some of Popseekl pioneers.

...with a little help from my friends

We couldn't have asked for a more supportive community. This campaign wouldn't exist without the contribution of a group of extraordinary artists. A special thank goes to:

ScorpionDagger, Chiara Lombardi, Klim Kutsevskyy, Marta Morientes, Pierframes, Francesco Andreozzi, Funkblasted, Lucamata.

And the list will get longer as the campaign progresses.

Support now, or cry later

Also, the first 100 supporters will be granted access to our crowdfunding raffle and we'll get a chance to win a secret prize 

 

There's more to it

It's not just about perks though. Supporting our campaign means much more than getting some cool merch or great artwork.

Bring art back to life

It means bringing new generations closer to visual arts, helping artists to leverage the digital world the same way other creative industries are doing. Art is not just what you can find on art history books, or an asset you can invest in. Art is made of thousands of extraordinary living creators, whose pieces have the power to move people no less than the release of a new song, or the drop of a new pair of sneakers. We believe a social environment is essential to give visual artists the exposure and the resonance they deserve.  

Empower thousands of creators

It means contributing to the creation of a new platform that will empower artists from all over the world to reach a much wider audience than they currently can. With respect to existing online platforms, we aim at creating a much more engaged and enthusiastic community around our creators.

Make the art world fair 

It means fixing the way the pie is shared in the art world. In a world where a 40-60% middlemen commission is the norm (even online!), we are pioneering a paradigm shift where the lion's share of the profit is kept by creators. Whenever you buy something on Popseekl, ~85% goes to the artist. The rest is held by Popseekl to keep things running and improving. 

 

Share our campaign with your network

Social sharing

Like our project? Every new supporter counts, so help us make a big noise about our campaign! Use the social sharing icon at the top of this page to share our campaign with your network, or send the link to this page to your friends!

Instagram raffle

Another way you can help us raise awareness about Popseekkl is via Instagram. Follow we_are_popseekl and share our crowdfunding-related content with your network. Don't forget to tag us to get a chance to win a secret prize in our raffle!

story:
137 PRODUCTIONS LAUNCHED THIS CROWDFUNDING PROJECT TO SUPPORT THE CREATIVE COMMUNITY AND CHARITIES IN LONDON : 

 GREAT ORMOND STREET HOSPITAL'S CHARITY, POSITIVE EAST AND ACTION 4 LONDON. 

The pandemic had a tremendous impact on the creative community and on charities, with most live and fundraising events canceled over the last year. 

Getting this project fully funded will allow us to support both artists and charities in London. 

 

THE CREATIVE PROJECTS  

 

WEARABLE ART BY PERLA 

We are producing a clothing line with figurative artist Perla Mignanelli, inspired by her paintings. Funding the project will allow us to hire a team of people to produce the first collection, manifest our creative idea of bringing arts off the walls, and give work to unemployed talents in the fashion industry.  Follow Perla on: https://bit.ly/2SuuNdy 

 

ABOUT WEARABLE ART AND OUR HIGHER GOAL  WITH THIS CAMPAIGN 

 

 

 

SKYROCKETING

Music artist and Entrepreneur Jimmy Brixton is producing a collection of 11 dance-house- electro songs with music producer TOKOTA. Funding this project will allow us to give work to musicians, songwriters, mixing engineers and to kick-start a record label, sign artists, and promote new independent music. 

For more info follow Jimmy on Instagram: https://bit.ly/3qwc0LA

 

SUPPORTING UP AND COMING CREATIVES 

We plan on utilizing some of the funds to support up-and-coming creatives in Lonon and help them get to the next level with their careers, may that be through studying, maintenance support, or coaching. 

 

REDEVELOPMENT OF AN ABANDONED RAILWAY STATION

We are supporting a creative collective redeveloping an abandoned railway station, being turned into a permanent art gallery. Funding this project will allow us to pay the painters, the constructors and to create a magical experience. 

 

SUPPORTING THE CHARITIES

 

 

Our plan is to start by donating 10% of the funds raised to Great Ormond Street Hospital's Charity, Action 4 London, and Positive East and then initiate a long-term partnership with these charities, organizing live events with our creative community in support of their fundraising efforts and work closely with them to further utilize art, music, and fashion as a tool to impact their missions an contribute to their outstanding causes. 

  • Great Ormond Street Hospital of Children's Charity: The Great Ormond Street Hospital is one of the world's leading children's hospitals and the largest pediatric center in the UK for pediatric intensive care, cardiac surgery, neurosurgery, pediatric cancer services including bone marrow transplants, nephrology, and renal transplants. Great Ormond Street Hospital Charity supports the hospital and its patients by funding four key areas:  rebuilding and refurbishment, support for families and children, research into children's health, life-saving medical equipment. 
  • Positive East: Positive East has been at the forefront of HIV service and care for three decades; supporting people from point of HIV diagnosis to longer-term care. Their mission is to improve the quality of life of individuals and communities affected by HIV and they developed a holistic range of health and wellbeing programs from counseling to workshops to HIV testing and prevention. They work towards three primary goals: promoting the physical and mental health of people living with HIV, supporting people to stay HIV negative, and influencing policy development and service improvement. 
  • Action 4 London:  Action 4 London is a volunteering organization empowering the most disadvantaged areas across London, providing the relative support and tools needed by a diverse range of vulnerable and disadvantaged people by also sharing their volunteers' team with other charities, housing associations, and London Councils.

To find out more -

 http://www.gosh.org  

www.positiveeast.org.uk 

http://www.action4london.org.uk

The magnitude of what YOU can do as a contributor will have a HUGE impact on the artists' projects, the sponsors' businesses, GOSH's, Positive East and Action 4 Lonon's charities.

 

HOW CAN I CONTRIBUTE?

 

The most effective way for you to support us is by making a direct monetary contribution to the project, by purchasing one of the rewards, or by simply donating.  Here's a list of ways to contribute, but feel free to do it as you wish and contact us if you have other ideas! 

  • BUY FROM OUR ONLINE SHOP - choose from our wide range of options and shop around!
  • MAKE A DONATION - you can simply donate without buying anything from the shop! any amount, high and small, is super appreciated. 
  • SHARE OUR PROJECT AMONG YOUR CONTACTS - allow us to reach new audiences by sharing our project on your social media accounts! 
  • BECOME A SPONSOR! - get in touch if you want to be featured on our online shop. WhatsApp us on +447909240844 or email us at 137productionhouse@gmail.com and tell us more about what you do and how we can collaborate. 

 

OUR FINANCIAL GOAL EXPLAINED 

 

Here's a breakdown for you in more detail : 

We need a minimum goal funding of £150k to produce the projects and support the charity.

  • 5% will be held by IndieGoGo as a platform charge; 
  • 10% will be donated to Great Ormond Street Hospital's Charity, Positive East & Action 4 London; 
  • 73% will go to the creative community;
  • 12% will be used to pay our team of creatives who have been working really hard behind the scenes to make this project happen (including campaign managers, video editors, photographers, pr, and social media managers!)

As there's been a lot of behind the scenes work to prepare for this campaign, let alone the ongoing work done by the artists to manifest their visions, we opted for a flexible funding campaign, which means we will receive our funds even if we don't reach the minimum goal set.  Obviously, we're here to win, but we want to cover our backs in the unlikely case of not fulfilling the goal entirely. 

The percentages calculations will remain the same despite the amount reached.  

 

THAT'S ALL FOLKS! 

Social media accounts to follow : 

@jimmybrixton_official

@perla.artdeco.uk

@137productions

 OUR FINANCIAL GOAL EXPLAINED  Here's a breakdown for you in more detail : We need a minimum goal funding of £150k to produce the projects and support the charity.
5% will be held by IndieGoGo as a platform charge; 
10% will be donated to Great Ormond Street Hospital's Charity, Positive East & Action 4 London; 
73% will go to the creative community;

12% will be used to pay our team of creatives who have been working really hard behind the scenes to make this project happen (including campaign managers, video editors, photographers, pr, and social media managers!)
As there's been a lot of behind the scenes work to prepare for this campaign, let alone the ongoing work done by the artists to manifest their visions, we opted for a flexible funding campaign, which means we will receive our funds even if we don't reach the minimum goal set.  Obviously, we're here to win, but we want to cover our backs in the unlikely case of not fulfilling the goal entirely. The percentages calculations will remain the same despite the amount reached.   THAT'S ALL FOLKS! Social media accounts to follow : @jimmybrixton_official@perla.artdeco.uk@137productions

story:
Short Summary

LANDSLIDE: The Polaroids of Wade Radford. A new LIMITED EDITION book from his archives, for the FIRST TIME. 

Due to the expense of producing Photography books we are running pre-orders via Indie Go Go to ensure we raise the much needed funds. 

Limited  Paperback A4 Book copies , please be sure to donate to not miss out on owning a First Edition that will NEVER be republished. A4, 84 pages, colour photographs feature throughout. Forewords included at front, but after that... PURE PICCIES... We don't want to be bogged down in text for an item such as this. Including previously  unpublished photos.

As you will see through this page you can buy an unsigned copy, signed copy or you will get a signed copy + your name at the back of the book as a supporter of creation. 

Synopsis- 

Often lonely, often minimalist- Wade Radford’s Polaroid archive is a rare glimpse into his quiet existence made up of road trips to historic locations, and eerily desolate snaps caught through his vision. This is a document of the horizons that please him, his beloved places and his pictures taken for his one off DIY poetry releases. Featuring landscapes, self portraits, England’s beautifully abandoned buildings; Landslide is a curious collection of everything and nothing… Wade Radford is an Independent artist from England most well known for his savage portrayal of Kayden ‘Quinn’ Daydream in the cult film ‘TWINK’. He is the writer of numerous poetry anthologies and zines, an independent artist, actor, filmmaker and loner.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

- We need to raise £445 to get the ball rolling, but any extra is a bonus. 

Many people have enquired about a photography book over the years and we are excited to bring it to you at last. This is a perfect companion to the 'NEW Flesh' book. 

ALL ORDERS will be released for shipping on November 15th. If the book sells out on pre-order we won't be reissuing any more copies. Support our campaign to avoid disappointment. 

Thank you,

<3  W

story:
New Options for Artists

JDA is a small company with a 20 year long tradition of serving the “Creative Rebel Alliance”… those creatives who have the audacity to compete with the famous and powerful and expansive and expensive leaders in the printing, design, and art worlds. We like being where the energy is and are proud to aid and abet some of the most original and imaginative people on Earth.

Today the majority of our clients are involved with creating beautiful things. Artists, Photographers, and Graphic Designers creating works of art for all of us to enjoy. What do we do?

  • We provide the services, support, inspiration, and connections to assist our clients in being successful.  
  • We photograph art work and make Archival Pigment Prints, also known as Giclées. 
  • We use our decades of color experience and printing knowledge to help people prepare their work to be printed throughout the world… catalogs, calendars, brochures, magazines, postcards… as well as in our studios. 
  • We advise clients on website design and optimization, social media, blogging, and other Internet related issues. 

We want to make new materials and venues available to these creative leaders, and we’d like to invite you to be a part of this adventure!

There is a technique by which inks can be infused into materials called Dye Sublimation*. By materials we don’t just mean fabrics… T-shirts, pillow cases, and the like… but exotic things like glass, ceramics, wood, plastics, and metal. We envision not only new marketplaces for the artists to conquer, but new elements for the creative mind to include in their artwork… perhaps whole new classifications for the art itself!

(Want to know what Dye Sublimation is? See * below!)

What We Need

We are setting our goal at $3800.

Dye Sublimation requires completely different equipment than we already have. 

  • A special printer equipped with unique Dye Sublimation inks.
  • A specialized heated press to do flat items.
  • Specialized wraps to do additional non- uniform items.
  • A dedicated convection oven to custom projects.
  • A small, ready inventory of items to be sublimated.
  • Transfer paper, silicone sheets, cooling racks, gloves and tools to handle hot items, and various other supplies.

We’ve set our goal to fund an entry level to our project. If we go over our funding goal, we intend to use the proceeds to purchase more advanced equipment to allow for larger items and a more efficient workflow, as well as additional inventory. 

We will proceed with the project and fulfill all the promised Perks whether we reach our goal or not, and all the raised funds will apply to those goals. We are committed to this new branch of JDA. We feel it’s important, not just for our company, but to the art community, to bring new options… in marketing and the creative process.

What You Get… Perks

We hope you’ll find these incentives attractive, but we are open to ideas! If you don’t see something that grabs you, email us and tell us what would! 

  • $1 Our undying thanks. Every dollar helps achieve our goal, and we are truly grateful! 
-------------------------------------------------------
  • $10 A thank you email with 4 custom wallpapers (The Seasons) for your computer or cell phone
--------------------------------------------------------
  • $35 Poster Print of 
    • “Endlessly Curious” 8”X18”
Personalize this Perk with a name or message for just $10 extra!
-----------------------------------------------------------------
$50 Wall Graphic- Reposition-able Adhesive Fabric
  • “No Limits”18”X22”



Personalize this Perk with a name or message for just $10 extra!

------------------------------------------------------------------------

$35 Beer Colors Stein


Personalize this Perk with a name or message for just $10 extra!

-------------------------------------------------------------------------


$50 Pair of Coffee Mugs

  • Coffee
  • Tea

Personalize this Perk with a name or message for just $10 extra!
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
Fine Art Perks
  • $125 16”X20” Signed and Numbered Open Edition Artist’s Giclée on Artist’s Watercolor Paper


  • $350 20”X24” Signed and Numbered Open Edition Photographer’s Giclée on Archival Canvas
    • “Bedtime Story” By Award Winning Wildlife Photographer Scott Shuey

Don't see something that catches your eye?

Virtually everything JDA does for it's clients is customized. If you'd rather see one of your own photos or art pieces on a mug or a canvas,just contact us. We will happily make it happen for you!

Other Ways You Can Help

Like the idea but can’t contribute? You can help us tremendously by telling your friends, relatives, and social media contacts about our project! We need your help spreading the word, and using the IndieGoGo Share Tools makes that easy.

*What is Dye Sublimation?

Perhaps you have experienced this: You find an ice cube in the freezer that has been there a long time. It’s much smaller than a fresh one, but it’s been frozen the entire time!?! What happened? This is an example of the process of sublimation. The frozen water goes directly from the solid state (ice) to the gaseous state- essentially cold steam. In the Dye Sublimation  printing process, the same thing happens except we use heat instead of cold and ink instead of water. We use a special ink to print on a particular paper receiver stock. The image is attached to the item to be “sublimated”, and heat is applied. The ink becomes a gas then permeates and bonds with the item. Unlike every other printing method where the inks lie on the surface of what’s being printed, the sublimation inks become part of the items surface. This allows us to make bright, durable prints on materials that haven’t been possible before.

story:
This campaign continues to collect donations at The Kerulos Center.


Monument to an Ancient Culture

Maori master artists, Ian George and Henry Tavioni, are creating a metal and stone sculpture of Honu, the green sea turtle (Chelonia mydas) to be unveiled during the Cook Islands' 50th Anniversary Independence Day celebrations, August 4, 2015. It will stand in front of the Cook Islands Ministry of Education and UNESCO building where national and international students, religious leaders, officials, and the public visit daily.

The Cook Islands Honu Monument is a testimony of dignity and compassion that celebrates tribal and wildlife societies who have lived side-by-side for thousands of years. 

How Can Art Save an Endangered Species?

The symbolism of the turtle is important to me as a Polynesian because of the layers of multiple meanings the icon conveys. I incorporate the Honu into my art with my paintings and my sculptures. It is also an image I wear inked onto my body again because of its significance within the Pacific indigenous communities. – Ian George
Art is one of humanity’s most beautiful expressions that inspire people to do great things. The Cook Islands Honu Monument is not just about sea turtles. It’s not just about humans. It’s about a global inter-species movement—the celebration of a way of life that flourished with all of nature.


Pacific Islanders have lived with sea turtles for thousands of years. Polynesian peoples and wildlife have lived together with mutual regard and respect. The Honu (green sea turtle) symbolizes this ancient pact, a pact that has not been honored by modern humanity.

Sea turtles are teetering on the edge of extinction. Unless this is stopped, they will follow the dodo and albatross and the ever-growing list of animals who are disappearing because of modern human pollution and waste. Our own species is in danger; not only our physical survival, but the survival of our souls. But we can turn this around. The monument is one giant step towards a new future. It represents humanity’s commitment to renewed peace and well-being for all animals and the tribal peoples who have kept wildlife cultures free and thriving.

Our Gift to the Future

Young ones learning to tally hatched eggs.
In conjunction with The Kerulos Center's Sacred Bones Project, the monument will serve as a pivot for education and advocacy among local and international communities to inspire conservation and cultural revitalization. This project integrates art into a conservation education and outreach program conducted by Dr. Michael White.

Dr. White's conservation education includes classroom and field activities to study  biodiversity, sustainability, and environmental balance to ensure healthy ecosystems for future generations. Senior students assist in various phases of research, including surveys of critical green sea turtle nesting beaches on remote cays, inventories of nests after hatching, genetic sampling, and tagging. Classroom resources include designing and printing educational resources in local languages.


Our Story

It all started with Honu—the green sea turtle.

One day, while developing curricula for our Sacred Bones Project, we came upon the idea of Wildlife Monuments. Sacred Bones is a learning-in-service program that combines science, history, and tribal culture with practical hands-on work to aid endangered wildlife and foster nature-based consciousness (see video below).


Companion sculptures designed by tribal artists seemed the perfect way to expand our mission to support wildlife and tribal self-determination worldwide. Monuments are usually for humans, and also many are created in memory of those who have died. But we wanted to have something that celebrated the living—sea turtles who are struggling to survive.

Sea turtles have lived on earth since the dinosaurs—for over 200 million years. But, because of modern humans, they have been pushed to the edge of extinction.

The cultures of tribal humans who have lived side by side with the turtles for thousands of years are also endangered. Creating the Honu monument and its unveiling on the 50th anniversary of the Cook Islands' Independence celebrates the ancient pact between Pacific Islanders and their marine kin.

Like the sea turtle, our team spans the globe. The sea turtle is therefore a symbol of human unity and cooperation. By linking art with education and science, the Honu represents active engagement to inspire modern human cultural change and return to peaceful and respectful ways of living.

The Sacred Bones Vision

The Cook Islands Honu Monument is the first of seven planned sculptures in the Sacred Bones Project that will be designed and created around the world by tribal artists—one for each endangered sea turtle species. The seven monuments will crystallize artistic, cultural, and scientific communication and exchange among sea turtle peoples, tribal cultures with deep traditional knowledge of living sustainably in ocean ecosystems.

What We Need & What You Get

Sea turtle design by Eric Bergeron used to create a temporary tatoo, the perk for a $100 donation.
You are a part of this new future, this new present that is committed to saving sea turtles and creating a monument for the living.

What We Need

The Kerulos Center seeks $19,000 to create and place the Honu monument and launch a green sea turtle conservation education program. Here's how the money will be used:


Design and create metal sculpture

$2000

Design/carve stone base for metal sculpture    

$2000

Cutting and welding

$3000

Install metal sculpture into stone base

   $500

Materials

$2900

Conservation Education

 $4000

Local Media, Outreach, and Marketing

  $1950

Operating Expenses

 $2650

If we exceed our funding goal of $19,000, all excess proceeds will be dedicated to future wildlife monuments as planned in the Sacred Bones Project. Should we not reach our funding goal, here's what we plan to do. First, we'll pay whatever expenses we've incurred, primarily transaction fees and the cost of perks. If we have around $10,000 remaining, we'll create and erect the Honu monument without the Conservation Education portion of this project.

If we fall substantially below that number, we'll do one of two things based on the team's assessment at the time: (1) continue fund-raising activities in other venues until we have enough to create the monument; or (2) allocate funds to conservation education (art + science) in the Cook Islands, with a focus on the endangered Honu, green sea turtles, and the ocean ecosystems where they live.

What You Get

Your contributions, small or large, speak loudly for Honu.  In gratitude for your contributions, we have a diverse collection of perks ready to ship. The one we're most excited about is a temporary tatoo based on an original sea turtle design by artist Eric Bergeron (see image above).

Other Ways  You Can Help

Now that you know about this project that weaves art, science, and conservation together, would you help us get the word out? Use the Indiegogo share tools and other social media and help us reach across the globe and create an enduring artistic legacy for Honu and the Cook Islands!


The Kerulos Center is an exempt 501(c)(3) non-profit organization (EIN: 26-1402190). Donations are tax deductible to the full extent of the law.  Our vision is a world where animals live in dignity and freedom. We translate this vision into everyday living by helping animals in need. Our work empowers people to change their lives for animals to make all places sanctuary. You contribution will help create this enduring artistic legacy for education, conservation, and cultural revitalization.

story:
Bref résumé

« When I was a young boy
At the age of five
My mother told me
I'll be the greatest man alive. »

Muddy Waters – Mannish boy.


L'idée c'est de faire un film d'acteur, de poésie, d'astronomie, de rage de vivre et de blues. Un court-métrage de 35 minutes.

Mon nom est Hugo Prévosteau, je suis Français, scénariste et réalisateur de ce projet. A Paris avant, ou j'apprends le métier de comédien et réalisateur, je vis et travail à Montréal depuis trois ans.

Débarqué fraichement à Montréal, je rencontre le groupe RANDOM RECIPE pour lequel je réalise deux vidéoclips ainsi que plusieurs capsules promotionnelles.

Mais aussi et surtout, je découvre le théâtre Sainte-Catherine, avec la troupe du Nouveau International, foyer d'acteurs, de réalisateur et de metteur en scène de toute sorte dans un joyeux bordel bilingue.

Je tombe amoureux de la place et en fait ma deuxième maison.

Pendant les trois derniers années, je collabore avec Alain Mercieca et Anton Golikov sur des pièces, des vidéos des mises en scènes et plus récemment sur un court-métrage, « Safeword », écrit et réalisé par mes soins qui sortira début 2105.

Je quitte bientôt le Canada, après le tournage de ce film pour rentrer en France et ce sera mon dernier projet en tant que Montréalais. Je veux ce film comme un feu d'artifice à la gloire de Montréal, à la gloire de la jeunesse, de l'univers et du blues.

J'écris mes scénario pour les réaliser et c'est comme ça que j'envisage mon métier de réalisateur, comme un tout, d'abord avec l'écriture puis ensuite avec le travail d'acteur et la réalisation.

Mannish boy est un film sur l'adolescence, l'ennui, le cosmos et la rage de vivre.

L'action se déroule dans la communauté haute en couleur Russe de Montréal. Travailler avec Anton Golikov pour incarner ce personnage complexe coulait de source.

Pouvoir réaliser ce dernier projet serait un beau moyen pour moi de remercier cette ville et les gens que j'y ai rencontré.

Hugo Prévosteau

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Pourquoi on a besoin d'argent ?

En clair les 15000$ servirons à payer:

-Les techniciens ( Directeur de la photographie, directeur artistique, électros.) - 6000$

-Location des lumières - 3000$

-Production ( repérages, organisation du tournage, casting, régie.) - 3000$

-Payer les frais de post-production. (Montage, colorisation) - 2000$

-Publicité, promotion - 1000$

In return, check out some of the perks! I will gear them specifically towards you and your interests.

L'impact

Mannish boy est le deuxième court métrage de la boîte de production Les Mains Dans Les Poches fondée par Hugo Prévosteau.

Ceci est la première vidéo d'une série de cinq trailers qui seront diffusés chaque semaine pendant un mois pour le film Mannish boy.

Mannish boy est un film sur des poupées russes, des engueulades aux milieux de la nuit, sur le blues, le passage à l'âge adulte et le cosmos.

Mannish boy, c'est le voyage initiatique de Roman, jeune homme de la communauté Russe de Montréal, au visage pré-pubère animé d'une rage de vivre. Personnage au caractère impétueux et un peu tête à claques qui va vivre , le temps d'un week end, des événements bizarres et un peu dérangeants qui vont changer sa vision du monde.

Synopsis

Roman, un jeune homme d'origine russe vivant à Montréal et au visage d'ange fait un rêve étrange. Il rêve qu'il marche dans la rue et qu'il est soudainement entouré par des centaines de poupées russes. A l'intérieur de l'une d'elle se trouve une ampoule allumée, il la touche, se brûle et l'explose à coup de batte de baseball.

Il s'en suit une engueulade extrême avec sa copine en rentrant de soirée, une explosion ou la vaisselle et les insultes pleuvront.

Roman apprend ensuite par sa mère qu'il doit quitter le nid familial car elle s'est trouvée un nouvel amant.

Roman fulmine et s'embarque dans une soirée trash avec ses deux amis Dimitri et Lev. Soirée qui finit en psycho drame avec Roman ivre mort menaçant de sauter du troisième étage.

Le lendemain, Roman part à la campagne pour rendre service à son père, qui tient un garage, en allant chercher une porte de voiture chez un particulier.

Ce qu'il va trouver le changera à tout jamais.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with your friends and family, on Facebook and elsewhere! Help me spread the word.

Also, check out  my website www.hugoprevosteau.com
story_txt:
Bref résumé


« When I was a young boyAt the age of fiveMy mother told meI'll be the greatest man alive. »

Muddy
Waters – Mannish boy. 


L'idée c'est de faire un film
d'acteur, de poésie, d'astronomie, de rage de vivre et de blues. Un court-métrage de 35 minutes.

Mon nom est Hugo Prévosteau, je suis
Français, scénariste et réalisateur de ce projet. A Paris avant,
ou j'apprends le métier de comédien et réalisateur, je vis et
travail à Montréal depuis trois ans.

Débarqué fraichement à Montréal, je
 rencontre le groupe RANDOM RECIPE pour lequel je réalise deux
vidéoclips ainsi que plusieurs capsules promotionnelles.
Mais aussi et surtout, je découvre le
théâtre Sainte-Catherine, avec la troupe du Nouveau International,
foyer d'acteurs, de réalisateur et de metteur en scène de toute
sorte dans un joyeux bordel bilingue. 

Je tombe amoureux de la place et en
fait ma deuxième maison.
Pendant les trois derniers années, je
collabore avec Alain Mercieca et Anton Golikov sur des pièces, des
vidéos des mises en scènes et plus récemment sur un court-métrage,
« Safeword », écrit et réalisé par mes soins qui
sortira début 2105.
Je quitte bientôt le Canada, après le
tournage de ce film pour rentrer en France et ce sera mon dernier
projet en tant que Montréalais. Je veux ce film comme un feu
d'artifice à la gloire de Montréal, à la gloire de la jeunesse, de
l'univers et du blues.

 J'écris mes scénario pour les
réaliser et c'est comme ça que j'envisage mon métier de
réalisateur, comme un tout, d'abord avec l'écriture puis ensuite
avec le travail d'acteur et la réalisation.
Mannish boy est un film sur l'adolescence, l'ennui, le cosmos et la
rage de vivre. 

L'action se déroule dans la communauté
haute en couleur Russe de Montréal. Travailler avec Anton Golikov
pour incarner ce personnage complexe coulait de source. 


Pouvoir réaliser ce dernier projet serait un
beau moyen pour moi de remercier cette ville et les gens que j'y ai
rencontré.

Hugo Prévosteau

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez


Pourquoi on a besoin
d'argent ?

En clair les 15000$ servirons à payer:

-Les techniciens ( Directeur de la
photographie, directeur artistique, électros.) - 6000$
-Location des lumières - 3000$
-Production ( repérages, organisation
du tournage, casting, régie.) - 3000$
-Payer les frais de post-production.
(Montage, colorisation) - 2000$
-Publicité, promotion - 1000$In return, check out some of the perks! I will gear them specifically towards you and your interests.

L'impact

court métrage de la boîte de production Les Mains Dans Les Poches
fondée par Hugo Prévosteau.

story:
Please donate to save a bit of Sheffield's quirky history.

I usually come to Sheffield once a year for the renowned Sheffdocfest. Last year I discovered that Heavy Plant, my favourite Sheffield public sculpture, was facing imminent destruction. I had 6 weeks to save it from the bulldozer. I set up a campaign and with help from lots of people and Tesco we managed to get it professionally dismantled onto a giant special truck. It's now being safely stored at Kelham Island Industrial Museum. 


This year, I'd like your help to give something back to Sheffield and get this fabulous, iconic and maverick sculpture reconstructed and re-sited.


If everyone at the docfest gave A fiver we'd have enough to do it! 


Please donate - it's time to re-pot Heavy Plant!

Heavy Plant is special because it was one of the very first art commissions in the newly named Industrial Quarter. It is a powerful sculpture connecting Sheffield's proud steel heritage to today's cultural renaissance. It celebrates the unsung heroes; the people that actually worked in the little mesters yards and independent cutlers of Sheffield.


Built by sculptor David Kemp in 1988, Heavy Plant takes the form of an imaginary furnace with a bizarre spray of materials - including shards of glass and toolmakers offcuts - erupting dramatically from the top. 

The sculpture stands eighteen feet high and is built from recycled debris that Kemp found on Sheffield’s derelict industrial sites. He used material from local toolmakers and cutlers, old factory windows and even bits of defunct machinery. 


The sculpture celebrates Sheffield’s past as the City of Steel and reflects the fact that after the demise of so many of its old industrial buildings, a new and vibrant city of culture has emerged.


A new development is being built over the old site by BMB Property developers for Hallam University, to build new luxury student accommodation Pearl Works.


Sara Hill set up the campaign:


“I have long been a fan of Heavy Plant and was very sad to witness its dilapidation and hear of its possible demise,” she said earlier this week. “For the past 18 years I have been coming to Sheffield for the annual Sheffield documentary festival. Every year I would visit the sculpture, take photos and introduce others to it. I love its wit and charm. The fact that it is made of heavy old steel plant materials, made by the hard working men and women of the industrial era, yet it looks like a plant and the top thistle even blows in the wind like long grass. I started this campaign to save and relocate this important work.

The original artist David Kemp is not in good health and now lives in west Cornwall. I've since had the pleasure of visiting David in his studio and it's been a privilege to get to know him and see more of his works. He has given his blessing and support to two local artists to repair Heavy Plant and re-imagine it - perhaps as part of a new work to reflect a new location in the area. Jason Heppenstall, like David, makes beautiful sculptures out of scrap metal and Andrew Vickers is a sculptor and stonemason.” Darren Bown, conservation engineer at SIMT and maker, will be assisting them.

 Some of David's other work includes the Navigators at Hayes Galleria. http://www.atlasobscura.com/places/the-navigators 

and the much loved Well Heeled Bitches 

http://www.davidkemp.uk.com/tinners-hounds/


Thanks to Jaqui Bellamy and Eve Wood we've also been filming the campaign and hope to turn it into a short film. David Kemp still has some of his original sketches and watercolours so we plan to mount an exhibition when it's all done.


If you'd like to hear the full story and see more photos and videos, take a look on Facebook for now, there will be a blog and Instagram coming soon



For more information and contacts:

Sara Hill

saveheavyplant@gmail.com

@saveheavyplant


www.facebook.com/saveheavyplant

story:
New Yorkers are fortunate to live with public art, art that they meet over and over and become familiar and intimate with. Art that elevates their mood and represents the value of culture shared with thousands of visitors every year.  

There is an element of surprise in public art that stops you in your tracks and nourishes your humanity. Its a gift to the city and all who visit, a gift of art in our everyday lives. 

This year New Yorkers will find new friends in the major exhibition of sculptures by American artist Joy Brown on the green malls in the center of Broadway, NYC,  between 72nd Street and 166th Street.   

Nine of Brown’s larger-than-life bronze figures occupy public spaces inviting interaction and camaraderie. The sculptures draw you in—endearing figures with their earthy patina, the rounded forms conveying the heavy gravity of stone; the expressions and gestures transcend that weight, radiating warmth and inviting you to come close, to touch. They hold a space of stillness and peace. 

 Art movers worked nearly 10 hours in the wee hours of the night maneuvering Joy's bronze figures in place. This after shipping containers from China landed, permits were filed and cranes and trucks hired. 

Planning of this exhibition has taken years, Morrison Gallery co-presenting the exhibition has contributed significantly both financially and logistically however,  

WE NEED HELP to pay for this momentous exhibition. 

We Need $40,000. to defray our costs of shipping and installing. 

For your contribution you could receive any number of delightful Joy Brown creations, from drawings to palm sized animals to a pair of bronze animals! 

 

Any funds we receive will to go our debts of shipping and installing 

 

This outdoor exhibition is free and open to the public 24/7 , its an exciting prospect for art to be on view all the time, to anyone and everyone who walks on broadway for the next 6 months.  Its an inclusive installation allowing all to engage and enjoy no matter one's economic status, age, race or religion. Its for you and everyone you know. 

In the past we have witnessed the glee and happiness Joy's sculptures evoked when placed in public locations. To imagine the number of people touched by these works and touching them, on Broadway, everyday in NYC is inspiring. 

 

If you can't help financially, you can help by Spreading the Word!  

Your time and energy spent sharing our cause is valuable to us!  We are excited about this project and want the world to know about it!   Indiegogo makes it simple to contact your friends via social media. 

Thank you, we appreciate your support in all its forms!

story:
SELAMAT DATANG (Welcome ;)

Indonesia biggest and free Street Art and Graffiti Festival NEED YOUR HELP to make it Incredible again !

We are a group of Street Art Enthusiasts,  coming from both local and expat communities in Bali and we have been working hard since 2015 to support the local Street art and graffiti communities to help the talented Balinese and Indonesian artists to be able to make a living from their work. We are also supporting different projects related to waste management or wildlife protection in Bali to protect this beautiful Island for the next generations to enjoy.

 

This campaign should help us to close the budget for our second edition of the TROPICA Festival. This event is a unique opportunity for the young and talented communities of Bali Street Art and Graffiti artists to connect with more experienced artists from all over the world.

All of us are working for FREE on these projects, and all our events are FREE for everyone to attend. We do manage to get a few sponsors every year to cover some of the costs related to the organization of the Festival, but we rely mostly on the generosity of private contributors to make it happen and to have a major impact for the local communities in Bali.

 

Our total budget for 2017 is 40’000$ and we have barely covered half of it with Sponsors this year, so your contribution is KEY to help us make it happen.

The money will be used to cover mostly the logistic, material, promotion costs and legal fees associated with the event.

If you can’t support us financially but you still want to help and you will be in Bali during festival dates, please get in touch with us to become part of our volunteer team

THANK YOU for your support

story:
Praise Jawn!

 

We are a Phamily of PiRats from Philly bringing our collective Jawn to the playa. Our Phamily consists of Artists, Performers, Musicians, Fire Conclave, Greeters, Rangers and most especially Pirates. First we brought the Philly Phreak Show, then the Yo! Union Guild and now we present the Shrine of Brotherly Love.
 
The Shrine of Brotherly Love is a communal collaborative skyscraper cityscape with interactive niches, unique relics and quotes representing the historical contributions of our great city and the expression of its burner community. Each member of our camp has contributed a detailed element to the Shrine. There will be one removable element that will be taken out before the burning of the shrines to be added to our Phamily's collection of regional project participation.
 
The Shrine of Brotherly Love debuted at PEX Summer Fest in Center Camp. Our PEX Phamily contributed their messages in our bottles which will come with us on our pilgrimage to the desert. When our Shrine is installed on playa we welcome the public to interact and contribute their own messages in our bottles to be burned with the Man.
 
Our Shrine will be placed on the 9:00 side of the Man Pavilion.
 
Please consider supporting our radical ritual through contributing to our campaign and spreading the love.  Funds raised will be used to assist in covering project transportation costs and material embellishments such as lighting specific for use at Burning Man highlighting the details of the Shrine.  Once all project costs are covered any excess funds available will assist the support camp.  We are grateful for your continued support of the Philly Burners regional projects!  Burn baby burn!  )'(
 
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Meet our Artists:

Here's a few stories from some of the Philadelphia Shrine Artists sharing the intimate details behind what inspired their contributions... 

 

- Mischa Greenberg and Melissa Bottiglio created a box for our Burning Man Shrine of Brotherly Love. Before designing our piece, we talked about the radical ritual (this year's Burning Man theme) surrounding capitalism, commercialism, and the almighty dollar. We built a shrine to the dollar, and included a couple other items that represent popular commercialism (Mickey Mouse, and the auto/oil industry) with Barbie-like figures bowing/yoga posing while worshiping the shrine... within a shrine. For the background, we tiled our rendition of Matisse's "Dancers," which is a piece that can be seen at The Barnes Museum, representing Philadelphia. We also like the juxtaposition of the figures freedom, dancing, being in the moment vs. the money-worshipers, being controlled by materialism. We hope you enjoy our contribution as much as we enjoyed creating it. XO

 

 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

- Becca Johnson's story behind the "Fairmount Park" box (the one with the copper wire wrap "tree"): We sit and watch the sunset from Lemon Hill, climbing trees and watching the city descend into darkness. You can catch a cool breeze and see the water from there. It's been 9 years that I have lived in this city and the escape that Lemon Hill gives me from the concrete hustle and bustle can't be found anywhere else in the city of Brotherly Love. This kind of love is special as it unites two completely separate environments. On one side of the hill, you can see sloping green, trees climbing into the skyline and birds chirping. The other side the hill rolls down to the waterfront and is met by many lines of cars and people who are eager to start or end their day at the park. It's a  feeling of meditative quietness and solitude as you lay in the grass and another feeling that you're never quite alone when living in the city, a comfort in the loud noises that lulls you to sleep each night.

 

 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

- By Kim Traub: Ben Franklin said, "As we enjoy great advantages from the inventions of others, we should be glad of an opportunity to serve others by any invention of ours, and this we should do freely and generously." Ben Franklin would have been an excellent Burner.

To many Philadelphians, Ben Franklin is the ultimate Founding Father. His legend is familiar to most Americans as a self made, inventive Renaissance man with a hearty lust for life. The Shrine box I created for him was inspired by one of the oldest museums in the United States, the Franklin Institute; "...The Franklin Institute has played a central, yet constantly evolving, role in meeting the educational needs of America in the fields of science and technology. For the organization's first century, the Institute offered classes in mechanics, drafting, and engineering, and promoted science and invention." (https://www.fi.edu/about-us/mission-history)
The Benjamin Franklin National Memorial is a 20 foot high statue of Franklin located in the entry to The Institute. Of course, Ben is well known for many of his inventions, especially electricity and his famous kite and key experiment. He was a ravenous reader with a home filled with books an he invented bifocals so he could continue reading as he aged. His "bookish inclination" inspired him to become an accomplished printer and he started the first U.S. public library.  Poor Richard was a pseudonym he used to publish quotable wit and wisdom in the 1700s. One of the center piece exhibits in the Franklin Institute and favorite of school field trips in the Philadelphia area is the walk through anatomical heart complete with beating soundtrack. 
"The doors to wisdom are never shut."

Other symbols in my shrine box:
Brotherly love was also immortalized in Robert Indiana's "LOVE" statue, a park centerpiece and bookend to the Ben Franklin Parkway (the other end is the Philadelphia Museum of Art.) The Parkway is also home to the Rodin Museum, the largest collection of August Rodin's sculptures outside of Paris. His most famous work, The Thinker, is an appropriate figure to pair with Ben Franklin's desire for knowledge. "An investment in knowledge pays the best interest."

 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Tim Ahern and Nicole Russo: We made our little box in order pay homage to some things that we celebrate every day; colors shapes and sizes. Bright colors are one of our favorite ways of expressing ourselves. We are bright and colorful people! Different colored and sized spheres are glued together to form new constructs. They are meant to be reminiscent of the fact that even though we are all a bit different, if we come together we can make something new and beautiful. And it’s pretty awesome that they look like colorful boobs. We like boobs. Alot. There are also things that we only unveil to the most curious. Perhaps, if the sun has set and the stars are out you should look a little closer at our multicolored representation of some of the things that we are thankful for and see what you can find.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Jen Grace: Orpheus, the saddest robot,is walking in front of boathouse row like a #boss. This is a 221 piece robot I built...he is a music box and he lights up at night! He is my celebration of impermeance and understanding that it's okay to let go of things you've worked hard on. Even if it is beautiful and was your world for a moment in time.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

 

Read more about the Man Pavilion Shrine projects here:

https://burningman.org/event/brc/2017-shrines-and-processionals/

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Shrine of Brotherly Love at PEX Fest

Photos credit: Red Lite Photos
