story:
Short Summary

At Southern Pacific Review we publish "Latin America's Best Writing." Our focus is on publishing short stories and poems and news and commentary about Chile, South America, which is where we are located. 

We have an annual short story contest which is in its 5th year. 

Regarding Chile, I (Walker Rowe, the publisher) write articles focusing on corruption and pollution in Chile.  And I wrote a funny book about living in the country here.

My fiction and poetry editors are unpaid volunteers from the USA and Canada. So are our interns, but they are from different countries.

We accept no advertising and have no revenue.  I am the publisher and I pay all the expenses myself.  

What We Need & What You Get

It costs  $100 per month to pay for a poem, short story, and a dance and film review. Then we pay our web hosting company about $300 per year.  I pay all of this myself out of my tiny salary that I earn working as a freelance tech writer and writing news on Latin America for other sites.

What I want to do now is to bring in a couple of interns to help me finish writing stories on corruption in Chile.  So far, until we understand completely the cases we are investigating we are writing all of that on Wikipedia.  When we understand the issues 100% then we will write about it in on our site.
The Impact

We fill two needs.  Primarily we are a venue where poets and short story writers can publish their work.  The other is we are trying to expose some of the poverty and injustice in this nation. 

No one reads poems and short stories much anymore, except poets and short story writers, which is why the 150 year old Atlantic magazine quit publishing those.  But Jessica our poetry editor has a lively network of poets that she invites to publish on our site.  And Chris takes the short story submissions we get every month and picks 1 to publish.  Once per year Chris and I read the 90 or so short stories that people submit to our annual Southern Pacific Review Short Story contest.  We pick a winner and pay them $100. 

Risks & Challenges

We will continue operating whether we raise $500 (our goal) or $1.  It's just that I need a little help being the patron of the arts all by myself.

Other Ways You Can Help

I you  can't help then just mention to your friends our website and if they like literature they will find something here to read.  We are writers and writers must have their audience,

story:
Almost at our $10K minimum!


The Event: Eco_Hack 2016


The Location: Swale floating forest


What is Eco_Hack 2016 ?

Eco_Hack events center around large-scale, physical + digital + biological spaces. In addition to being installation artwork in their own right, these interactive environments serve as unique platforms for invited artists to create additional ambitious, multidisciplinary works.

This summer, Eco_Hack 2016 is taking place at Mary Mattingly’s Swale, a floating food forest on the Hudson River. In addition to Biome Arts' interactive bio-digital installation, Eco_Hack 2016 will include a performance series, activist summit, and skill-share workshops that are free and open to the public.


Diagram of power and digital system for Eco_Hack 2016


Prototype of forest projections for Eco_Hack 2016


Who is Biome Arts?

Biome Arts is a collective of artists, designers, engineers, biologists, and activists collaborating to make art that anticipate the next global paradigm: sustainable, open-source, commons-based culture. We're looking for alternatives to the destruction of the environment, copyright regimes that stifle innovation, and property regimes that diminish our common space.


Biome Arts’ previous installation “The Core”


Your Contribution Will Support

  • THE INSTALLATION gathers environmental data (precipitation, wind, moisture, plant growth, etc.) from the surrounding plants and projects interactive data visualizations back onto the structure and forest.

  • PERFORMANCES such as Shake by Lucia Monge, which uses a speculative language informed by the installation’s data to translate the movement of trees to the human body.

  • ARTWORK such as Data Bell by Brian House, where the installation’s data is mapped to the parameters of ringing bells that subsequently change their character, reflecting the "mood" of the forest.

  • SKILL-SHARES in urban agriculture, renewable energy, mesh networks, data privacy, etc. that contribute to self-reliance, grassroots organizing, and community-run local infrastructures in NYC neighborhoods.

  • ACTIVIST SUMMIT focused on developing a Green-Black Alliance (Green Party - Pirate Party) in NYC, i.e. a unifying banner and support network for the diverse initiatives and groups that currently support clean energy, cooperative economics, and open data in NYC and globally.

  • FLOATING COMMUNITY CENTER that functions as a lab, theater, gallery, school, and forum that offers an experimental, open-source response to climate change for NYC and other coastal communities around the world.


What We Need

We've secured funding from grants, foundations, patrons, and are soliciting in-kind donations from manufacturers and companies throughout our network. We are also asking for your help in raising the following:

  • MINIMUM BENCHMARK: $10,000 - We can make a smaller-scale version of the structure and create an installation that includes a basic sensor network, essential computing power, a solar array capable of minimal power duration, and 2 projectors for partial coverage of Swale.

  • FULL GOAL: $20,000 - We can make a full-scale version of the structure, create an installation with a robust sensor network, 4 projectors for greater coverage, stronger computing capabilities for more complex graphics, a more powerful solar array, and embedded audio equipment.


Past Experience

Biome Arts has a proven track-record. In the summer of 2014, we created Eco_Hack 2014 : a two-week symposium on ecology, technology, and the commons that culminated in the construction of a networked, semi-autonomous structure in the woods of Delhi, New York. This structure housed five more expansive artworks created by participants:



Campaign Perk Details

$25 - Biome Arts Zine 

  • An original design Biome Arts zine with the Eco_Hacking Manifesto

$50 - Kickass Coasters

  • An original design Biome Arts zine with the Eco_Hacking Manifesto

  • Set of 4 laser-cut Eco_Hack 2016 coasters

These stylish coasters are made of mirrored acrylic that is laser-etched with the real wood end grain patterns shown here. Dimensions: 1/8" (3.175 mm) thick and 3.75" (95.25mm) diameter.

$100 - Swale Cyanotype Print

  • An original design Biome Arts zine with the Eco_Hacking Manifesto

  • Handmade, one-of-a-kind cyanotype print of a plant on Swale

All perk cyanotypes are one-of-a-kind 9 x 12" (23 x 30.5 cm) prints created by placing plants directly onto paper and exposing them to the sun. All images are made using plants grown on Swale (mat not included).

$250 - Print + Lump Nubbin - Only 15 Available!

  • An original design Biome Arts zine with the Eco_Hacking Manifesto

  • Set of 4 laser-cut Eco_Hack 2016 coasters

  • Handmade, one-of-a-kind cyanotype print of a plant on Swale

  • Lump Nubbin by Biome Arts members Adam Frezza and Terri Chiao

Lump Nubbins - small mixed media plant sculptures on concrete base

$250 - 3 Swale Prints - Only 15 Available!

  • An original design Biome Arts zine with the Eco_Hacking Manifesto

  • Set of 4 laser-cut Eco_Hack 2016 coasters

  • Set of three unique cyanotype prints of plants on Swale

$500 - Super EcoHacker Skill-Share

  • An original design Biome Arts zine with the Eco_Hacking Manifesto

  • Set of 4 laser-cut Eco_Hack 2016 coasters

  • Set of three unique cyanotype prints of plants on Swale

  • Please CHOOSE ONE of these services provided by Biome Arts:

    • Create a custom laser etched art piece based on your photo/image

    • Create a custom cyanotype print using plants or image of your choice

    • 2hrs consultation on code, user interface, graphic design, and/or web platform via video call

$1000 - Ultra EcoHacker Skill-Share

  • All $500 level perks +

  • Please CHOOSE ONE of these services provided by Biome Arts

    • 5*1 hour photo lessons (NYC or via video call): basic to advanced, with Brooklyn-based Biome Arts member Sally Bozzuto. Camera, Photoshop, Lightroom, lighting, alternative process and film photography

    • 5*1 hour sessions with Biome Arts member Chihao Yo on how to code for your social activism with d3.js (Taipei, Taiwan or via video call).

    • 5*1 hour sessions on digital fabrication (Providence, RI): 3D printing, laser cutting, UV printing, CNC, plotter, vacuum forming, etc.

    • 5*1 hour lessons in creative coding from Saito Group: Processing (general creative software: data visualization, animation, etc.), Python (natural language programming), p5.js (visual web coding). (anywhere in the world, via video call)

$5,000 - Mega EcoHacker Skill-Share

  • All $1,000 level perks + 

  • 5 hours of consultation with Biome Arts on 21st Century Technology, Arts and Industries (Information Science, Bio-Tech, Digital Agriculture, Renewable Energy and Distributed Governance for Organizations) as it applies to you, your business or your community (anywhere in the world, via video call)

  • If you are in NYC during Eco_Hack 2016 (July 15th to August 15th), the core members of Biome Arts will take you on a personal tour of Swale and our installation, as well as out to dinner and drinks

Other Ways To Help

Please share this campaign and follow us on social media! 

  • Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/biomearts
  • Twitter: https://twitter.com/BiomeArts
  • Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/biome_arts


THANK YOU!


SEE YOU IN NEW YORK :)

All $1,000 level perks + 
5 hours of consultation with Biome Arts on 21st Century Technology, Arts and Industries (Information Science, Bio-Tech, Digital Agriculture, Renewable Energy and Distributed Governance for Organizations) as it applies to you, your business or your community (anywhere in the world, via video call)
If you are in NYC during Eco_Hack 2016 (July 15th to August 15th), the core members of Biome Arts will take you on a personal tour of Swale and our installation, as well as out to dinner and drinks



Other Ways To Help



Please share this campaign and follow us on social media! 

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/biomearts

Twitter: https://twitter.com/BiomeArts

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/biome_arts





THANK YOU!






SEE YOU IN NEW YORK :)

story:
(DEUTSCHER TEXT OBEN / ENGLISH TEXT BELOW)

Das Buchprojekt und unser Ziel

Das Kunsthaus KuLe steht für eine Utopie als Langzeitexperiment. Die Idee, Kunst und Leben zu verbinden, wird hier seit über 25 Jahren in gemeinschaftlicher Lebensform praktiziert. Das Buch dokumentiert die ungewöhnliche Geschichte dieses Hausprojekts in der Auguststraße 10 in Berlin-Mitte, vom Aufbruch in den 90er Jahren bis heute. Anhand von zahlreichen Texten, Interviews und einzigartigen Fotografien werden die seit Jahrzehnten gewachsenen Netzwerke einer Stadtentwicklung von unten sichtbar.

In den letzten zwei Jahren haben wir mit über 100 Menschen am diesem Buch gearbeitet. Nach einem spannenden Prozess und vielen Arbeitsschritten sind wir nun tatsächlich fast am Ziel!

Jetzt möchten wir unser Werk in die Welt schicken und mit vielen anderen diesen großen Erfahrungsschatz teilen. Es sind Geschichten, die den Mauerfall in Berlin und seine Auswirkungen bis heute widerspiegeln. Im Zentrum stehen Erfahrungen von Selbstermächtigung und die langjährige Praxis von Kunst und Leben in der Auguststraße 10 in Berlin-Mitte.

Es ist ein wunderschönes Archiv von 400 Seiten, davon 100 Seiten mit Bildern in Farbe, vielen Essays und Interviews, wissenschaftlichen Texten, Gedichten, Umfragen, einem Comic, einem grafischen Zeitstrahl, einem umfangreichen Glossar, einem Index zu verwandten Hausprojekten sowie 500 außergewöhnlichen Fotos.

Nun, im letzten Stadium vor der Realisierung, brauchen wir die Hilfe einer großen Community um die Druckkosten des Buches zu decken. Unser Fundingziel ist 21.000€. Bitte unterstütze uns in dieser letzten Etappe und werde Teil des kollektiven Prozesses!

Spirit von KuLe

Als wir anfingen, über ein Buch über die KuLe nachzudenken, entstand dies aus dem Bedürfnis, ein Stück Zeitgeschichte einzufangen, die unsichtbaren Fäden von Erinnerungen miteinander zu verknüpfen, Beziehungen aufzuzeigen und mit Bildern aus Vergangenheit und Gegenwart einen Boden für Visionen zu bereiten.

Dieses Buch wird ein wichtiges Archiv sein, nicht nur über das Kunsthaus KuLe, sondern auch über verwandte Hausprojekte, die nach dem Fall der Berliner Mauer – im „Sommer der Anarchie“ – entstanden sind und den besonderen Reiz Berlins bis heute prägen.

 

Mehr über das Buch

Das Buch wurde in fünf Hauptkapitel strukturiert und durch einen umfangreichen Anhang ergänzt. Den Einstieg bilden Erinnerungen zur außerordentlichen historischen Situation nach dem Mauerfall, deren Chancen von Menschen aus Ost und West unterschiedlich wahrgenommen wurden. Das nächste Kapitel konzentriert sich auf das Haus in der Auguststraße 10 und seinen Standort in Berlin-Mitte. Hier werden der alternative Umgang mit Eigentum und die Herausforderung der Sanierung thematisiert. Es folgt das Kapitel »Kunst und Aktion«, das die künstlerischen Interventionen der KuLe im Stadtraum mit performativen Projekten und den Fassadeninstallationen beschreibt. Nach einem Einblick ins Innenleben der Gemeinschaft, bei dem verschiedene Generationen zu Wort kommen, wird dem Austausch mit den Nachbarschaften im näheren und weiteren Umfeld Raum gegeben.

Der Anhang besteht aus einer Timeline, die die Ereignisse und Aktivitäten von 26 Jahren chronologisch sichtbar macht, einem Glossar für Begriffe, die außerhalb der Szene kaum verstanden werden, sowie einem Index zu 18 Hausprojekten und Kunsthäusern, die in einer Verbindung mit der KuLe stehen oder gestanden haben. Die zahlreichen Querverweise innerhalb des Buches laden die Leser_innen dazu ein, sich die Inhalte auf eigenen Wegen zu erschließen.

Das Buch ist auf Deutsch und Englisch, was auch die Alltagskommunikation in der heutigen KuLe widerspiegelt, die meistens zwischen deutsch und englisch wechselt. 

- English -

The Book Project & Our Goal

Kunsthaus KuLe is the embodiment of a utopia as long-term experiment. For over 25 years, the idea to connect art and life has been practiced here as a collective way of life. This book documents the unusual history of the house project at Auguststraße 10 in Berlin-Mitte, from its beginnings in the ’90s until today. Numerous texts, interviews and rare photographs lend visibility to networks engaged in bottom-up urban development that have grown and transformed over decades. 

For the past two years we have been working together with 100 people, writers, translators, graphic designers, activists, artists, past and present 'KuLes', to bring together this archive documenting the past 25 years of the Kunsthaus KuLe as an example of alternative city development and squatting in Berlin.

It is a beautiful archive comprising 400 pages, including 100 full-colour pages, with essays, interviews, scientific texts, poems, drawings, surveys, a comic strip, an illustrated timeline, an extensive glossary and over 500 rare photos.

Now, in the final stages, we are asking for help to raise funds to cover the printing costs of the book. We need to raise €21,000 for the printing! Please support us in this final stage and become part of the collective process.


In the Spirit of KuLe

Together, we are writing our own history by amplifying the voices of many people who for us embody relevant aspects of a huge community. There are views from the inside and from the outside, from different vocational fields like art, theatre, music, architecture, urban planning, journalism, cultural management, art and the natural sciences as well as from educational, social and technological professions. We are activating a collective memory that points out developments and also contradictions, and that brings different opinions to the debate. We hope that reading this is fun, that it gives food for thought, opens up perspectives and maybe encourages new germinations. 

As we began to think about a book on KuLe, it became clear that such a book would come from the need to capture a piece of contemporary history: to knot together invisible threads of memory, demonstrate relationships and prepare the ground for visions with images from the past and present.

This book will be both a collectors item, as well as an important archive not only about the Kunsthaus KuLe but about the history of Utopian living projects and the very particular history of Berlin squatting more generally. 

More about the Book

The book has been structured into five main chapters and is complemented by an extensive appendix. We start with memories of the exceptional historical situation after the fall of the Berlin Wall, which provided opportunities that were perceived differently by people from East and West. Chapter two shifts the focus to the house at Auguststraße 10 and its location in Berlin-Mitte. Here, alternative ways of dealing with property and the challenges of renovation are addressed. Chapter three, “Art and Action,” describes KuLe’s artistic interventions in urban space through performative projects and facade installations. After a glimpse into the inner workings of the community, in which different generations have their say, room is given to exchanges with neighbours from near and far.

The appendix consists of a timeline that shows the events and activities of 26 years in chronological order, a Glossary of terms that are little understood outside of the scene as well as a House-Project Index of 18 projects and art houses that are or have been connected to KuLe. The numerous cross-references within the book invite readers to explore the content along their own paths. 

The book is in both German and English, reflecting everyday communication in today’s KuLe, which mostly switches between the two languages. 

Wer hat es gemacht? Who made it? 

Kunst & Leben. Ein Haus in Berlin-Mitte seit 1990
Art & Life. A House in Berlin-Mitte since 1990

Editors / Herausgeberinnen: Ursula Maria Berzborn, Steffi Weismann
Design / Gestaltung: Hagen Verleger
Copyediting / Lektorat: Carina Herring, William Locke Wheeler

Texts, Interviews:
Corin Arnold/ED 2000, Gereon Asmuth, Antonia Baehr, Pepe Baumgärtner, Bettina Berger, Ursula Maria Berzborn, Ariane Beyn, Anne Biehl, Jörg Bodemann, Nicholas Bussmann, Mars Dietz, Nils Dümcke, Ulrike Ertl, Christian Falsnaes, Fernanda Farah, Benjamin Förster-Baldenius, Susanne von Falkenhausen, Farzad Farkhooi, Alicia Frankovich, Christopher Fuelling, Tim Edler, Janine Eisenächer, Heiko Gölzer, Elise Graton, Joshua Hakimi, Kathrin Hegedüsch, Jörg Heuer, Swantje Henke, Mathias Heyden, Pip Hill, Christian Kesten, Andreas Koch,  Birgit Kohlhofer, Uta Kollmann, Bettina Köppen, Andrea Kuhnke, Brandon LaBelle, Thalia Langer, Ranjana Leyendecker, Annette Maechtel, Joel Mu, Tom Mustroph, Eve und Carmi Neiger, Andrea Neumann, Helmut Neumann, Hank Obermayer, Karen Orth, HeikeMaria unVORStellBAR, Marianne Ramsay-Sonneck, Friedemann von Recklinghausen, David Reuter, Alex Martinis Roe, Arthur Rother, Jay Ruby, Felix Rüsing, Barbara Pradzyńska, Marcel Prüfert, Wally Potts, Jochen Sandig, Ines Schaber, Dorothee Scheiffarth, Todosch Schlopsnies, Nalin Sehgal von Hantelmann, Melanie Sehgal, Derek Shirley, Alexandra Spencer, Ulrike Steglich, Gislinde G. Strunz, Jan Theiler, Stefan Vens, Kirsten Wagenschein, Brita Wauer, Michael Wetekam, Liliane Weismann, Steffi Weismann, Lea von Wintzigerode, William Wheeler, Reinhard Zabka, Manuel Zimmer 

Photos:
Klaus Bädicker, Pepe Baumgärtner, Ursula Maria Berzborn, Debbie Davies, Robert Engelhardt, Christian Falsnaes, Alicia Frankovich, Andreas Kermann, Keno Hamer, Hakon Hoffarth, Brandon LaBelle, Judy Landkammer, Alex Martinis Roe, Navot Miller, Andreas Münstermann, Philipp von Recklinghausen, Max Schaffer, Nina Sidow, Isabell Spengler, Stefan Vens, Angelina Vinci, Steffi Weismann, Anja Weber, Rolf Zöllner, Liang Zhipeng, Krzyszof Zielinski u.v.a. / a.m.o.

Index Pages to the House Projects/ Index-Seiten zu den Hausprojekten: 
ACUD, Antje Öklesund, Schloss Bröllin, Brunnen 6/7, Duncker 14/15, Eimer, Flutgraben, K77, Kleine Hamburger 5, KuLe, Lychi 60, Linie 206, Schokoladen, Haus Schwarzenberg, Spreefeld, Gut Stolzenhagen, Tacheles, Tucho 30/32

Publishing House: Revolver Publishing Berlin

Perks

Wie die KuLe selbst, ist auch das Buch Teil eines kollektiven Prozesses, der sich weiterentwickelt. Mit einer Unterstützung für die Druckkosten kann man einen konkreten Baustein beitragen und je nach Wunsch, auch in persönlichen Kontakt mit dem Projekt kommen. Eine Kaffeeklatsch Haustour oder ein Wochenende für zwei machen es möglich. Alle Perks ab 35€ beinhalten ein KuLe-Buch.

Like the KuLe project more generally, the realisation of this book will continue to be a morphing, collective process. By supporting this campaign you become part of this process. By choosing 'KuLe experience' perks; such as our weekend stay for two and our Kaffeeklatsch house tour, you'll get to experience the project firsthand. All perks over €35.00 include a copy of the KuLe Book. 

Dem spielerischen Geist der KuLe entsprechend, stammen viele Perks aus gefundenen Schätzen und vergessenen Papieren, die irgendwo im Haus über Jahrzehnte lagerten und heute einen seltenen Wert haben. 

In the playful spirit of KuLe many of our perks include found treasures, art works, forgotten papers and original fittings from the house; objects that over time become rare and special keepsakes.

1. Original KuLe Artwork
Claudia Schiffer muß auch mal aufs Klo (Claudia Schiffer also uses the loo)
Dieses Bild hing im legendären KuLe Esszimmer, ein upgecyceltes Kunstwerk à la KuLe!  / Choose this perk to receive the KuLe Book plus an exclusive one of a kind KuLe up-cycled art work. In the spirit of KuLe this 350 x 350 mm painting has over time developed and used to hang on the wall of the legendary KuLe dining room. 

2. Ein Wochende in der KuLe /  Weekend Stay for Two At KuLe 

Verbringe ein Wochenende mit der Person deiner Wahl in der KuLe - das live-Experiment! Schau dir unser Video an um einen Eindruck davon zu bekommen. Du erhältst das Buch und die Gelegenheit Kunst & Leben an einem Wochenende zu zweit im Kunsthaus KuLe live zu erfahren, inklusive Nutzung des legendären Badezimmer und einem gemeinsamen Essen mit den Bewohner_innen und Freunden. / Ever wondered what it is like to be inside a living utopian experiment? With this perk you will receive the KuLe Book and have the rare chance to experience art&life during a weekend stay for two at the Kunsthaus KuLe. Includes a communal dinner with KuLe residents and friends. 

3. Buch + Probenraum / Book + Rehearsal Space
Wähle diesen Perk, um das KuLe Theater für eine Woche zum proben zu nutzen. Weitere Infos findest du auf unserer Webseite kunsthauskule.de / Choose this perk to receive the KuLe Book plus one week of rehearsal space in the KuLe Theatre. This 70 sqm space has been a laboratory for contemporary theatre and music for more than 20 years, and is the home of the legendary Labor Sonor concert series as well as many other artistic activities. 


4. Originale Türklinke / KuLe Book + Original Handle
Du bekommst ein Buch und die originale Türklinke zum Hofeingang der KuLe. / You will receive the KuLe Book plus an original, one of a kind wood and brass handle, an original fitting of the Kunsthaus KuLe building.


5.  Messing Türklinke aus der KuLe / Book + Brass Door Handle 
 Erhalte das KuLe-Buch mit einer originalen Messing-Türklinke des Kunsthauses KuLe, mit Spuren der Zeit und einer Aura von Kunst & Leben. / Receive the KuLe Book plus an exclusive one of a kind original brass door handle from the Kunsthaus KuLe. Only four available and each is a little different, wearing the marks of time and use, imbued with the aura of art&life.


6. Roulette Marke 20er Jahre / Book + Vintage Roulette Tokens
Du erhältst einen von nur vier originalen Roulette Jetons des Hotel Esplanade aus den 20er Jahren mit einem KuLe-Buch. Für Sammler! / We uncovered these original roulette tokens, dating back to the 1920s, from the famous Esplanade Hotel Berlin in the KuLe attic. This perk includes a copy of the KuLe Book and a selection of collectable roulette tokens.


7. Liebhaber Kombipaket  / Collectors Combi-Pack
 Erhalte ein persönlich signiertes Buch im Kombipaket mit der AK Kraak DVD und einer Kollektion von schönen DDR-Papieren aus dem KuLe Archiv. / Receive an exclusive signed copy of the KuLe Book plus an AK Kraak DVD and a vintage paper set selected from KuLe's rare paper collection.
8. KuLe Kaffeeklatsch  / Book + House tour + Coffee
 Erhalte das Buch mit einer Haustour und einem Schwatz bei Kaffee und Kuchen in der KuLe Küche mit ehemaligen und heutigen Bewohner_innen. / Receive a KuLe Book and a tour of the KuLe house with tea, coffee and cakes with past and present residents in the KuLe Kitchen.
9. Book + AK Kraak DVD
Bekomme das Buch mit einer DVD des Videokollektivs Ak Kraak: Die spezielle KuLe Edition, mit Videos von politisch-künstlerischen Aktivitäten rund um die KuLe von 1990-1996. / Receive the KuLe Book plus a copy of AK Kraak DVD (the KuLe Edition). AK Kraak is a video activist collective since 1990.
10. Signiertes Buch / Limited edition signed Book 
Erhalte ein KuLe-Buch mit persönlicher Widmung signiert von den Herausgeberinnen, diversen KuLe-Künstler_innen und Autor_innen. / Receive one of 100 special copies signed by KuLe founders, long term residents, book editors and KuLe artists and other contributors.
11. Buch im Vorverkauf  / Advance-sale Book
Das KuLe-Buch im Vorverkauf für Selbstabholer ohne Versandkosten! Bis zum Ende der Kampagne am 24.5. kostet das Buch noch 10% weniger. / Save more than 10% off the retail sale price and if you can pick it up yourself, you'll receive the KuLe Book before it hits the shops.
12. DDR Uhrenset / Surprise Watch Set 
Du bekommst eine kuriose Sammlung von Teilchen aus einem DDR-Uhrmacherladen, die wir seit 1991 in der KuLe aufgehoben haben. Ideal für Schmuck und zum basteln! / We've put together 20 one-of-a-kind watch sets from the magical store house in the KuLe attic. 

13. Gravo-Druck Margarine Box 
Du erhältst eine dieser wunderschönen Margarineschachteln aus Karton – legendäres DDR-Design von Gravo-Print aus Halle. / These beautiful mint-condition margarine boxes, originals from the GDR Gravo-Druck of Halle, were recently uncovered in the KuLe attic.

14. Schöne DDR Papiere / Assorted Vintage Paper Set 
Du wirst ein speziell zusammengestelltes Set aus DDR-Papieren erhalten, darunter eine Sternenkarte, sowie eine originale Tischnummer des berühmten Hotel Esplanade aus den 20er Jahren. / We have 50 packs of vintage papers, including a beautiful star map from the GDR and assorted postcards and paper relics.


15. Hotel Esplanade Tischkärtchen / Vintage Table Cards from the 1920s
Tischkärtchen aus dem berühmten Hotel Esplanade aus den 20er Jahren, die mysteriöserweise auf dem Dachboden der KuLe schlummerten. / From the KuLe rare paper archive, these original table plaques from the famous Esplanade Hotel date back to the 1920s. How they came to take up residence in the KuLe attic is something of a mystery, reflecting the layered history and magic of the house.

Andere Wege uns zu unterstützen

Bitte leite unsere Kampagne weiter und erzähl so vielen Leuten wie möglich davon. Wenn du Ideen oder Informationen hast, z.B. über Menschen oder Institutionen, mit denen wir in Kontakt treten sollten, teil uns das bitte mit!

Komm zur unserer Book Launch : 3. - 5. June 2016  in der Augusstraße 10 in Berlin. Auf unserer Webseite findet sich demnächst das genaue Programm! kunsthauskule

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign on your social media.  

If you have any ideas of people and institutions who we should get in touch with, please let us know!

Come to our book launch: 3. - 5. June 2016  at Augusstraße 10 in Berlin. Please visit our website for the detailed program! kunsthauskule

Münstermann, Philipp von Recklinghausen, Max Schaffer, Nina Sidow, Isabell Spengler,
 Stefan Vens, Angelina Vinci, Steffi Weismann, Anja Weber, Rolf Zöllner,
 Liang Zhipeng, Krzyszof Zielinski u.v.a. / a.m.o.Index Pages to the House Projects/ Index-Seiten zu den Hausprojekten:  ACUD, Antje Öklesund, Schloss Bröllin, Brunnen 6/7, Duncker 14/15, Eimer, Flutgraben, K77, Kleine Hamburger 5, KuLe, Lychi 60, Linie 206, Schokoladen, Haus Schwarzenberg, Spreefeld, Gut Stolzenhagen, Tacheles, Tucho 30/32Publishing House: Revolver Publishing BerlinPerks

Wie die KuLe selbst, ist auch das Buch Teil eines kollektiven Prozesses, der sich weiterentwickelt. Mit einer Unterstützung für die Druckkosten kann man einen konkreten Baustein beitragen und je nach Wunsch, auch in persönlichen Kontakt mit dem Projekt kommen. Eine Kaffeeklatsch Haustour oder ein Wochenende für zwei machen es möglich. Alle Perks ab 35€ beinhalten ein KuLe-Buch.






Like the KuLe project more generally, the realisation of this book will continue to be a morphing, collective process. By supporting this campaign you become part of this process. By choosing 'KuLe experience' perks; such as our weekend stay for two and our Kaffeeklatsch house tour, you'll get to experience the project firsthand. All perks over €35.00 include a copy of the KuLe Book. 


Dem spielerischen Geist der KuLe entsprechend, stammen viele Perks aus gefundenen Schätzen und vergessenen Papieren, die irgendwo im Haus über Jahrzehnte lagerten und heute einen seltenen Wert haben. 
In the playful spirit of KuLe many of our perks include found 
treasures, art works, forgotten papers and original fittings from the 
house; objects that over time become rare and special keepsakes.

1. Original KuLe ArtworkClaudia Schiffer muß auch mal aufs Klo (Claudia Schiffer also uses the loo)Dieses Bild hing im legendären KuLe Esszimmer, ein upgecyceltes Kunstwerk à la KuLe!  / Choose this perk to receive the KuLe Book plus an exclusive one of a kind KuLe up-cycled art work. In the spirit of KuLe this 350 x 350 mm painting  has over time developed and used to hang on the wall of the legendary KuLe dining room. 






2. Ein Wochende in der KuLe /  Weekend Stay for Two At KuLe 
Verbringe ein Wochenende mit der Person deiner Wahl in der KuLe - das live-Experiment! Schau dir unser Video an um einen Eindruck davon zu bekommen. Du erhältst das Buch und die Gelegenheit Kunst & Leben an einem Wochenende zu zweit im Kunsthaus KuLe live zu erfahren, inklusive Nutzung des legendären Badezimmer und einem gemeinsamen Essen mit den Bewohner_innen und Freunden. / Ever wondered what it is like to be inside a living utopian experiment? With this perk you will receive the KuLe Book and have the rare chance to experience art&life during a weekend stay for two at the Kunsthaus KuLe. Includes a communal dinner with KuLe residents and friends. 
3. Buch + Probenraum / Book + Rehearsal SpaceWähle diesen Perk, um das KuLe Theater für eine Woche zum proben zu nutzen. Weitere Infos findest du auf unserer Webseite kunsthauskule.de / Choose this perk to receive the KuLe Book plus one week of rehearsal space in the KuLe Theatre. This 70 sqm space has been a laboratory for contemporary theatre and music for more than 20 years, and is the home of the legendary Labor Sonor concert series as well as many other artistic activities. 




4. Originale Türklinke / KuLe Book + Original HandleDu bekommst ein Buch und die originale Türklinke zum Hofeingang der KuLe. / You will receive the KuLe Book plus an original, one of a kind wood and brass handle, an original fitting of the Kunsthaus KuLe building.





5.  Messing Türklinke aus der KuLe / Book + Brass Door Handle  Erhalte das KuLe-Buch mit einer originalen Messing-Türklinke des Kunsthauses KuLe, mit Spuren der Zeit und einer Aura von Kunst & Leben. / Receive the KuLe Book plus an exclusive one of a kind original brass door handle from the Kunsthaus KuLe. Only four available and each is a little different, wearing the marks of time and use, imbued with the aura of art&life.






6. Roulette Marke 20er Jahre / Book + Vintage Roulette TokensDu erhältst einen von nur vier originalen Roulette Jetons des Hotel Esplanade aus den 20er Jahren mit einem KuLe-Buch. Für Sammler! / We uncovered these original roulette tokens, dating back to the 1920s, from the famous Esplanade Hotel Berlin in the KuLe attic. This perk includes a copy of the KuLe Book and a selection of collectable roulette tokens.





7. Liebhaber Kombipaket  / Collectors Combi-Pack Erhalte ein persönlich signiertes Buch im Kombipaket mit der AK Kraak DVD und einer Kollektion von schönen DDR-Papieren aus dem KuLe Archiv. / Receive an exclusive signed copy of the KuLe Book plus an AK Kraak DVD and a vintage paper set selected from KuLe's rare paper collection.

8. KuLe Kaffeeklatsch  / Book + House tour + Coffee  Erhalte das Buch mit einer Haustour und einem Schwatz bei Kaffee und Kuchen in der KuLe Küche mit ehemaligen und heutigen Bewohner_innen. / Receive a KuLe Book and a tour of the KuLe house with tea, coffee and cakes with past and present residents in the KuLe Kitchen.
9. Book + AK Kraak DVDBekomme das Buch mit einer DVD des Videokollektivs Ak Kraak: Die spezielle KuLe Edition, mit Videos von politisch-künstlerischen Aktivitäten rund um die KuLe von 1990-1996. / Receive the KuLe Book plus a copy of AK Kraak DVD (the KuLe Edition). AK Kraak is a video activist collective since 1990.
10. Signiertes Buch / Limited edition signed Book Erhalte ein KuLe-Buch mit persönlicher Widmung signiert von den Herausgeberinnen, diversen KuLe-Künstler_innen und Autor_innen. / Receive one of 100 special copies signed by KuLe founders, long term residents, book editors and KuLe artists and other contributors.
11. Buch im Vorverkauf  / Advance-sale Book Das KuLe-Buch im Vorverkauf für Selbstabholer ohne Versandkosten! Bis zum Ende der Kampagne am 24.5. kostet das Buch noch 10% weniger. / Save more than 10% off the retail sale price and if you can pick it up yourself, you'll receive the KuLe Book before it hits the shops. 
12. DDR Uhrenset / Surprise Watch Set Du bekommst eine kuriose Sammlung von Teilchen aus einem DDR-Uhrmacherladen, die wir seit 1991 in der KuLe aufgehoben haben. Ideal für Schmuck und zum basteln! / We've put together 20 one-of-a-kind watch sets from the magical store house in the KuLe attic. 

13. Gravo-Druck Margarine Box  Du erhältst eine dieser wunderschönen Margarineschachteln aus Karton – legendäres DDR-Design von Gravo-Print aus Halle. / These beautiful mint-condition margarine boxes, originals from the GDR Gravo-Druck of Halle, were recently uncovered in the KuLe attic.



14. Schöne DDR Papiere / Assorted Vintage Paper Set 


Du wirst ein speziell zusammengestelltes Set aus DDR-Papieren erhalten, darunter eine Sternenkarte, sowie eine originale Tischnummer des berühmten Hotel Esplanade aus den 20er Jahren. / We have 50 packs of vintage papers, including a beautiful star map from the GDR and assorted postcards and paper relics.




15. Hotel Esplanade Tischkärtchen / Vintage Table Cards from the 1920s Tischkärtchen aus dem berühmten Hotel Esplanade aus den 20er Jahren, die mysteriöserweise auf dem Dachboden der KuLe schlummerten. / From the KuLe rare paper archive, these original table plaques from the famous Esplanade Hotel date back to the 1920s. How they came to take up residence in the KuLe attic is something of a mystery, reflecting the layered history and magic of the house.





Andere Wege uns zu unterstützen
Bitte leite unsere Kampagne weiter und erzähl so vielen Leuten wie möglich davon. Wenn du Ideen oder Informationen hast, z.B. über Menschen oder Institutionen, mit denen wir in Kontakt treten sollten, teil uns das bitte mit!Komm zur unserer Book Launch : 3. - 5. June 2016  in der Augusstraße 10 in Berlin. Auf unserer Webseite findet sich demnächst das genaue Programm! kunsthauskule

Other Ways You Can Help
Please share our campaign on your social media.  
If you have any ideas of people and institutions who we should get in touch with, please let us know!
Come to our book launch: 3. - 5. June 2016  at Augusstraße 10 in Berlin. Please visit our website for the detailed program! kunsthauskule

story:
Hi Everyone!

You may know Ashley and I as friends, family, your kid’s art teachers or through our past projects which include Gaff Gallery in Vancouver and Galerie Rye in Montreal. Here’s a quick re-cap to get you caught up with us:

After working our tails off trying to make it as independent gallery proprietors and artists, while working day jobs, etc. we decided to teach overseas. We have been teaching art in Qatar (whole story there) for the past four years, saving towards our next project- and this is it! Two years ago we bought a 52 acre farm in Tamworth, Ontario (about a 30min drive north of Kingston). It’s gorgeous— rolling hills right on the Salmon River, 100 year old timber barn, plus a house and smaller second barn. The place is ideal for what we have been wanting to do for some time now: set up studios and get to work making art and continuing the community driven cultural activities that we enjoyed so much at our previous venues. But this time it’s different– we are not in the city and we are not running an exhibition space (although there will be exhibitions surely). With Salmon River Studios we will focus all of our energy into arts production and providing cultural and educational opportunities to our local community with a long term goal of broadening that community nationally and internationally.


We have already begun converting the barns into studios for printmaking, painting, drawing, ceramics and sculpture where we will create our own work and invite the public to take part through lessons and workshops for all ages and skill levels. The barns are in excellent shape but need some sprucing up with things like improved lighting and plumbing and to make them as functional as possible we need to supplement the equipment that we already have.

Luckily the Doucette Pilles Deerman gang are can-do people so we will be completing most of the improvements ourselves. However, materials and equipment are necessary expenses.

In our past arts endeavours people have often commented that we are ‘brave’ for trying to go out on our own and try to make these ventures work. Brave is one way to put it- it often feels like crazy would be a more apt description. However, we have always been surprised at how excited and eager people are to support independent arts venues and participate in community driven cultural activities. We never felt alone in our efforts and are confident that Salmon River Studios will be a long term culmination to many years of ground work and will contribute to the Canadian and global arts community beginning with our little corner of the world.

That said- we have put our savings into obtaining this property, are leaving our steady pay checks and are returning to Canada (with our new baby boy Sylvan!!!) and plan to supply teach part time (substitute teaching) to make ends meet. We have some savings to sustain us through this transition but are humbly asking that those of you who like what we’ve done in the past and/or like our artwork will help us by contributing and helping us get this place rolling!

Your contributions will expand the possibilities of what types of work can be done in our facilities, what services and opportunities for artists we can offer and will hasten our progress in meeting the potential that we know this special place has.


What We Need & What We Have to Offer

In exchange for your generous contributions (large or small) we humbly offer that which we have- our artworks, hand crafted items and our services as art instructors. We welcome any inquiries about specific perks listed and are more than happy to make alternate arrangements if you have something specific in mind that would be of interest as an exchange.

Click on the gallery tab to view examples of artworks and hand crafted paddles. Also feel free to visit www.gabrieldeerman.com to view other artworks- most of which can be reproduced as high resolution digital prints (or prices can be discussed privately for sales of original work).

_____________________________________________________________________________

Expense Break Down:

Barn Improvements!

As we will be completing the barn improvements ourselves and sourcing used materials and equipment as much as possible, we can only approximate the total cost of this initial push. Here is a breakdown of what we need and what we already have:


Large Barn

PCV ROOFING PANELS (skylights) $20 X 10   $200

Electrical Work   $500

Patchwork of wood framed windows on north wall $300

Lighting

16+ hanging lamps w/ frosted mason jar covers  $240

upward facing flood lights  $35 x 2    $70

Outdoor Flood Lights $12x6    $70

Ikea Track Lighting   $200

Lumber for building Benches and Tables   $300

Plumbing (connecting well and installing drains)      $300

Sinks      $100

Tempered Glass for monotype printing  (sml,md,lrg)   $300


Small Barn

Kiln (medium sized)    $1000

2 ceramic wheels     $1000

Clay Extruder    $200

   TOTAL: Approx $5,000 

What we already have

Salvage wood for:

  • Counters
  • Shelving
  • Easels

Sound equipment

2 Digital projectors

Small Kiln

12”x20” Blick etching press

20” Akua pin press

Here’s how we plan to prioritize use of the funds you donate: improvements to the infrastructure of the barns is paramount (lights/electrics/plumbing), after meeting those basic studio necessities we will focus on studio equipment.

The Impact your contributions will make

As you all know, making art and offering lessons/workshops requires a great deal of time and effort. With your help we will have the financial breathing room to accelerate this project in a way that would not be possible while working full time gigs.  With this jump start we hope to be up and running, and introducing ourselves, our work and services to the greater Kingston community this fall.

Tamworth is a small town in a rural patchwork of other small townships around Kingston and Napanee. This area has a surprising number of artists, young families, farmers and retirees for whom we hope to provide unique opportunities. As artists our interests and abilities are very broad- encompassing from what could be referred to as traditional (landscape painting, making paddles, etc.) and spanning widely into the spectrum of contemporary art practice, praxis and pedagogy. As Ontario certified teachers with experience facilitating the inquiry and concept driven International Baccalaureate Programme, we likewise offer a broad spectrum of abilities: whether teaching children and young adults the basics of art through inquiry, working with students with special needs, working with adults in exploring a new hobby, expanding on existing skills or hosting workshops on arts integration in the classroom and topics central to contemporary discourse- It is our hope that over the coming months and years Salmon River Studios will become a cultural hub from which our community will greatly benefit.

For more info on specific courses/workshops that we will be offering visit http://www.salmonriverstudios.com/lessons/


Long Term Aims

We are confident that our experience in art/cultural work in the past combined with our training and experience as arts educators and continuing education (we are both wrapping up masters degrees) will translate to (with a lot of hard work and help from our community) a sustainable, long term enterprise which will over the next two years transition into a non-profit and seek operational funding through the Ontario Arts Council, Canada Council for the Arts and other arts and cultural funding sources. Ultimately we hope for Salmon River Studios to offer artist residency programs, host guest artist workshops and lectures, exhibitions, musical/performance/theatrical events and to become a magnet for arts and cultural programming in the area.

Other Ways You Can Help

Want to help in other ways than contributing money? That’s great! We would be grateful for any help you could provide whether it’s swinging a hammer, trading/donating materials or equipment,  or just getting the word out! Please contact us and we can have a chat!

We have been out of the country for quite awhile now and may be a bit out of the loop. Sharing this campaign, our website/facebook page or just telling people who you think may be interested in what we’re doing is probably the most valuable thing you can do for us. Help get the word out!!

Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
My Story

My name is Patrick. I am a freelance artist specializing in anthropomorphic art with a background in graphic design and animation. Recently I have had quite a number of friends who have gotten into a really cool new trend: adult coloring books. I would like to create a furry coloring book that not only provides a entertainment to people of all skill levels but also provide a variety of subjects catered to the Furry Fandom.


I started doodling furries 14 years ago in high school. Since then I have went to school for graphic design and animation. Deciding illustration was my passion I have been working on small projects such as book covers, logos for small businesses, and commissioned illustrations. I would ideally like to work on small independent publications like this and make a name for myself in the realm of illustration and comic books. 


The Goal

All funding of this project will be used to publish an initial run of the book along with any stretch rewards listed below.  I'm aiming for a publish date of March 4th with a minimum of 34 pages for your colouring enjoyment. Over the last 2 weeks I have completed about 20 illustrations and I have a month to complete any additional illustrations. 

All funding up to the goal will go to ensuring you get your book and provide a small number of on hand books for conventions and shows. Anything past this will help to fund the production of new books after this specifically the supplies I need to continue producing quality illustrations and the initial production costs.

So now that you've read what this project is all about let me share some of the initial illustrations going into this book:

story:
Short Summary

We are looking to create a flexible space for the creation and presentation of all forms of art. A space that is open to everyone, all ages and to incubate our fledgling arts community.

this space is intended to be used for...

  • open studio space- a small membership fee will give artists the chance to use the space to create, Newport is an incredibly expensive place to rent a studio space full time, this will negate those costs by creating a collective space for very little money.
  • gallery space- a place for artists to have openings and show off their work.
  • performance space- all ages venue for expression of music/dance/moving visual media. This will be the only place in Newport that will be focused on featuring the art and not selling drinks, thus creating an environment for more creativity rather than creating an atmosphere focused on increasing bar/food sales.
  • meeting space- a place for community organizations to hold meetings to help further the betterment of our little city.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the plan:  We're doing a flexible funding campaign looking to raise $10,000- this money will go towards the first few months of rent for the space as well as the initial build out costs and startup fees.

If you are kind enough to donate to this campaign here is the breakdown of what you get-

  •  $1-$50= Invite to our exclusive grand opening party, you get to be on the guest list for the first event we hold.
  • $51-$100= Invite to our exclusive grand opening party, 1 month membership to the collective studio space (feel free to gift this membership to someone else if this membership is not something you would use)
  • $101-$200= Invite to our exclusive grand opening party, 3 month membership to the collective studio space (feel free to gift this membership to someone else if this membership is not something you would use) 
  • $201-$350= Invite to our exclusive grand opening party, 6 month membership to the collective studio space (feel free to gift this membership to someone else if this membership is not something you would use)
  • $351-$500= Invite to our exclusive grand opening party, 1 year membership to the collective studio space (feel free to gift this membership to someone else if this membership is not something you would use)
  • $501+= Invite to our exclusive grand opening party, lifetime membership to the collective studio space (feel free to gift this membership to someone else if this membership is not something you would use) as well as your name or the name of your business listed on all of our advertising media, as well as prominently displayed inside of the space.

The Impact

The Newport Arts community is thriving right now, this project is going to be a catalyst to push this community to the next level.
  • All ages show space- providing a safe place for someone under 21 to go and listen or play music, this is something this town desperately needs.
  • Providing a space for creation of art that most of the local artists are desperately seeking.
  • Bringing the art community together to push the boundaries of creativity.

Risks & Challenges

Newport has always been a difficult to place run a business, especially one that is based in supporting the arts. This space is a viable community asset that could positively impact the creative community for generations to come. It's only with your help and support that this space can start up and thrive!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? that's totally ok, here are some other ways to help.

  • Share this campaign on social media, share it often! if this is something you want to see happen the best way to support it is to get other people excited about it!
  • Talk about this campaign, social media isn't the only platform for communication, word of mouth is an amazing tool.

Thank you for your consideration, we appreciate your time.
story_txt:
Short Summary We are looking to create a flexible space for the creation and presentation of all forms of art. A space that is open to everyone, all ages and to incubate our fledgling arts community.
this space is intended to be used for...  open studio space- a small membership fee will give artists the chance to use the space to create, Newport is an incredibly expensive place to rent a studio space full time, this will negate those costs by creating a collective space for very little money. gallery space- a place for artists to have openings and show off their work. performance space- all ages venue for expression of music/dance/moving visual media. This will be the only place in Newport that will be focused on featuring the art and not selling drinks, thus creating an environment for more creativity rather than creating an atmosphere focused on increasing bar/food sales.
meeting space- a place for community organizations to hold meetings to help further the betterment of our little city.
   What We Need & What You Get Here's the plan:  We're doing a flexible funding campaign looking to raise $10,000- this money will go towards the first few months of rent for the space as well as the initial build out costs and startup fees.
If you are kind enough to donate to this campaign here is the breakdown of what you get-

 $1-$50= Invite to our exclusive grand opening party, you get to be on the guest list for the first event we hold. $51-$100= Invite to our exclusive grand opening party, 1 month membership to the collective studio space (feel free to gift this membership to someone else if this membership is not something you would use)
$101-$200= Invite to our exclusive grand opening party, 3 month membership to the collective studio space (feel free to gift this membership to someone else if this membership is not something you would use) 
$201-$350= Invite to our exclusive grand opening party, 6 month membership to the collective studio space (feel free to gift this membership to someone else if this membership is not something you would use)
$351-$500= Invite to our exclusive grand opening party, 1 year membership to the collective studio space (feel free to gift this membership to someone else if this membership is not something you would use)
$501+= Invite to our exclusive grand opening party, lifetime membership to the collective studio space (feel free to gift this membership to someone else if this membership is not something you would use) as well as your name or the name of your business listed on all of our advertising media, as well as prominently displayed inside of the space.    The Impact
The Newport Arts community is thriving right now, this project is going to be a catalyst to push this community to the next level.

All ages show space- providing a safe place for someone under 21 to go and listen or play music, this is something this town desperately needs. Providing a space for creation of art that most of the local artists are desperately seeking. Bringing the art community together to push the boundaries of creativity.    Risks & Challenges Newport has always been a difficult to place run a business, especially one that is based in supporting the arts. This space is a viable community asset that could positively impact the creative community for generations to come. It's only with your help and support that this space can start up and thrive!   Other Ways You Can Help Can't contribute? that's totally ok, here are some other ways to help.  Share this campaign on social media, share it often! if this is something you want to see happen the best way to support it is to get other people excited about it! Talk about this campaign, social media isn't the only platform for communication, word of mouth is an amazing tool.   Thank you for your consideration, we appreciate your time.

story:
Welcome to my first curatorial project, Race and Revolution: Exploring Human Injustices through Art, to be held this August – September 2016 on Governors Island in New York City. This show, what I hope is just the first of several on the topic of the history of racism in the United States, combines my passions and experiences as a teacher, an artist, and an advocate for social justice.

About the show

How have Native and African Americans been written out of American history, and  what does this mean to contemporary political and social ideologies? Race and Revolution: Exploring Racial Injustices through Art is a group art show that will address this question by pairing historical documents that reveal requests the American and British armies made - with the intention to exploit - of Indigenous and African American peoples to get them to fight for their causes during the American Revolution. Through original works, artists will respond to excerpts from historic documents written by George Washington, Lord Dunmore, John Adams, and others. Governors Island in New York City is the perfect location because soldiers from the Continental Army were based there until the British took it over during the Battle of Brooklyn in 1776.

The objective of this exhibition is to question how Colonial entitlement is embedded in contemporary culture and to address the connection between the history of how African American and Native peoples were - and continue to be - regarded today.

About the artists

Cannupa Hanksa Luger: Born in Fort Yates, North Dakota, on the Standing Rock Reservation, Raised by his artist mother, Luger has always known art as an important means of expression. His sculptures come from a place of, "...not knowing."

Frohaw Two Feathers: Born in Chicago and based in Los Angeles, Two Feathers’s portraits and large-scale paintings focus on historical narratives that have long been forgotten or written out of history books. 

gilf!: One of NYC’s most recognized, provocative female street and activist artists. She creates both bold public and gallery works that inspire thoughtfulness, while simultaneously motivating progressive change within communities.

Jennifer Painter: A photographer, videographer, and editor, Painter explores stories and cultures. Her work embraces artists, communities, and emerging local organizations, 

Jorge Alberto Perez: a Cuban-born artist, curator and writer who works in a variety of media including, but not limited to, photography, collage, installation and writing. Perez questions the truthfulness of the image within the economy of desire in visual culture as well as the allegorical value of fragmented images.

Michelle Angela: a visual artist/ skilled muralist/ community arts educator who uses her art as a vehicle to represent people and communities whose histories are often lost or co-opted. 

Nicholas Galanin: Born in Sitka, Alaska, Galanin has struck an intriguing balance between his origins and the course of his practice. Having studied a variety of media, Nicholas draws upon a wide range of indigenous technologies and global materials when exploring an idea. 

Nona Faustine: A photographer who was born and raised in Brooklyn, Nona speaks to what it means to be a woman in the 21st Century. Her photographs balance history and folklore from the perspective of gender and identity politics.

Talwst: Talwst is a Canadian-Trinidadian artist based in New York who works in mixed media and performance. He is currently involved in an ongoing and prolific infinity series of miniature dioramas in reclaimed ring boxes.

Where you come in!

This show has the potential to really make an impact on how the public looks at American history, but I need your help. As an independent curator not affiliated with an organization, applying for grants is incredibly challenging.

The $12,000 for Race and Revolution will cover permits for the space, insurance, marketing, artwork handling, etc. UConn: Neag School for Education has offered to cover costs for education materials.

Additional programming is also being developed for universities, school groups, and galleries. The closer I get to achieving my fundraising goal, the more I can allow for public programming. My hope is that each person who visits Race and Revolution walks away with the desire to learn a little more, to dig a little deeper into the history they thought they knew. Once we acknowledge and confront our past, we may have the potential to heal from it.

story:
Who am I and what the HECK is this thing?

My name is Andrea Aguilar and this project tells the story about how I quit my job to build a creative community centered around Filipino culture. After more than 10 years of telling the stories for others as a television producer and filmmaker, I attended Burning Man. It was at the biggest cultural and arts festival in the world that I realized the importance of telling your own story and embracing who you are. Through reconnecting with my roots I decided to build an art project, start a camp, and film a documentary to tell the story of how one can one discover and connect with your culture through art.

If you can find the biggest, brightest symbol for a group of people it will spark conversation and provide the opportunity to learn who they are. An undeniable symbol unique to the Philippines is the Jeepney, a popular mode of public transportation that also serve as moving works of art. Customized to the individual taste of each driver, brighter and crazier the Jeepney, the more people will want to ride. Drivers are rewarded to display their personality and creativity - something I believe we need more of in the world!

To honor this very Filipino cultural icon, I am creating my own Jeepney to put on display at Burning Man. We have partnered with Digital Permaculture to modify it the image of the endangered Philippine eagle. Using their own state-of-the-art software and 3D mapping, we outfit our jeepney with a steel frame covered in fabric and line it with LED’s for spectacular lighting.

Fighter is an endangered eagle I met at the Philippine Eagle Center in Davao.


Our Mission:

Along with building the car we are founding a Burning Man theme camp called It’s More Fun in the Philippines! Our camp will both be the home base for everyone involved with the car, but also a place to invite visitors in to showcase unique Filipino culture through art, food, and music. We will show how active participation in your life, embracing your culture and creating something beautiful can help give meaning to your world. The inspiration for the shape of the car has also led me to standing up to fight for the endangered Philippine eagle and draw attention to those trying to save the species.

I want to show what injecting an underrepresented demographic at Burning Man will do for the event and see the reaction from our Filipino campers who have never experienced something like this. Sharing the result in our documentary will allow me to spread the message of Burning Man of how you can improve your society by adopting principles taught such as participation, leaving no trace, and decommodification. For a country where environmental issues, consumerism, and disproportionate wealth create increasing problems, I hope to inspire and spark change in the Philippines. Due to these issues, our people have spread out all over the world. We’re still connected through where we come from, but never truly feel settled. My ultimate goal is to help form a bond between creative Filipinos to each other in hopes to co-create something beautiful together.


Gingee is a DJ, Music Producer, Vocalist and Music Teacher.

Chef Yana, will host the playa's first-ever Salo Series Filipino pop-up dinner.

(Photo Credit: Katie Herst)


We Need Your Help!

Your generous funding will help with the costs of further design, construction, and transportation of the car. Donations also will go to providing unique Filipino services to contribute at Burning Man to bring visitors into our camp to share our culture. We plan on serving traditional Filipino pop-up meals, outfitting the camp with traditional Filipino accoutrements, and showcasing uniquely Filipino musical performances.

Filming the construction and results of this project is perhaps the most important aspect and won’t be easy! We need help gathering film equipment and editing tools to produce the documentary that will take this from a one-time event to a way of life for us. With plans of touring the car at other festivals as well as distributing the film around the world, I am devoting my life to sparking change and inspiring others to celebrate Filipino history and culture.

Please know any donations will go straight to this project regardless of if we hit our goal and we will always need extra funding to keep it going beyond this year at Burning Man. We need to make a big splash at our first event to gain attention and have as many creative types as possible join our cause. By this time next year, this adventure would have added new friends and resources to help build this community and inspire other to do the same.

Really Fun Perks! 

Carefully curated, fun, and something for everyone. By supporting our project you're also fueling social entrepreneurs based in the Philippines and California artists. There's a super special one too for $5, shell necklaces by our Momma Eagle, who has been so moved and inspired by the Burning Man Principles. This perk will be a "One-for-One" program. By purchasing a one of a kind shell necklace, we will be gifting one to someone on the playa! 


Other Ways to Help

Sharing Our Story:

The Jeepney Eagle Art Car needs financial pledging, but above all, it needs your attention and interest! If you love this project as much as we do then please take a moment to share our campaign. Post for your social network and get them to spread the word as well!

Joining the Team or Donating Items:

We also would LOVE to get more campers to share Filipino culture at Burning man so please reach out if you would like to join the camp or help with our project anyway. If you or your Filipino relatives have anything with an island motif laying around we will gladly borrow or take donations. Clothing, decorations, rugs, or any other items uniquely Filipino will help transport visitors at our camp to the Philippines. Also camping equipment including portable stoves, generators, or heavy duty coolers can really be costly, but borrowing can save us big time.  

Food Donations!

Do you or your someone you know own a supermarket? Do you own a great product that supports feeding hungry campers? We're looking for anything from the Asian grocery store: plantains, egg roll wrappers, eggs, meat, hard veggies, dried mushrooms, soy sauce, vinegar, condensed milk, coconut milk, coconut water, and of course RICE!

Where will my money go? 
Vehicle Cost + Eagle Spaceframe = $28,000
Transportation to Black Rock City = $2,000
Documentary Equipment + Editing = $5000
3 Salo Series Dinners + Deep Playa Street Food Cart = $5000
Gingee Musical Performances = $5000
Crowdfunding Fees = $5000
Just In Case S!*t Hits the Fan = $15,000
TOTAL = $65,000

Thank You!

I sincerely appreciate everyone who has taken the time to read this, contribute, share with their network or just support me in general. Choosing a cause to believe in over a steady job was not an easy decision and any encouragement keeps me going. The people I have traveled to meet in the Philippines, those who have embraced me in the Filipino creative community, and even the Filipino eagles themselves have all further made me believe in what I am doing to keep Filipino culture alive and that I can spark real change in people to do the same.

We will continue to keep you posted on what your donations help us achieve. You are now part of our Jeepney Eagle Art Car family!

More about Me:

Growing up in Southern California I set out to tell stories through film and television. Working with so many who followed their passion helped me make the decision to tell my own story as I set out for the Philippines and reconnect with my culture. After 45 days in my native land, I traveled to all three major regions of the Philippines: Luzon, Visayas and Mindanao. The biggest issue I noticed affected the Philippines is deforestation due to climate change, illegal mining, slash and burn practices, and overall rapid consumption of all of our natural resources. From my visit at the Philippine Eagle Center, I learned the country’s eco-system is extremely out of balance. There are roughly only 400 pairs of these endemic eagles left. They also are the largest predator found in the region and keep order to the forest.

This is a clear sign, that we need to take action and quickly. I’m excited to report that I was able to connect with passionate Filipinos involved in social enterprises, dedicated to improving the livelihoods of others through sustainable practices. I’ve come to the realization that this is my call to come back home to restore the forests through education and eco-tourism. I now plan to return to the Philippines consistently to help make a direct impact and continue to build the community of forward thinking Filipinos who are making a real difference in keeping our culture alive and preserving our beautiful land.

story:
The Gallery 

From February 25-28th, A Youth Mind will be presenting their first display of photos taken by different youth photographers from Meru, Kenya; Facatativa, Colombia; and Austin, Texas. The purpose is to highlight and distinguish a series of similarities and differences found between all three locations and to act as a catalyst for a global conversation between the three countries devoid of media distortion, foreign lens, and/or third party intervention. The photos were taken to depict the photographers surroundings, environment and daily life as purely as possible. 

All photos were taken on disposable film.

FREE* ($5 suggested donation at door) // 2:00-4:30 // Photo prints will be on sale at the event. If you cannot make it on Sunday, feel free to stop by SprATX (2400 E CESAR CHAVEZ ST. #316.B) anytime for the gallery beginning on Thursday, February 22th around 2:00PM. SprATX will be open from 12:30PM-7:30PM daily this week.

 The Funds

Through this gallery we hope to share beauty of the world's eyes with you. All money raised will go towards running more initiatives. 

HOW IT WORKS: 

To purchase a print - please show one of our team members that you have donated the specified amount to our Indigogo - and then we will ship it to you!

story:
The Ministry of CGI, support us or donate, and receive one, out off 55,  Limited Edition Prints, or get your discount.

Check out all 55 images at:  http://info1376375.wix.com/paul-hogenboom-fund

International Photographer Paul Hogenboom from Amsterdam (NL), asks for your support to finalize his latest online project: "The Ministry of CGI".  A web-shop for 3D backgrounds, archived images, beautiful sceneries, panoramas, Hdri's and black & white shots; all taken during the last four decades, starting from 1976 until now. At this moment the library contains over 25.000 high resolution images and still grows every day. A library of high Quality images from locations Across the world that can be used to create any professionally manipulated picture as if you were there. We need your support to finalize the Ministry of CGI-webshop and go online.  A team of highly skilled professionals in Shimla  (India) will take care of this. Our goal is to launch The Ministry of CGI this summer. We look forward to keeping you informed about progress made! 
In Dutch:                                                                                                                                           Steun ons met het voltooien van onze online webshop. Help ons snel online! Het is een monsterklus geworden en het resultaat wordt prachtig. U kunt doneren of kiezen voor korting of een unieke foto met of zonder lijst. Ideal betalingen zijn op Indiegogo niet mogelijk maar Creditcard en Paypal wel. Bij creditcard kiest u voor de optie Paypal en klik door naar de optie Creditcard. Betaal op Indiegogo en kies uw foto op:                                                                                              http://info1376375.wix.com/paul-hogenboom-fund


Check out all 55 images at:   http://info1376375.wix.com/paul-hogenboom-fund

WHAT IS CGI?                  Cgi is:"Computer Generated Imaging".

Watch this video:


The Ministry of CGI is the latest source of complete pre-shot photographic locations and backgrounds for use in CGI. We shoot complete 'virtual locations' - real scenes to integrate them into a mix of 2D and 3D: to "shoot" your campaign. But TMOCGI offers more than this: you can find unique black & white pictures taken in the seventies, we own a vast collection of super-panoramas, we scanned and digitized hundreds of creative slides, retouched them and made them ready to print.

" Having this website and web shop built, has proven to be like climbing up a fantastic, but steep hill; for the last few kilometers, I could do with your kind push in the back and your help to finalize the project and go online..."

Chip in...          or just get in touch with us.....          info @paulhogenboom.nl

> With donations over € 100,= you may choose one of the Limited Edition Photo prints, signed, stamped and numbered, or a discount of € 100,= with your future purchase.

> If you were to donate € 125,= or more, you will receive your chosen photo in a modern aluminum frame. (ex. panorama's), or the same amount as a discount.

> All prints will be sized A4 ( 21 x 29,7 cm). Just contact us if you would like a different size.  Panorama prints may vary : 10-15 cm X 30-45 cm

The Ministry of CGI, support us or donate, and receive one, out off 55,  Limited Edition Prints, or get your discount.


Check out all 55 images at:  http://info1376375.wix.com/paul-hogenboom-fund


International Photographer Paul Hogenboom from Amsterdam (NL), asks for your support to finalize his latest online project: "The Ministry of CGI".  A web-shop for 3D backgrounds, archived images, beautiful sceneries, panoramas, Hdri's and black & white shots; all taken during the last four decades, starting from 1976 until now. At this moment the library contains over 25.000 high resolution images and still grows every day. A library of high Quality images from locations Across the world that can be used to create any professionally manipulated picture as if you were there. We need your support to finalize the Ministry of CGI-webshop and go online.  A team of highly skilled professionals in Shimla  (India) will take care of this. Our goal is to launch The Ministry of CGI this summer. We look forward to keeping you informed about progress made!

story:
Bonjour à vous passionnés de maintenir vôtre santé et de promouvoir l'Art dans un milieu convivial. 

Hello to you fans to maintain your health and promote art in a friendly environment.
BART ( Bar à jus Art= Bart) Bois Moi juice is the name I want to give my project. I have always been passionate about health and Art.  So i have this idea to open a juice Bar and promote artist inside the walls.   As a painter , I would like to open initially a small kiosk where you can stop drinking fresh juice and buy a snack while having a visual arts with drawings etc.
Increasingly , people are in a hurry and do not have the time or expensive machines to make fresh juice in the morning or afternoon . A fresh juice is not oxidized as Commercial juice so his vitamins value is optimize.
Without your help, it will be impossible for me to start this project which is a dream in itself. I much prefer working for myself and provide more choices of informed consumers by adding more of my personnality into this business project.
If I reach the goal , I could even possibly add gluten-free snacks pastry from my friend, great stuff, great collaboration for local food.
If I do not achieved the objective , the funds will continue my art and be able to make real openings in galleries in Quebec, USA or Europe to make myself known and more or buy a small land and grow organic fruits and veggies for continue to make a difference in this world.
If you want to help me put in motion that next it would be great and you will always be welcome at this friendly BART TO JUS .
THANK YOU TO GIVE FOR MAKE THIS PROJECT HAPPEN.

BART à jus Bois Moi est le nom que je veux donner à mon projet.
J'ai toujours été une passionnée de la santé et de l'ART.  Étant artiste peintre, j'aimerais ouvrir dans un premier temps un petit kiosque où on peut arrêter boire un jus frais et acheter une collation, tout en ayant un visuel artistique avec des dessins au mur et/ou mes toiles ainsi que de promouvoir celles des autres artistes, et ce, à des prix abordables pour l'acheteur, mais respectables pour l'artiste.
De plus en plus, les gens sont pressés et n'ont pas le temps ni les machines coûteuses pour se faire un jus frais le matin ou le midi.  Un jus frais n'est pas oxydé comme les jus commercials et/ou ceux qu'on se prépare la vieille, il est à son meilleur et  ces jus contribuent au maintien d'une bonne santé globale.  Chaque jus aurait son apport de minéraux avec un ajout léger de légumes verts donc plus complets avec mes mélanges personnalisés.
Sans vôtre aide, il me sera impossible de démarrer ce projet qui est un rêve en soi.  Je préfère de loin travailler à mon compte et apporter un plus aux choix des consommateurs avertis en ajoutant mon grain de personnalité à ce projet.?
Si j'atteins l'objectif, je pourrai même éventuellement ajouter des collations sans gluten de mon amie pâtissière à mon bar à jus, donc ce qui serait superbe ce fait de pouvoir travailler en collaboration avec une très bonne amie et de lui offrir une job qui sait !  
Plus j'aurai de fond, plus le concept sera complet et la place à louer pourra être grande et permettra même de promouvoir des objets fait à la main d' artistes de Montréal et d'ailleurs. Pour se faire je devrai dépasser l'objectif de départ.
Donc, l'argent servira à louer un local, l'aménager, acheter les machines nécessaires, acheter les collations sans gluten, payer un employé, acheter certains objets artistiques afin de les revendres, et me permettre d'avoir un salaire convenable, etc.
Si je n'atteins pas l'objectif, les fonds serviront à poursuivre mon Art et à pouvoir réaliser des vernissages dans des vrais galleries au Québec, aux États-Unis ou en Europe afin de me faire connaître davantage.....  et/ou pour acheter un terrain pour cultiver des légumes et des fruits biologiques et éventuellement de les vendres si possible pour amasser d'autres fonds et arriver à mon objectif ultime qui est d'ouvrir mon BART à Jus Bois Moi à saveur artistique.

Être en business est une chose, mais faire la différence dans la société en encourageant les gens à prendre des habitudes santés tout en mettant de l'avant l'Art est encore plus intéressant comme énergie.  Et j'espère pouvoir apporter cette différence chez les gens qui m'entourent de près ou de loin.

Si vous voulez m'aider à mettre en branle ce prochain ce serait magnifique et vous serez toujours bienvenue à ce BART À JUS conviviale.

Si j'atteinds l'objectif, les donateurs de plus de 20 $ auront automatiquement un rabais de 10 % à la caisse. Cliquez sur le carré descriptif de cette offre de 20 $ pour y avoir droit.

Win a Art craft for the option 1000$ invest or more Win this toile (see the link)

https://www.pinterest.com/pin/461267186816894985/

Merci à l'avance de partager ma page et de faire parler de ce projet qui me tient tant à coeur !


Merci mille fois AUX DONS QUE VOUS M'OFFREZ !


Sophie Claudia BART À JUS santé Bois Moi !
