Sophie Claudia BART À JUS santé Bois Moi !

story:
Hatodik éve készítünk tantermi előadásokat, mert hisszük, hogy a középiskolások a legkíváncsibb, legnyitottabb emberek, akiket a színház nyelvén a saját közegükben kell megszólítani.

Idei darabunk Beate Teresa Hanika Soha, senkinek című regényéből készült, a családon belüli erőszak témáját járja körül a tőlünk megszokott emberséggel, derűvel, életszeretettel. A könyv Magyarországon a Tabu könyvek sorozatban jelent meg, ami jól mutatja, hogy egy olyan szociális problémáról van szó, amiről fontos, hogy valódi párbeszéd kezdődjön. Fontos visszajelzés számunkra, hogy sok korábbi előadásunk után a Soha senkineket is beválogatták a nívós kaposvári Gyermek – és Ifjúsági Biennálé programjába, ahol Simkó Katalin elnyerte a legjobb színésznőnek járó díjat. 

Korábbi darabjainkat nagy érdeklődés kíséri az iskolák részéről. A gyáva több 250 előadást élt meg, az Ady/Petőfi és a Vakság több mint 100-szor ment. A tavalyi bemutatónk, A kézmosás fontosságáról lassan túllépi az 50-et. Minden tantermi előadásunkat játsszuk színházi térben, elitgimnáziumokban és olyan vidéki iskolában is, ahol jelentős gondot okoz az előadás minimális költségének a kifizetése. Nekik jellemzően pályázati pénzből, EU-s, alapítványi vagy más forrásokból finanszírozva tudtunk ingyen, vagy jelképes összegért játszani.

Most szeretnénk egymillió forintot összegyűjteni, hogy legalább tíz Soha, senkinek előadást el tudjunk vinni rászoruló iskolába, olyan középiskolásoknak, akik más módon nem találkoznának a problémával. A tapasztalat azt mutatja, hogy a rászoruló iskolák is tudnak valamennyit fizetni, így valószínűbb, hogy ebből a pénzből tizenöt-húsz előadást tudunk majd megvalósítani.

Az adományokat a kétszereplős darab színészeinek gázsijára, az előadást követő feldolgozó foglalkozást vezető pszichológus szakértő honoráriumára valamint szervezésre és utazásra fordítanánk.

story:
About me & my campaign:

  • I am a man aged 23 who lives just below london, who is trying to get my art out there.
  • The campaign is too raise funding mainly for advertisement to get my artwork shown to as many as people as possible and maybe some better art equipment if I achieve the target. 
  • The money raised will help 10's of thousands of people across the world see my artwork,it will also hopefully raise awareness of my artwork and its popularity. 

What I Need & Where it will go

  • advertising online, advertising my facebook page which currently has 2495 likes. 
  • New/better equipment
  • Getting prints done to sell

How it will help:

  • I am a unique artist and I believe its good and important to show different styles of art, as its an expression and can be seen in many different ways.
  • I received $100 in the past from family and with it got over 2000 likes from it which have stuck since I gained them, showing real interest in my work. I can't afford to keep investing as I don't earn a lot of money as it is.

Risks & Challenges

I have to advertise my artwork carefully as not everyone wants to see artwork but many people do, so I have to direct it at people who are most likely be interested in it. This can be easily solved by:

  • targeting peoples interests and hobbies
  • targeting cultures where my artwork would most atract
  • trying a few different ways and compaing results to get the best results each time

Other Ways You Can Help

Like my page on facebook on this link: https://www.facebook.com/LiamThompsonArtist/

story:
Bring Ballenarca to Puerto Rico!

 

Ballenarca, the giant whale puppet, has traveled the road across the United States, displaying her magical world for people of all ages to experience.  Her tires have tread land for the past year pushing through miles of open hearts and minds, welcoming everyone into her creative vision. This surreal, interactive show has not only greatly impacted and changed the lives of her audience, but also everyone on crew that have dedicated their minds and countless hours into birthing this project. She was conceptualized to be a symbol of creation:  one with no boundaries, to be a free performance of music, puppetry, costume and dance, and to grow a community of makers, musicians and activists for free art!  A show designed to travel and exist in the streets for people walking by to experience surprise, delight and unpredicted revelations. She was built in Austin, Texas as a collaboration with makers from Austin and Poncili Creación of Puerto Rico.

Due to the limitations and physical exhaustions of the road, she is aging fast and needs your help to get to the Homeland of her family: PUERTO RICO!!! She will make the trip to Florida and then take the ferry to San Juan.  We want to take her to Puerto Rico because more than half of her builders and crew are from the island and she is very well known there.  She will be loved and welcomed into the vibrant art community and delight the island with her magic.  When she arrives in Puerto Rico she will be joined by members of prior Ballenarca tours, both from Puerto Rico and Texas.  She will tour around the city and hopefully the entire island.  After her tour she will reside at the Kuniklo Puppet House, an artist collective of former Ballenarca members in the mountains above San Juan.  There she will become a living installation for future shows and projects.  

What we will need

There are many elements involved in transporting a giant trailer-bound whale across the Gulf of Mexico.  The most important part of this scenario is the ferry.  To take the ferry from Florida to San Juan would cost approximately $2000.  At this moment, the whale is in Austin, TX, so we would have to drive her to Florida, costing at least $1500.  After those expenses, we need to refurbish the whale and remake several puppets that have deteriorated, this would cost roughly $800.  The remaining $700 will be put towards securing a viable vehicle to tow the whale when she reaches Puerto Rico, as well as living expenses for the members of the Whale Crew.  

Our rewards are handmade art prints from our members and reprints of our Ballenarca L'Éxpedition Magnifique zine and Ballenarca T-shirts.  Our art is whimsical and charming and makes a perfect complement to a donation. 

If we do not reach our goal, we will use the money that we do make to refurbish the whale.  As of now, she is in serious need of some sprucing.  She has been lying dormant for almost a year and the old girl can use any help she can get.  

If we surpass our goal, we will use the funds to tour further than the San Juan area, taking Ballenarca around the coasts and countryside of Puerto Rico.  

     

    The impact 

     With this campaign we intend to broaden the impact that Ballenarca has already had.  Ballenarca belongs in Puerto Rico, where she can delight children and communities for years to come.  Since she is a mobile stage, the opportunities are endless for performances, events and workshops.  The creative community of Puerto Rico is ready for her.  Local artists who helped create her, and have given presentations about Ballenarca at the yearly puppetry festival in San Juan.  People of the community are familiar with her and have always wanted to experience her first hand.  This will be an amazing opportunity to bring her to a community where she would have a lasting and much appreciated effect. 

    Our Other Successful Campaigns

         Ballenarca has a long and successful history. Ballenarca is the brain child of maker Chereya Esters.  Ballenarca was made in Austin, TX in November 2014.  She was a crowdfunded project, raising over $5000 to create her from an old trailer and found foam.  Ballenarca went on tour in December 2014 from Austin, TX to Miami Art Basel.  In 2015, Ballenarca launched on her second voyage, La Éxpedition Magnifique.  She went from Austin, TX through the midwest and down the east coast on a month long self-sustaining tour.  She visited the National Puppetry Convention at UCONN and performed at many museums, parks and creative spaces.  Her impact was incredible, as you can see by the delighted faces of the children and adults in our video.  
        

    Risks and Challenges

     There will be many challenges in this project.  In all of her incarnations, Ballenarca has faced incredible adversity.  But because our team is so strong and our network so supportive, we have been able to overcome the many challenges that we have faced.  Our greatest challenge in this upcoming project will be all the modes of transportation that Ballenarca will need to get her from Texas to Puerto Rico.  The truck to get her to Florida and the ferry to San Juan pose the biggest risks.  We have always had to deal with a myriad of mechanical failures in our past tours, but we have always found a way to overcome.  
      

    Other ways you can help

    Please help signal boost Ballenarca!  You can help us reach our goal and begin this new chapter in the beautiful saga that is Ballenarca.

    Thank you so much for supporting our beautiful project.
story_txt:
Bring Ballenarca to Puerto Rico! Ballenarca, the giant whale puppet, has traveled the road across the United States, displaying her magical world for people of all ages to experience.  Her tires have tread land for the past year pushing through miles of open hearts and minds, welcoming everyone into her creative vision. This surreal, interactive show has not only greatly impacted and changed the lives of her audience, but also everyone on crew that have dedicated their minds and countless hours into birthing this project. She was conceptualized to be a symbol of creation:  one with no boundaries, to be a free performance of music, puppetry, costume and dance, and to grow a community of makers, musicians and activists for free art!  A show designed to travel and exist in the streets for people walking by to experience surprise, delight and unpredicted revelations. She was built in Austin, Texas as a collaboration with makers from Austin and Poncili Creación of Puerto Rico.Due to the limitations and physical exhaustions of the road, she is aging fast and needs your help to get to the Homeland of her family: PUERTO RICO!!! She will make the trip to Florida and then take the ferry to San Juan.  We want to take her to Puerto Rico because more than half of her builders and crew are from the island and she is very well known there.  She will be loved and welcomed into the vibrant art community and delight the island with her magic.  When she arrives in Puerto Rico she will be joined by members of prior Ballenarca tours, both from Puerto Rico and Texas.  She will tour around the city and hopefully the entire island.  After her tour she will reside at the Kuniklo Puppet House, an artist collective of former Ballenarca members in the mountains above San Juan.  There she will become a living installation for future shows and projects.  What we will needThere are many elements involved in transporting a story:
Short Summary

If one were to ask what type of artist I consider myself  I would say that I am an eclectic visualist. This is because I’m always looking for new discoveries and I create a variety of work from traditional contemporary, to a digital tech style.

I have been drawing since the age of 5 and I would have never guessed that my childhood interests would spark my artistry as an adult. I received my B.F.A from the School of Visual Arts in New York in 1988 but didn’t come out on the art scene until 1990.

 My debut as an artist was at an Expo at the Javits Center in New York  where I had gone by my artist name (KEM). I premiered my art work in the form of buttons and wearable art. I then realized that there was a market for my work with its style of vivid colors and animated expressions.

In 1992, I attended the Print shop of master printer Bob Blackburn  where I studied the basics of lithography and block printing. I have done well with Gallery showcases in the state of Georgia where I resided for five years between 1996 to 2001.  I relocated back to my home town of Brooklyn New York in 2001 and shifted my gears towards education then became an arts instructor in New York City public schools.

In 1999 I founded Artizfacts Visual Arts Specialist, a visual arts communications platform for conveying thought provoking concepts in the community through  means of creative expression in multi-media for children. I am presently developing my independent animated film, Employed as an arts instructor and proud owner/ curator of The Artizfacts Studio Gallery Hub in the Bronx of New York.

  • My campaign is to raise money for renovations for the interior ceiling and lighting of the Artizfacts Studio gallery. This is my personal Art Studio Gallery space in which I have opened by doors to the public for free viewing. In support of other emerging artist, I have provided a platform for exhibitions of their work and will continue to do so. I feel that an art space
  • should be practical yet esthetically pleasing to the eye. This is something both art exhibitors and viewers can benefit from.
  • Funds raised will have a great impact on exhibiting artwork with the correct track lighting. Nothing is more curtail then enough of the right light to view the vibrate colors and textures of art on display. Secondly modernizing the ceilings to conceal the raw industrial look of hanging pipes and valves is important to me. I want visitors to feel at home, a sense of comfort for families and their children in the community when the enter the space. 

What I Need & What You Get

  • My goal for this project is to raise $1,500 for materials such as

1# Efficient track lights for entire space.

2# Licensed electrician for wiring the project.

3# LED strip/ Effect/ Mood Lighting

4# Insulation coverage and concealment of ceiling pipes and valves.

5# Interior ceiling  paint -Black -5 gallons, Grey 2 gallons

* ***ALL NONE ELECTRICAL LABOR WILL BE DONE MY SELF TO KEEP THIS BUDGET AT $1500.

As a token gift for your donations I will be offering the following perks:

wearable art tee shirts, Prints, posters, art classes and original artwork.

  • Monies raised will be put to use in the renovation of Studio Gallery interior ceiling project. If a fraction of funds are raised then the bulk will go to the electrician ......

The Impact

  • Your contribution is valuable by supporting Visual arts space in the Bronx which will allow artist from the NYC area as well as the world to showcase. This enriching experience will impact the lives of families through arts education and appreciation.
  • The Artizfacts Studio Gallery in its former New Rochelle location opened its doors for arts students for a gallery walk during the "Artsfest". Motivating and inspirations via student artist interviews in 2012 to 2013.
  • My doors have always been open to the public, either through exhibitions or private showings. this way you can actual see the works in progress and become an active participant in events and activities.

Risks & Challenges

Insight into the risks and obstacles are as follows. There are none for the sponsors, just the perks. For the fundraiser there is always the real factor of not being funded. All your time, energy and plans for funding can go bust. Your support is so needed. I myself I'm not an expert at fundraising. Of course I don't have the celebrity status to pull in tens of thousands in funded. I'm that hard working emerging artist with a dream, willing to share, that simple. The one you could or even might have ran into on the bus or train and we chat.

Here are two ways I plan as a backup if my goal flops:

  • Start an art auction or Reduce the price for selected art piece, which has already started. The $50-$100 original art sale is in affect https://www.facebook.com/events/898627526926461/
  • Daddy may have to get that side gig for a while to make the extra funds while maintaining daddy daughter time.

Other Ways You Can Help

Understandably many of us are falling on hard financial times, you'd like to contribute but that may present a challenge at this time. Mortgages, rent, car payment, tuitions and every day bills are priority. As a father of two small children I can relate to these challenges as well howevery there are alternatives of demonstrating support.

  • You can spread the word via social media, internet  and other means of communication. Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. Your time is also a resource that will be much appreciated.
  • Remember  to use the Indiegogo share tools!And that's all there is to it.

Thanks for your support and If you cwish you can following me on facebook. If you wish to visit the spring art exhibition at the Artizfacts Studio Gallery Hub please click the link below,

https://www.facebook.com/events/1781861488711058/

story:
The Powerful Bernie Sanders T-shirt Project

I originally started this project to create a more meaningful and powerful Bernie Sanders t-shirt just for myself. But as I wore the 3 shirts I made around my friends, family and out in public the more and more I had people stoping me and asking where I got them. After making about 25 of these for friends and family I thought what a great way to raise money for Bernie's campaign and spread the powerful images to all his supporters. These shirts are not just about a 2016 campaign. These shirts can remind us to be strong and stand up for what is right in our country. Bernie has done so much in a short time to open peoples eyes and make them believe there is a way for change. We are STRONG in our numbers and we are the majority!!! WE CAN CHANGE THINGS!!! But we can't lose the momentum we have.

story:
I was born in Birmingham-UK and was raised by the local care authority in rural Derbyshire in a residential school. At 16, I left school and wandered a lot around the country trying to identify with myself. It was at this point in my latter teens that I discovered art - mainly sculpture, but also drawing and painting. Within this short leap of time I had fully engaged with art. I was locked in, so to speak. 

I am in need of relocating asap from my current work space of the past 9 years as my lease cannot be renewed and I have not the funds for the move. The work spans most of my life's testimony to the arts which is 29 years of paintings, sculpture and drawings in mixed media.


A documentary of my work has just been made - follow the link to view

https:/vimeo.com/156612499 this is direct link to documentary

http://www.corbiculadesign.co.uk/video_promotional.html  
See also Gallery images and my Facebook page and Website, which also contains my CV.

Moving this back catalogue of various artworks is expensive, as it requires a specialist removal firm, packing delicate and large pieces made in every conceivable medium. Relocating will enable me to continue my life as an artist, share my art and put it out to a wider audience. 

I have no choice but to ask for financial help as I cannot make this move alone.

Any help you are able to provide is very much appreciated. You can make a financial contribution of any amount or select a ‘Perk’ (see examples below). Even if you are not able to contribute financially, you can help by sharing this campaign. My thanks to everyone for their support.

“I have bought works from Paul for my own collection and feel lucky to have them. He deserves all the help and support he can get and I feel that, given the right opportunities and exposure, he will eventually receive the success and acknowledgement he so richly deserves.”

- PETER RANDALL-PAGE, Internationally renowned sculptor and artist

“It is as though something inside him is trying to get out, something wise and timeless, trying to communicate with the world through Paul but yet they are as one. Somehow Paul is reconnecting us with our primal selves, which can be exciting, moving, challenging, frightening.  Put simply, this feels like some higher creative force has been placed in the hands of a very humble but very passionate man.”

- AARON CUSTANCE, Biochemist

"Anyone who experiences Paul's work will come to know that he is 'the real deal'. I have never met someone so genuine, so talented. Paul Devon Young is a true artistic genius, and I feel lucky to count him as a friend."

- ROBERT GALE, Editorial Artist, NEW YORK TIMES, 1980's-90's

"I have a hectic lifestyle and am usually totally absorbed in my own work. What I find to my surprise is the peace and timeless wonderment that emanates from Paul's sculptures and paintings. It is as though they are actually trying to say something to me. I almost expect them to speak. I don't pretend to understand this, but it is a real phenomenon."

- SHAN MILLER, Artist and social entrepreneur

The general costs of relocating comprise:

  • Removal company to package and relocate delicate artworks.
  • Removal of large pieces which I will try to achieve with the kind help of friends.
  • Insurance costs.
  • Relocation and settlement costs.
  • The spaces I have been looking at so far seem to be units on industrial estates, so the unforeseen costs that will incur just for being in such a space.
  • There are always other costs that seem to keep coming up, as in the case of my present studio, which has become storage space,

Like the general public, most have to go out and get a job.  
I have worked most of my life and believe in doing good for the wider community... 

When I eventually do relocate I need to establish asap rather than falling back into the zero finance zone that in a strange way I accepted, believing, well I suppose, I should just keep scraping the scraps and be grateful and I look at my work and keep finding other work to keep it together...

 ...and it is together in some ways.

 I have everything ready for the move....

 I am hoping that via this campaign, works on my website, the generosity of the public, it can be seen that clarity is all that I have left.

Perks - examples :

or See Gallery / Facebook / Website for more images

Please note: Perks fee does not include shipping.

£20 GBP A4 Photograph of ceramic piece - Photograph of sawdust fired sculpture

£25 GBP Fossil bone drawing (A4 print) - Fossil bone drawings of 20 ink on paper, unframed, signed

£30 GBP Atavist Series - Digital and mixed media on canvas, digital print (size approx. A3)

£75 GBP - Signed print Monolith Rock and Sea

£100 GBP - Signed c A3 copy print of vessels, ceramic mixed media

£200 GBP 
Original Ceramic Sulpture - Brick clay fired with metal - ‘reptilian’, series of twenty available. Approx. 15-30cm tall.

£275 GBP New Ceramic - Ceramic, metal - ‘elemental’, series #2. Approx. 30cm tall.

£350 GBP
Mixed Media  on Canvas ‘Dinqu’ from the ‘random’ series. Size approx. A3. 

£850 GBP Painting
Approx. Painting, mixed media on canvas, abstract ‘Opposite August’. Size approx. A2.

£1200 GBP Mixed Media on Board - ‘Bluescape’ c 120 x 86 cm

£4000 GBP Njero Presence- Large ash wood sulpture 2004, 175x50x50cm

story:
WHAT IS THE PERILS OF OBEDIENCE ?

THE PERILS OF OBEDIENCE is a multidisciplinary project by New York City based artist Itziar Barrio, structured around the creation of a movie. Initiated in 2010, a new iteration for THE PERILS OF OBEDIENCE will take place in Bogotá on November 2015 as a live audition at Espacio Odeón, curated by Rincón Projects. 

Previous stages of this project were carried out in Bilbao (2010) at BAD Theater and Contemporary Festival and in New York City at Abrons Arts Center (2013 and 2014).

Barrio's ongoing project THE PERILS OF OBEDIENCE mixes performance, theater, film and live experience to confront established sets of rules and cultivate the conditions for unscripted consequences. Inspired by the findings of Stanley Milgram's 1961 psychological experiments, THE PERILS centers around four characters immersed in power dynamics within the same scene in an endless conflict. 

* THE PERILS OF OBEDIENCE is recorded from start to finish, becoming the basis for the creation of different pieces such as videos, sculptures, photographs and silkscreen prints.

* The project is an exploration in power dynamics and constructed situations.

To learn more about this project click the link below: 

www.itziarbarrio.com/casting-the-perils

QUE ES LOS PELIGROS DE LA OBEDIENCIA?

LOS PELIGROS DE LA OBEDIENCIA es un proyecto multidisciplinario de la artista Itziar Barrio (NYC) que inició en el 2010  y que se estructura alrededor del rodaje de una película. La nueva versión de LOS PELIGROS DE LA OBEDIENCIA que tiene  un formato de audición en vivo tendrá lugar en Bogotá en Noviembre de 2015 en el Espacio Odeón con curaduría y gestión de Rincón Projects. 

Las versiones anteriores de éste proyecto se realizaron en Bilbao (2010) para el Festival de Performance BAD y en la ciudad de Nueva York en el Abrons Arts Center (2013 y 2014).  

LOS PELIGROS DE LA OBEDIENCIA es un proyecto en proceso de Itziar Barrio que mezcla performance, teatro, cine y experiencia en vivo, que confronta las normas establecidas y crea condiciones para obtener consecuencias inesperadas e improvisadas.  

El proyecto está inspirado en los resultados obtenidos por el sicólogo Stanley Milgram en 1961. LOS PELIGROS se centra en cuatro personajes inmersos en dinámicas de poder dentro de una escena de conflicto interminable. El Casting, es el proceso de selección de estos cuatro personajes. 

*  LOS PELIGROS DE LA OBEDIENCIA es filmado en su totalidad, desde el inicio el proceso hasta el final, convirtiéndose en la base para la creación de diferentes piezas visuales como vídeo, esculturas, fotografías y obras gráficas (serigrafías). 

* El proyecto explora dos conceptos: las dinámicas de poder y las situaciones construidas.

Pueden ver más de éste proyecto en el siguiente enlace: 

www.itziarbarrio.com/casting-the-perils




About Itziar Barrio / Acerca de Itziar Barrio

Itziar Barrio lives and works in New York City. Itziar Barrio's work has been presented internationally at: MACBA, Barcelona; Museum of Contemporary Art of Belgrade, Serbia; Salzburger Kunstverein, Austria; Abrons Arts Center, NYC; tranzit, Romania;  ARTIUM Museum, Vitoria-Gasteiz, Spain; European Networks for Art producers (ENPAP); New Museum Festival of Ideas for the City, NYC; Havana Biennial, Cuba; Storefront for Art and Architecture, NYC; Hudson Valley Center of Contemporary Art (HVCCA), Peekskill, NY; PIST Project Space, Istanbul, Turkey; Kunsthaus Tacheles, Berlin; LOOP, Barcelona; Sala Rekalde, Bilbao, Spain; Tabakalera, San Sebastián, Spain.

Barrio has received awards including First Prize Ertibil; Brooklyn Art Council, Spanish Ministry of Culture, the NYC Department of Cultural Affairs, Foundation for Contemporary Arts, NYC, and New York Foundation for the Arts Individual Artist Grant. Her residency awards include Skowhegan School of Painting and Sculpture and the International Studio & Curatorial Program (ISCP), New York.

*********************

Itziar Barrio vive y trabaja en la ciudad de Nueva York. Su trabajo ha sido expuesto internacionalmente en museos, galerías y bienales como: MACBA, Barcelona; Museo de Arte Contemporáneo de Belgrade, Serbia; Salzburger Kunstverein, Austria; Abrons Arts Center, NYC; tranzit, Rumania;  ARTIUM Museo, Vitoria-Gasteiz, España; European Networks for Art producers (ENPAP); New Museum Festival of Ideas for the City, NYC; Bienal de la Haban, Cuba; Storefront for Art and Architecture, NYC; Hudson Valley Center of Contemporary Art (HVCCA), NY; PIST Project Space, Istambul, Turquía; Kunsthaus Tacheles, Berlin; LOOP, Barcelona; Sala Rekalde, Bilbao, España; Tabakalera, San Sebastián, España.

Ha recibido numerosos premios, entre los que destacan el Brooklyn Art Council, Ministerio de Cultura de España, NYC Department of Cultural Affairs, Foundation for Contemporary Arts, NYC, New York Foundation for the Arts Individual Artist Grant y Primer Premio Ertibil. Ha sido artista residente entre otras instituciones de la Skowhegan School of Painting and Sculpture, el International Studio & Curatorial Program (ISCP) y Hudson Valley Center for Contemporary Art.

About Odeón / Acerca de Odeón

Espacio Odeón is a non-profit, independent that has been operating since 2011. Our mission is to promote visual and performing arts, as well as contributing to the regeneration of the historic center of Bogotá, La Candelaria. Through a diverse and dynamic program that is open to the public, Espacio Odeón becomes a contemporary art center with national and international projection. We promote the reflection of the different artistic manifestations of today.

***************

ESPACIO ODEÓN - CENTRO CULTURAL es una iniciativa de carácter independiente y privado que abrió sus puertas en el año 2011. Nuestra misión es fomentar y difundir las artes visuales y escénicas, así como contribuir al plan de recuperación del centro histórico de la ciudad. A través de una programación diversa y abierta a todos los públicos, el Espacio Odeón es un centro de cultura contemporánea con proyección internacional, que promueve la reflexión sobre cada una de las manifestaciones  artísticas de la actualidad.

About Rincón Projects/ Acerca de Rincón Projects

Rincón Projects is a venture to bring together ideas and people interested in the arts, in a collaborative way to generate different projects in areas like arts Management, art market, publications and advisory for artistic events. In a globalized world, Rincón Projects develops its activities in different cities promoting the exchange and connection between individuals and their various cultural backgrounds.  Rincón Projects likes to function as  roving platform, however, since April 2015 it has a permanent project room in Bogotá, Colombia.

*******

Rincón Projects es una iniciativa para reunir ideas y personas interesadas en el arte, de manera colaborativa y con el fin de generar diversos proyectos en áreas como la gestión cultural, el mercado del arte, las publicaciones y la asesoría en eventos artísticos. En un mundo globalizado, Rincón Projects ha realizado sus actividades en diferentes ciudades, promoviendo el intercambio y conexión entre individuos de diferentes contextos culturales. Rincón Projects tiene carácter nómada, aunque desde Abril de 2015, cuenta con un “Rincón” de proyectos permanente en Bogotá.

WHY DO WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT? / POR QUE NECESITAMOS SU APOYO? 

We have already funded part of the project, but we are still needing some more funds to successfully produced the performance. 

*******

Ya hemos logrado financiar parte de este proyecto pero todavía necesitamos más fondos para producir exitosamente éste proyecto. 


HOW WILL WE THANK YOUR SUPPORT? / COMO LE AGRADECEREMOS SU APORTE?

$20: You will get an exclusive postcard of the project. / Recibirá una postal exclusiva del proyecto.

$50: You will get a specially designed Tote Bag + a ticket for the performance.  / Recibirá una bolsa especialmente diseñada y una boleta para el performance. 

$100: You  will get a Limited Edition Photograph. -There is only 20 per image- + ticket for the performance.  / Obtendrá una fotografía de edición limitada de 20 copias, más una boleta para el performance. 

$500: with your donation you will get a limited edition Print (Silkscreen on paper) + 2 tickets for the performance  / Con su donación obtendrá una serígrafía de edición limitada, creada especialmente para este proyecto, así como 2 boletas para el performance. 

$1000: As a Patron for this project, you will get  the Limited edition Print (Silkscreen on Paper) YO SIEMPRE PUEDO + Tote Bag & Agenda +  a Private Studio Visit (Studio is in NY ) or a private view of the CASTING, Bogotá. / Cómo patrocinador y mecenas de este proyecto obtendrá la serigrafía de YO SIEMPRE PUEDO + Bolsa THE PERILS & Agenda Odéon +   visita privada al estudio del artista ( NY) o una función privada de CASTING, en Bogotá.

story:
Our Story

Twin Rabbit Artist Collective (theTRAC) Gallery & Studios

theTRAC equips working artists with the resources to create successful careers as professional artists and educators. This is an opportunity for artists and our community to come together and create a better life experience for us all. We are the new standard for artists and the art world; the right TRAC starts here.

theTRAC aims to erase the "starving artist" byline and get working artists on the fast TRAC to success. By focusing on the artist's well being not the profit margin, we will help artists gain experience and stand out among the competition. As we progress, we will continue to be a pillar of our community, expanding our opportunities for our artists and community members, adding more "green" facets to our daily operations, and pairing with our community and supporters to create a better, brighter, more beautiful place to live.

Our Promise to You

We promise you that every single penny you contribute will go straight into theTRAC. We are working non-stop to make our dream into a reality, and we will not waste your generosity. We have innumerable ideas for how to make theTRAC truly spectacular, and we will not stop until we do. If we can get started without having to repay bank loans (which takes away from our ability to help artists), our ability to succeed goes up exponentially. Your generous contributions go directly toward making theTRAC a success. Period.

WHAT WE WILL DO:

Start a collective of working artists to help them further their artistic and teaching careers. We'll do this by offering large studio spaces they can afford, gallery spaces where they can show, and high quality classes they can teach to gain experience they won't find anywhere else.

  • Artists will have large, affordable, upscale spaces where they can create and thrive individually, and collectively
  • With over 12,000 square feet of creative space to prosper and grow, artists will have access to high quality studio space, work space, gallery space and a supportive environment to excel artistically and professionally
  • The community will have a place where they can not just purchase and view beautiful and affordable art, but create their own while learning valuable skills and enriching their lives

WHY IT MATTERS:

Supporting the arts helps the economy; fosters self-esteem in children and adults; benefits student achievement; boosts health and healing, and generally just makes the world a more beautiful place to live in. Fostering the arts benefits us all.

The competition is fierce for finding teaching jobs, we will help recent MFA graduates gain more experience and build their resumes with the multitude of opportunities the TRAC will offer. Keep the arts alive; support local artists and educators!

THE DETAILS:

There are hundreds of galleries and studios available to artists in every city, but few that seek to actually help benefit the artist. Businesses that offer show space for an artist's work tend to charge an artist twice: once to rent the space, and again by taking a commission on any work sold. That commission is ~40%. This is standard practice. This practice forces an artist raise their prices in order to get a fair price on their work. The this makes artwork far too expensive for most art-lovers to buy, and thus most artists cannot sell their work and wind up in the negative. In addition, as galleries are commission based, art work is rarely rotated out, and the same art is on the walls month after month. This is boring for the customers, and disheartening for the artists. Bad for artists, bad for business.

Studio spaces are flat-out overpriced. Closet-sized spaces are rented for $200/month, with spaces not much bigger going for $400+. Finding a space artists can afford to work in, in order to create the art that they will have to pay twice to show it, in a place they won't be likely to sell it, is a vicious cycle. The term "starving artist" isn't a cliche, it's a reality.

Teaching jobs are difficult to find, especially right out of grad school. The competition is fierce and it's rare for grads to find something in their state, much less their field. If artists can find a teaching job, they often must relocate, it is usually temporary (adjunct), and introductory classes are all that will be thought qualified for. Grads often end up taking jobs in the non-art sector, sitting on their hard-won (not to mention expensive!) degrees. Creative time and energy is wasted.

theTRAC Gallery & Studios will change all of that. theTRAC will provide an affordable, upscale place for artists of all disciplines (including literary and musical) to create, gain feedback, and show their work. We will provide large, budget-friendly studio spaces for rent, a gallery rented at a flat rate, taking no commission on sales, and will offer quality classes for low rates to people of all ages and skill levels. By working with theTRAC, recent MFA graduates will be able to continue the practice of teaching, gaining experience, and padding their resumes, making them more eligible in the teaching pool for any job they set their sights on. Classes at theTRAC will be offered at much lower prices, and taught by the highly trained MFAs, their lessons still fresh in their minds. These classes will also open up the opportunity for the MFAs to teach on every level, across disciplines, allowing them to become more skilled at teaching higher level classes, in addition to the introductory basics.

And this is just the beginning. We are looking ahead to expanding our business, thinking globally with new opportunities using technology to reach an online, interactive market, and virtual classrooms. Long-distance, and introverted learners, join us!

With you behind us, theTRAC will become the new reality. Before we can help local artists, we need your generous contributions to help fund our first year in business. Rent, utilities, supplies, furnishings, advertising... we can't do it without you!!

WHO WE ARE:

Meagan & Robert Keith: artists; educators; visionaries. Robert is a MFA graduate of the University of South Carolina with a background in education and all forms of art, specializing in painting and printmaking. Meagan's background is in comprehensive business management, education, photography, typography and graphic design.

What We Need (the details)

We have secured a large space that is perfect to start theTRAC. But we need your help to make this happen!

We need a minimum of $110,000 to get the first year started right. This will provide:

  • RENT, taxes, insurance and CAMs for 12,600 SF to house 20 large artist studios, a large gallery for shows, classrooms, workshops, and office space, shop space for the more involved arts (ceramics, etc.), restrooms, storage, etc.
  • UTILITIES estimated at ~$3,000/month
  • SUPPLIES: For classes we will teach. Classes should cover supplies after start-up.
  • FURNISHINGS/REMODELING. Building out the studio spaces, setting up the gallery, outfitting the work shop and the classroom, etc.
  • ADVERTISING. A combination of print ads, flyers and other means to reach the right target audience.
  • MISCELLANEOUS to fund shows and unexpected repairs/expenses, etc.

 What You Get!

  • We're creating the new way to do business in the arts and you can be a part of it!

  • Our t-shirts, stadium cups, pens and notebooks are beautifully designed by Meagan herself and stamped with pride with theTRAC logo. Be sure to check out our TRAC Fan Pack!

  • If you live in town, you can also choose to receive a class for FREE!

Risks & Challenges

We are determined, but we are not naive. We know there is a possibility of failure in any new venture, but we have the determination and ability to make theTRAC into a success. To be what we want to be, the bar is high, but we have no doubt we will triumph. Here's why:

  • We know what it's like to be on the other side of that resume or CV, hoping someone likes our work enough to hang it, buy it, learn it. This gives  us invaluable insight into how to go about making it work for everyone involved.
  • We chose a space near enough to downtown to be convenient, but far enough that we can be different, and have that be expected. Not being stamped from the corporate cookie-cutter is just the beginning of our success.
  • What's better for the artist, is better for the customer, is better for the business. It's just that simple.
  • theTRAC will be a destination not to be missed.
  • We're hard workers. We know that this is what we will be doing 25/8/366 and we can't wait.
  • We're also persistent as heck and don't give up. We make it work no matter what.
  • We’ve already started TRAC-ing down artists for membership. We're serious about making this work, and so are our artists.

If We Miss Our Campaign Goal

We have a huge goal to meet and regardless of the outcome of our efforts to secure your financial participation, we will apply the support we receive to pursue our passion to make a better life for artists and our future. We won't let our supporters down!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute, we totally understand! But that doesn't mean you can't help us immensely. Just help us spread the word about our cause! Word-of-mouth is one of the BEST ways to get noticed! So use the Indiegogo share tools, tell all of your friends, your family, your neighbors, your neighbor's friends, their families, tell everyone! We have a huge goal to meet, but we can promise you that it will be worth it. Wait until you see.

If we don't get to tell you personally, THANK YOU. From the bottom of our hearts, thank you. This venture is huge, but we cannot wait to begin.


Help us paint our dream.

All our love!

Meagan & Robert Keith, theTRAC

The
community will have a place where they can not just purchase and view beautiful
and affordable art, but create their own while learning valuable skills and enriching their lives

WHY IT MATTERS:
Supporting the arts helps the economy; fosters self-esteem in children and adults; benefits student achievement; boosts health and healing, and generally just makes the world a more beautiful place to live in. Fostering the arts benefits us all.
The competition is fierce for finding teaching jobs, we will help recent MFA graduates gain more experience and build their resumes with the multitude of opportunities the TRAC will offer. Keep the arts alive; support local artists and educators!
THE DETAILS:There are hundreds of galleries and studios available to artists in every city, but few that seek to actually help benefit the artist. Businesses that offer show space for an artist's work tend to charge an artist twice: once to rent the space, and again by taking a commission on any work sold. That commission is ~40%. This is standard practice. This practice forces an artist raise their prices in order to get a fair price on their work. The this makes artwork far too expensive for most art-lovers to buy, and thus most artists cannot sell their work and wind up in the negative. In addition, as galleries are commission based, art work is rarely rotated out, and the same art is on the walls month after month. This is boring for the customers, and disheartening for the artists. Bad for artists, bad for business.
Studio spaces are flat-out overpriced. Closet-sized spaces are rented for $200/month, with spaces not much bigger going for $400+. Finding a space artists can afford to work in, in order to create the art that they will have to pay twice to show it, in a place they won't be likely to sell it, is a vicious cycle. The term "starving artist" isn't a cliche, it's a reality.Teaching jobs are difficult to find, especially right out of grad school. The competition is fierce and it's rare for grads to find something in their state, much less their field. If artists can find a teaching job, they often must relocate, it is usually temporary (adjunct), and introductory classes are all that will be thought qualified for. Grads often end up taking jobs in the non-art sector, sitting on their hard-won (not to mention expensive!) degrees. Creative
time and energy is wasted.


theTRAC Gallery & Studios will change all of that. theTRAC will provide an affordable, upscale place for artists of all disciplines (including literary and musical) to create, gain feedback, and show their work. We will provide large, budget-friendly studio spaces for rent, a gallery rented at a flat rate, taking no commission on sales, and will offer quality classes for low rates to people of all ages and skill levels. By working with theTRAC, recent MFA graduates will be able to continue 
the practice of teaching, gaining experience, and padding their resumes,
 making them more eligible in the teaching pool for any job they set 
their sights on. Classes at theTRAC will be offered at much lower prices, and taught by the highly 
trained MFAs, their lessons still fresh in their minds. These classes 
will also open up the opportunity for the MFAs to teach on every level, across disciplines, allowing them to become more skilled at teaching higher level classes, in addition to the introductory basics.
And this is just the beginning. We are looking ahead to expanding our business, thinking globally with new opportunities using technology to reach an online, interactive market, and virtual classrooms. Long-distance, and introverted learners, join us!
With you behind us, theTRAC will become the new reality. Before we can help local artists, we need your generous contributions to help fund our first year in business. Rent, utilities, supplies, furnishings, advertising... we can't do it without you!!


WHO WE ARE: 
Meagan & Robert Keith: artists; educators; visionaries. Robert is a MFA graduate of the University of South Carolina with
a background in education and all forms of art, specializing in painting and
printmaking. Meagan's background is in comprehensive business management, education,
photography, typography and graphic design.


What We Need (the details)



We have secured a large space that
is perfect to start theTRAC. But we need your help to make this happen!
We need a minimum of
$110,000 to get the first year started right. This will provide:

RENT,
     taxes, insurance and CAMs for 12,600 SF to house 20 large artist studios, a large gallery for shows, classrooms,
     workshops, and office space, shop space for the more involved
     arts (ceramics, etc.), restrooms, storage, etc. 
UTILITIES estimated at ~$3,000/month

SUPPLIES: For classes we will teach. Classes should cover
     supplies after start-up.
FURNISHINGS/REMODELING.
     Building out the studio spaces, setting up
     the gallery, outfitting the work shop and the classroom, etc. 

ADVERTISING.
     A combination of print ads, flyers
     and other means to reach the right target audience. 
MISCELLANEOUS
     to fund shows and unexpected repairs/expenses, etc. 
 What You Get!

We're creating the new way to do business in the arts and you can be a part of it!


Our t-shirts, stadium cups, pens and notebooks are beautifully designed by Meagan herself and stamped with pride with theTRAC logo. Be sure to check out our TRAC Fan Pack!
If you live in town, you can also choose to receive a class for FREE! 

 Risks & Challenges
We are determined, but we are not naive. We know there is a possibility of failure in any new venture, but we have the determination and ability to make theTRAC into a success. To be what we want to be, the bar is high, but we have no doubt we will triumph. Here's why:
 We know what it's like to be on the other side of that resume or CV, hoping someone likes our work enough to hang it, buy it, learn it. This gives  us invaluable insight into how to go about making it work for everyone involved.
We chose a space near enough to downtown to be convenient, but far enough that we can be different, and have that be expected. Not being stamped from the corporate cookie-cutter is just the beginning of our success.

What's better for the artist, is better for the customer, is better for the business. It's just that simple.
theTRAC will be a destination not to be missed.

We're
     hard workers. We know that this is what we will be doing 25/8/366 and we
     can't wait.
We're
     also persistent as heck and don't give up. We make it work no matter what.

We’ve already started TRAC-ing down artists for membership. We're serious about making this work, and so are our artists. 




If We Miss Our Campaign Goal


We have a huge goal to meet and regardless of
the outcome of our efforts to secure your financial participation, we will apply
the support we receive to pursue our passion to make a better life for artists and our
future. We won't let our supporters down!
   Other Ways You Can Help If you just can't contribute, we totally understand! But that doesn't mean you can't help us immensely. Just help us spread the word about our cause! Word-of-mouth is one of the BEST ways to get noticed! So use the Indiegogo share tools, tell all of your friends, your family, your neighbors, your neighbor's friends, their families, tell everyone! We have a huge goal to meet, but we can promise you that it will be worth it. Wait until you see.
 If we don't get to tell you personally, THANK YOU. From the bottom of our hearts, thank you. This venture is huge, but we cannot wait to begin.Help us paint our dream.All our love!Meagan & Robert Keith, theTRAC

story:
Short Summary


Hello good people..

First, let me introduce myself: I am Efnu Nirwana, an artist  and musician living and working in Yogyakarta, Indonesia. In December 2014, I traveled to Leipzig, Germany for an independent artist residency and solo exhibition with Gap|Gap Offspace. Now I have been invited to Leipzig once again for an independent artist residency at KONTOR 80 (Torgauer Str. 80) which is an artist-run, non-commercial gallery and multidisciplinary artist collective.

This opportunity would provide me with the chance to continue an art-cultural exchange with the local artists and community that has already been started from my last residency.

To be back in Leipzig is like coming back to my second home. However, it will also mean that I will be living in another country for 3 months, working and living in a different atmosphere which is also what makes me excited.

This project isn't my project at all but ours. I just an artist who is operate it for you.

This project will held on July 2016 in KONTOR 80  and it will be a manual woodcut print performance, inviting community participants to use their imagination to visualize their real world from their own life experiences.

The participants will draw and cut together on one big piece of wood or linoleum, arranged in a circle. They will then manually print the woodcut on fabric or paper, “dancing” together on the woodcut to imitate a modern print-machine. Once finished, they will be able to display the print in their community as an invitation to continue the discussion of their shared humanity.

I quoted Jonathan H. Turner  ''Cultural clashes is a conflict caused by "differences in culture values and beliefs that place people at odds with one another".

My aim is to provide a medium through which people from different backgrounds can bridge socio-economic, racial, cultural and gender gaps. By working together on one piece of art, participants will have an opportunity to share ideas about humanity, peace and equality. Breaking down barriers of language, race, and ethnicity to create as one community develops unity and fosters understanding amongst all, to cut the border! And most of all, making art is always FUN to celebrate the diversity!

SHARING is CARING is the general idea behind this project, so I would like to ask for your contribution in helping make this project happen.

W.http://efnunirwana.com | F. https://www.facebook.com/efnu.nirwana | E. naivepop@gmail.com | B. http://happykvltproject.blogspot.co.id | P. +62 896-3299-3631


What We Need & What You Get

  • The project will cost € 2050 which will cover :

Paper 12’’ x 18’’ 1 pack of 50 sheets = € 19,6

Linoleum block 36’’ x 36’’ 3pcs Pkg of 3 pcs = € 93,42

Linoleum block 9’’ x 12’’ 4 Packs of 20 sheets (@ €18) = € 72

Block Printing Ink 16 oz / 473 ml 2 Jars (@ €22,49) = € 44,98

Rubber Brayer (ink roller) 8’’ 2 pcs (@ €31,65) = € 63,3

Fabric 2 m x 2 m 3 sheets (@ €19)= € 57

Graphite Pencils 20 pcs (@ €2) = € 40

Room rent for 3 months €200/month = € 700

Flight ticket ( two ways ) = € 800 

Ps: Prices and availability may vary by store, catalog, and online.

  • Perks! I guarantee you every item is limited, using the finest, professional artist materials, made manually from start to finish.
  1. Postcard Bundle

    Taken from my original drawing | 5 different drawing/bundle

  2. T-Shirts

    Woodcut Prints on 30s Cotton Combed |Crafted and printed manually from start to the end.

    Availability: Unisex | Allsize | 5 pcs | Only in Red                                                              Woodcut Prints on 30s Cotton Combed |Crafted and printed manually from start to the end.Availability: Unisex | Allsize | 5 pcs | Only in Blue

  3. Woodcut Prints on Paper #1

    Title: Halt

    Medium: Woodcut prints on paper (Canson Acid free/200gr)

    Size: 8'' x 11,5''

    Edition: 20 | 1 Artist Proof | Posted in roll / without frame | Availability: 2

    Title: Anarcho Jogis

    Medium: Woodcut prints on paper (Canson Acid free/200gr)

    Size: 8'' x 11,5''

    Edition: 20 | 1 Artist Proof | Posted in roll / without frame | Availability: 5

    Title: Lion

    Medium: Woodcut prints on paper (Tintoreto Gesso Acid free/160gr)

    Size: 9'' x 9''

    Edition: 20 | 1 Artist Proof | Posted in roll / without frame | Availability: 3

    Title: Tree House

    Medium: Woodcut prints on paper (Canson Acid free/200gr)

    Size: 8'' x 11,5''

    Edition: 20 | 1 Artist Proof | Posted in roll / without frame | Availability: 2

  4. Woodcut Prints on Paper #2

    Title: Se(a)renity

    Medium: Woodcut prints on paper (Canson Acid free/200gr)

    Size: 11,5'' x 15,5''

    Edition: 10 | 2 Artist Proof | Availability: 5

    Ps: Posted in roll / without frame / certificate of authenticity / personal letter.

    Title: Marx and His Mind

    Medium: Woodcut prints on paper (Canson Acid free/200gr)

    Size: 11,5'' x 15,5''

    Edition: 10 | 2 Artist Proof | Availability: 5

    Ps: Posted in roll / without frame / certificate of authenticity / personal letter.

    Title: The Food Fighter

    Medium: Woodcut prints on paper (Tintoreto Gesso acid free/160gr)

    Size: 11,5'' x 15,5''

    Edition: 10 | 2 Artist Proof | Availability: 2

    Ps: Posted in roll / without frame / certificate of authenticity / personal letter.

    Title: Propa Gandhi

    Medium: Woodcut prints on paper (Canson Acid free/200gr)

    Size: 11,5'' x 15,5''

    Edition: 10 | 2 Artist Proof | Availability: 5

    Ps: Posted in roll / without frame / certificate of authenticity / personal letter.

  5. Screen printing on Canvas

    Title: Broken String Affannato

    Medium: Screen printing, Acrylic on Canvas

    Dimension: 16,5'' x 23,2''

    Year: 2016

    Ps: Posted in roll / without frame / certificate of authenticity / personal letter.

    Title: Fals(e)tory Reading

    Medium: Screen printing, Acrylic on Canvas

    Dimension: 16,5'' x 23,2''

    Year: 2016

    Ps: Posted in roll / without frame / certificate of authenticity / personal letter.

    Title: Have A Good Nightmare

    Medium: Screen printing, Acrylic on Canvas

    Dimension: 16,5'' x 23,2''

    Year: 2016

    Ps: Posted in roll / without frame / certificate of authenticity / personal letter.

    Title: Ride on Waves

    Medium: Screen printing, Acrylic on Canvas

    Dimension: 16,5'' x 23,2''

    Year: 2016

    Ps: Posted in roll / without frame / certificate of authenticity / personal letter.



  • If the funds is more than the goal, its mean we can make another project at another places and reach more people. 
  • If the funds do not cover all required costs, I will make a fundraising exhibition to cover the rest.



Risks & Challenges

    • Nothing is risky but love.
    • I'm a hard-worker and a fast learner.
      I will post all my activities on my Facebook and my website so you can follow this project easily on internet.

Other Ways You Can Involved

We need you by giving nothing to promote or support financially this project to give the project a chance to come into the world.

Use the Indiegogo share tools!
If you are on Facebook please share this campaign on your page and using hashtag #cuttheborderproject.
SHARING is CARING!
Thank you from the bottom of my heart!! Peace, Love and Respect!

story:
"Roads? Where we're going we don't need roads"






In the beginning:

We hatched a plan to create an installation on the Playa based on the proposition:  What if the Cadillacs of the iconic art installation Cadillac Ranch, ten Cadillacs buried nose down by Ant Farm in Texas in 1974, re-emerged, nose up on the Playa at Burning Man?  

And what if the Cadillacs had been transformed into zero-emissions vehicles? 

"Where the idea was born... Burning Man 2015"


We brainstormed in camp at Burning Man in 2015, then made many drawings of a variety of hybrids and e-vehicles, like these..

Perhaps inevitably we eventually settled on the most iconic modern equivalent to, as well as the antithesis of the Cadillac -- the Tesla.  We approached Ant Farm with our idea and they gave us permission to create an installation based on Cadillac Ranch.  Thank-you Ant Farm!  

And, to challenge ourselves to get our act together, we applied for sponsorship from Burning Man Arts.  Burning Man Arts have offered us a $5,000 grant towards our expenses. 

Thank you Burning Man!  Now we’re really stoked about getting done in time, with all the help we can muster from you, the rest of our friends.

Story so far:

So, imagine that the ten gas-guzzling, gross-polluting Cadillacs of “Cadillac Ranch” have burrowed through the earth and are re- emerging as zero-emissions vehicles from the Playa.  

It would look something like this:

That’s if we had about $250,000 to build it.  And we will one day, although not in time for BM 2016.  So, more modestly, we will invoke the same concept with one, or if we can reach our stretch goal ten replicas, looking something like this:

So what is our goal ? 

Because of Burning Man and our friends we will build at least 

ONE LIGHT VERSION REPLICA ELECTRIC VEHICLE




    We want to build a Premium one

    You are able to climb into! 



    Of course with some kids and more modification !


    Of course we need lights (Safety first)



    So what's Next ? 

  • We ourselves are committed to giving as much as we can.

  • Our budget includes only expenses that are 100% directly attributable to the actual cost of the installation itself.

  • Our artists, engineers and crew pay for their transportation costs (in many cases from Germany) and personal supplies (food, camping equipment, etc.).

  • And many Burner friends are making generous in-kind donations.


"If our calculations are correct ... when this project hits his goal ....you're gonna see some serious......" 




 GOAL: SINGLE REPLICA ELECTRIC VEHICLE



GOAL = $16,500

You will get our time and our effort to make this project happen

  • Keep me posted and updated
  • Digital goods 
  • Our Sticker

“Playing with Fire” (“Jugando con fuego”) DVD 

A must-have for serious Burners and supporters:  lead-artist Keith Muscutt’s documentary explores the tradition of making art with fireworks in Peru.  Rural pirotecnicos grind gunpowder in their kitchens, make towering fire sculptures and blow everything up — including their factory with the filmmakers in it! Watch the trailer (“here”).  Plus the stickers and patches.


Champagne  reception

Artists champagne reception with a sundown tour of playa art on the mutant-vehicle Joyism (weather permitting), Thurs. Sept. 1st., 5:00 PM at Two-Lanterns Camp. Limit 10.” 


An exclusive Comic - 

Storyboard of our tale... Drawings by Pawel Pietkun 


Artist / architect and animator Pawel Pietkun (Link) is creating a storyboard in color of the conception and realization of the installation. It will be a lavish limited-edition of 50, signed by the artist for collectors. And of course you get the sticker and patch too.


3D Model of our Art Work

A fully assembled, laser-cut 3D model of the installation, true to the original, scaled down using the original CAD files. A collector’s numbered, limited-edition of ten, discreetly inscribed with the artists' signatures (just cover these up and you can pretend you made it yourself). Plus the 3D data files (creative commons copyright)



Last but not least ! 


Save the clock tower ... ehh. Save this piece of Art ! Every year at Thanksgiving the President of the United States pardons the White House Turkey, instead of cooking it.  In that same spirit of sacred giving we offer as the highest level of reward a reprieve for our installation.  

FOR A CONTRIBUTION OF $5,000 WE WILL PARDON ONE ELECTRIC VEHICLE REPLICA AND REFRAIN FROM BURNING IT ON THE PLAYA.  At your request, we will transfer ownership to you and deliver it, as is, to any location in the continental United States for the reasonable and necessary costs of transportation from Black Rock City.  

Preserve it as a priceless Art-e-fact, or burn the sucker – that’s up to you.





Keith "Easy" Muscutt: 

Explores the jungles of Peru for pre-Columbian ruins  (Learn more) which he documents with camera and pen.  "I’ve been a member of 2-Lanterns Camp since 2007 (Camp). 

Burning Man is the antidote to the Amazon, where I re-connect with my own tribe. With this project I’m returning to my roots making multi-media art and paying homage to a source inspiration."

Steve “Night-Rider” Ornellas: 33 years supervising the wood fabrication shop for the UCSC science programs, designing and building scientific apparatus, clean rooms, laser labs, green houses, dark rooms, wet labs, and field equipment.

Richard Peifer:  THEConstructor / Santa Cruz -California

Jason Guy: Desert rat, Light sculptor and Burner since '04; with fascinations in symmetry, geometry, tiling, evolution, robotics and electronics as well as ancient & maritime histories. (Instagram)

Joslyn Schott:  Chef, Nevada/California/Cologne - 

Bodo Jülicher: Architect from Cologne, Germany.

 juelicher (at) cosmonoid.de

Paulina Kuper: Psychologist from Cologne, Germany

Jakub Sztur: Architect from Aachen, Germany.

www.sztur-haerter.de / Instagram: https://goo.gl/y0grvM

js(at) sztur-haerter.de

Sean Pace:  Maker:  Link

Pawel Pietkun: Artist / architect and animator 

(Aachen(Germany)/ Kraków(Poland)

Andrzej Sztur(Andi aka. Sunny An Di): 

Economist from Aachen, Germany / Kraków (Poland)

Media Manager/ Something with Internet 

Ask for warm beer ! 

Andi (at)marketekture.de

So, imagine that the ten gas-guzzling, gross-polluting Cadillacs of “Cadillac Ranch” have burrowed through the earth and are re- emerging as zero-emissions vehicles from the Playa.  
It would look something like this:

That’s if we had about $250,000 to build it.  And we will one day, although not in time for BM 2016.  So, more modestly, we will invoke the same concept with one, or if we can reach our stretch goal ten replicas, looking something like this:


So what is our goal ? 
Because of Burning Man and our friends we will build at least 
ONE LIGHT VERSION REPLICA ELECTRIC VEHICLE















We want to build a Premium one

You are able to climb into! 





Of course with some kids and more modification !



Of course we need lights (Safety first)






So what's Next ? 



We ourselves are committed to giving as much as we can.
Our budget includes only expenses that are 100%
directly attributable to the actual cost of the installation itself.


Our artists, engineers and crew pay for
their transportation costs (in many cases from Germany) and personal supplies
(food, camping equipment, etc.).



And many Burner friends are making generous in-kind
donations.




"If our calculations are
      correct ... when this project hits his goal ....you're gonna see some
      serious......" 








 GOAL: SINGLE REPLICA ELECTRIC VEHICLE








GOAL = $16,500





You will get our time and our effort to make this project happen


Keep me posted and updated
Digital goods 
Our Sticker


“Playing with Fire” (“Jugando con fuego”) DVD 
A must-have for serious Burners and supporters:  lead-artist Keith Muscutt’s documentary explores the tradition of making art with fireworks in Peru.  Rural pirotecnicos grind gunpowder in their kitchens, make towering fire sculptures and blow everything up — including their factory with the filmmakers in it! Watch the trailer (“here”).  Plus the stickers and patches.

Champagne  reception
Artists champagne reception with a sundown tour of playa art on the mutant-vehicle Joyism (weather permitting), Thurs. Sept. 1st., 5:00 PM at Two-Lanterns Camp. Limit 10.” 


An exclusive Comic - 
Storyboard of our tale... Drawings by Pawel Pietkun 
Artist / architect and animator Pawel Pietkun (Link) is creating a storyboard in color of the conception and realization of the installation. It will be a lavish limited-edition of 50, signed by the artist for collectors. And of course you get the sticker and patch too.




3D Model of our Art Work
A fully assembled, laser-cut 3D model of the installation, true to the original, scaled down using the original CAD files. A collector’s numbered, limited-edition of ten, discreetly inscribed with the artists' signatures (just cover these up and you can pretend you made it yourself). Plus the 3D data files (creative commons copyright)





Last but not least ! 



Save the clock tower ... ehh. Save this piece of Art ! Every year at Thanksgiving the President of the United States pardons the White House Turkey, instead of cooking it.  In that same spirit of sacred giving we offer as the highest level of reward a reprieve for our installation.  
FOR A CONTRIBUTION OF $5,000 WE WILL PARDON ONE ELECTRIC VEHICLE REPLICA AND REFRAIN FROM BURNING IT ON THE PLAYA.  At your request, we will transfer ownership to you and deliver it, as is, to any location in the continental United States for the reasonable and necessary costs of transportation from Black Rock City.  
Preserve it as a priceless Art-e-fact, or burn the sucker – that’s up to you.




















Keith "Easy" Muscutt: 

Explores the jungles of Peru for pre-Columbian ruins  (Learn more) which he documents with camera and pen.  "I’ve been a member of 2-Lanterns Camp since 2007 (Camp). 
Burning Man is the antidote to the Amazon, where I re-connect with my own tribe. With this project I’m returning to my roots making multi-media art and paying homage to a source inspiration."
Steve “Night-Rider” Ornellas: 33 years supervising the wood fabrication shop for the UCSC science 
programs, designing and building scientific apparatus, clean rooms, 
laser labs, green houses, dark rooms, wet labs, and field equipment.
Richard Peifer:  THEConstructor / Santa Cruz -California
Jason Guy: Desert rat, Light sculptor and Burner since '04; with fascinations in symmetry, geometry, tiling, evolution, robotics and electronics
as well as ancient & maritime histories. (Instagram)
Joslyn Schott:  Chef, Nevada/California/Cologne - 
Bodo Jülicher: Architect from Cologne, Germany.
 juelicher (at) cosmonoid.de
Paulina Kuper: Psychologist from Cologne, Germany
Jakub Sztur: Architect from Aachen, Germany.
www.sztur-haerter.de / Instagram: https://goo.gl/y0grvM
js(at) sztur-haerter.de
Sean Pace:  Maker:  Link
Pawel Pietkun: Artist / architect and animator 
(Aachen(Germany)/ Kraków(Poland)
Andrzej Sztur(Andi aka. Sunny An Di): 
Economist from Aachen, Germany / Kraków (Poland)
Media Manager/ Something with Internet 
Ask for warm beer ! 
Andi (at)marketekture.de

story:
International Film Festival Manhattan is bringing multi-awarded and critically acclaimed scriptwriter to NYC for a meeting of the minds and hearts. Mr. Lee will selflessly share writing tips, techniques and his experiences with chosen participants to be part of the roster of writers that Mr. Lee has ushered to the wonderful world of writing and film. 
 In the tradition of past Ricky Lee workshops and the Writers Studio Foundation, that gives scholarships to deserving individuals, the committee is excited to do the same .To make this possible we need to raise funds, thus we are reaching out to the good donors in Indiegogo to help us fulfill the project that will be greatly beneficial to all participants.
 Day 1 October 17, 7pm: Film screening with introduction and question and answer with Mr Ricky Lee
 Day 2 October 18 ,Producers Club;  5-10pm
 Day 3 October 19 ,Producers Club;  5-10pm
 Note:  output will be a final storyline

story:
Friends.


I am embarking on a six-week commitment to complete a body of work that I have been spending time with in my studio since the beginning of 2016. 

I've been accepted into a summer residency program in PA--which is a great thing. But given that this is my first residency experience, I have run into some financial obstacles that have been unavoidable. 

This is a somewhat spontaneous venture and since the application date and the start date fell so close together, I am seeking a solution to provide the income I will be exchanging for time away to focus on my work.  

I hope that you might be willing to contribute financially, emotionally, spiritually to an ultimately reciprocal effort :) But I would not ask you for money until I extend an offer to you, first---check out the perks on the right side of this page!


www.brigidobrien.us

story:
Our Background

D'Oro da Sacramenti Regionale is regional collaborative community art project by the Sacramento Region burner community.  The Burning Man organization selected our project to be placed in the piazza surrounding the man pavilion in Black Rock City 2016 because it supports this year's theme Da Vinci's Workshop and brings regionally created interactive art to the playa.  However we need your financial support to finish construction of the project, transportation to the playa, and the set-up and support of the project while on the playa.  To understand more about the Burning Man theme for this year visit  http://journal.burningman.org/2015/10/burning-man-arts/brc-art/burning-man-2016-da-vincis-workshop/

The following is how the project was described when we applied for the art project consideration.

We would like to invite you to our Weapons Guild.   Common folk, tradesmen, Merchants, Noble Men,  all are welcome.  As you enter the busy, rustic guild space of D'Oro da Sacramenti you will walk through a logge facade. Upon entering you will be greeted by our Guild Members who craft custom weapons of Dragonswood and Valyrian wood.

Guild Tradesmen and smiths will instruct you on precision and accuracy then you are off to try your hand in the Weapons Practice Gallery!   Employ your new learned skills to fire a projectile crafted by other wayward burners from the highest quality of reconstructed Stuffed Animals parts.

Skills of precision and accuracy will be needed to hit the targets as you take aim with one of our Throne da Cataslings!  Take aim in our practice gallery.

Our Guild Emblem!

Designed by a community artisan, Deborah Coughlin, the D'Oro Da Sacramenti Regionale guild emblem will be on display outside our guild in the piazza around the man pavilion in Black Rock City.  The hand designed emblem incorporates a golden bear representative of California's state flag and armed with a Da Vinci crossbow representing our weaponry guild project featuring Da Vinci themed weaponry and shooting gallery.   The emblem was transferred into a logo and available on our stickers, pendants, t-shirts and hoodies through this campaign.

Here is depiction of the logoed t-shirt.

Our best perk!

Our limited edition D'oro da Sacramenti Regionale pendant is two sided laser cut in wood or acrylic.  The official D'Oro Guild Emblem is etched on one side and Da Vinci's Vitruvian Man on a rotating gear on the other side.  The wood version has a purple reflective background behind the Vitruvian Man.  The acrylic version has a mirrored finish behind the emblem, and the Viturvian Man etched into black acrylic appears when playa dust is applied.   Here is a look at the wood version.


 

We appreciate any level of support you can provide this project.  Thank you for your consideration.

story:
WHO IS MAKING THIS HAPPEN?

The Temple of Unitea crew is a seasoned team of 28+ long-time builders, burners, camp leads, project artists, engineers and imagineers.  We have several other Burning Man projects under our belts, including the Souk during Carvansarary, Wooden Nickle Carnival, DickyBox, Portal 11, and others I am forgetting.  We have done Bubble tea at Burning Man for 10 yrs and have thrown several steampunk high teas in a 37ft covered dome.  We know how to do tea and we know how to build for the desert and how to not piss off DPW.

We are inviting Tea experts from all over the world to come and teach classes and perform ceremonies.  We wanted to make it easier for people from around the world to parTeacipate by sharing their tea ceremonies with the communiTea.

WHY?

Cause we wanted to create a space for Tea Artists to perform.  A place where people from all over the world could come a share a secular ritual that both calms and stimulates conversation.  We wanted to gather people from all over the playa to enjoy this space and enjoy the adventure of taking our Tea on the road.

The Budget

We have the budget for this year and we have the budget for 2017 on a google spreadsheet! As you can see we had to scale it back.  If you help us with the funding now you will allow us to NOT burn out and stretch our budgets too far so we can continue to strive toward the SUPER BIG goal for next year.   Otherwise, we can still do it, it will just be pretty tough and we won't be able to afford as much tea or biscuits (and I know you want biscuits).

The Perks

So we have some awesome perks!

Unitea Stickers - $10

Support us just a little - you'll be tea-rific to us forever.  They are nice vinyl ones of our sepia and black logo. 

Tea Lip balm + 2 Matcha Moisturizing Bars - $35

Multi-purpose moisturizing bar made with beeswax, shea, butter, cocoa butter, essential oils, and matcha green tea - the ultimate cure for playa foot!

Unitea T-Shirt + Sticker - $45

Tea Cup Sets - $65

Ceramic cups burned with the symbol of the Temple of Unitea Made just for us by our Mistress of TeaCups!

Wet and White Partea VIP - $25

Come join us for a day of waterslide fun, DJs, and drinks (July 30th) if you are in Austin, Texas!

Wet and White Fundraiser Party on Facebook

The Impact

At The Temple of Unitea we will make Tea for all in a sacred space that provides a peaceful respite from the chaos of Burning Man. Unitea is not just about serving drinks; it is about full parTea-cipation and growing a communitea of Tea drinkers. Take Tea, Make Tea, and ParTeacipate in the art that surrounds you.

Risks & Challenges

While it's true we've had to scale back (for THIS year!) because our kickstarter didn't make it, we're still determined to bring super tea service to Burning Man for 2016. Community! Tea Classes! Biscuits! Conversation! Roaming tea service! But YOUR contributions will let us make it so much nicer: more tea! better biscuits! Tiny Sandwiches! Check out our grand plans, and join us to really rock it in 2017!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please Share on all forms of social media.  Get your friends to share as well.  Also consider just giving a few dollars for a sticker.  We will be doing a much much larger tea temple next year (we are working on it now - check out the website).  And getting stickers will get you on our list!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Who we are?

  • We are final year TV production students 
  • We want people to know more about the Jordan culture and traditions
  • Our aim is to observe the life of Bedouins who live with no access to the technology in the middle of the desert 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need 1,500 GBP to cover the expenses for our final year project (this includes flight tickets, accommodation, transportation, filming permissions)
  • We want to put all our creative input and time and to make a documentary that will be interesting for you! We want to educate our audience, inspire them about Jordan culture and also explore the challenged Bedouins face as a result of the tourism.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • It would be really helpful if you can share this campaign with your connections, friends and family.  We want to thank you for your time and cooperation!
